original: Ṛgveda
analyzed: ṛgveda
translated: Ṛg Veda

original: abodhy agniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum ivāyatīm uṣāsam /
analyzed: abodhi agniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum iva āyatīm uṣāsam
translated: Agni has been kindled by the fuel of the people, like the approaching dawn, like a cow.

original: yahvā iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam accha //
analyzed: yahvāḥ iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam accha
translated: Like young ones stretching out the old, the bright flames spread out towards the vault.

original: abodhi hotā yajathāya devān ūrdhvo agniḥ sumanāḥ prātar asthāt /
analyzed: abodhi hotā yajathāya devān ūrdhvaḥ agniḥ sumanāḥ prātar asthāt
translated: The priest has awakened to worship the gods. Agni, upright and well-disposed, has risen in the morning.

original: samiddhasya ruśad adarśi pājo mahān devas tamaso nir amoci //
analyzed: samiddhasya ruśat adarśi pājaḥ mahān devaḥ tamasaḥ niḥ amoci
translated: The shining light of the kindled one has been seen. The great god has been released from the darkness.

original: yad īṃ gaṇasya raśanām ajīgaḥ śucir aṅkte śucibhir gobhir agniḥ /
analyzed: yat īm gaṇasya raśanām ajīgaḥ śuciḥ aṅkte śucibhiḥ gobhiḥ agniḥ
translated: When you have seized the reins of the group, Agni is anointed with the pure ones, with the pure cows.

original: ād dakṣiṇā yujyate vājayanty uttānām ūrdhvo adhayaj juhūbhiḥ //
analyzed: āt dakṣiṇā yujyate vājayantī uttānām ūrdhvaḥ adhayat juhūbhiḥ
translated: The sacrificial fee is yoked, striving for strength. The upright one has offered with the ladles to the outstretched one.

original: agnim acchā devayatām manāṃsi cakṣūṃṣīva sūrye saṃ caranti /
analyzed: agnim acchā devayatām manāṃsi cakṣūṃṣi iva sūrye sam caranti
translated: The minds of those who worship the gods turn to Agni, as the eyes to the sun.

original: yad īṃ suvāte uṣasā virūpe śveto vājī jāyate agre ahnām //🔽janiṣṭa hi jenyo agre ahnāṃ hito hiteṣv aruṣo vaneṣu /
analyzed: yat īm suvāte uṣasā virūpe śvetaḥ vājī jāyate agre ahnām  janiṣṭa hi jenyaḥ agre ahnām hitaḥ hiteṣu aruṣaḥ vaneṣu
translated: When the two dissimilar dawns bring you forth, the white steed is born at the beginning of the days.🔽The worthy one has indeed been born at the beginning of the days. The red one is placed among the placed ones in the woods.

original: damedame sapta ratnā dadhāno 'gnir hotā ni ṣasādā yajīyān //
analyzed: damedame sapta ratnā dadhānaḥ gniḥ hotā ni sasāda ā yajīyān
translated: Placing the seven treasures in every house, Agni, the priest, has sat down as the best sacrificer.

original: agnir hotā ny asīdad yajīyān upasthe mātuḥ surabhā u loke /
analyzed: agniḥ hotā ni asīdat yajīyān upasthe mātuḥ surabhau u loke
translated: Agni, the priest, has sat down as the best sacrificer in the lap of his mother, in the fragrant world.

original: yuvā kaviḥ puruniṣṭha ṛtāvā dhartā kṛṣṭīnām uta madhya iddhaḥ //
analyzed: yuvā kaviḥ puru niṣṭhaḥ ṛtāvā dhartā kṛṣṭīnām uta madhye iddhaḥ
translated: The young, the wise, the most bountiful, the true, the supporter of the people, kindled in the midst.

original: pra ṇu tyaṃ vipram adhvareṣu sādhum agniṃ hotāram īḷate namobhiḥ /
analyzed: pra nu tyam vipram adhvareṣu sādhum agnim hotāram īḍate namobhiḥ
translated: They invoke the sage, the good one, at sacrifices, Agni, the Hotar, with salutations.

original: ā yas tatāna rodasī ṛtena nityam mṛjanti vājinaṃ ghṛtena //
analyzed: ā yaḥ tatāna rodasī ṛtena nityam mṛjanti vājinam ghṛtena
translated: He who has extended the two worlds with truth, they always cleanse the strong one with ghee.

original: mārjālyo mṛjyate sve damūnāḥ kavipraśasto atithiḥ śivo naḥ /
analyzed: mārjālyaḥ mṛjyate sve damūnāḥ kavi praśastaḥ atithiḥ śivaḥ naḥ
translated: The one to be cleansed is cleansed in his own abode, praised by the sages, a welcome guest for us.

original: sahasraśṛṅgo vṛṣabhas tadojā viśvāṃ agne sahasā prāsy anyān //
analyzed: sahasra śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tad ojāḥ viśvān agne sahasā prāsi anyān
translated: The bull with a thousand horns, of that strength, O Agni, with your might, surpass all others.

original: pra sadyo agne aty eṣy anyān āvir yasmai cārutamo babhūtha /
analyzed: pra sadyas agne ati eṣi anyān āvis yasmai cārutamaḥ babhūtha
translated: O Agni, you will quickly surpass others, to whom you have become the most beautiful.

original: īḷenyo vapuṣyo vibhāvā priyo viśām atithir mānuṣīṇām //
analyzed: īḍenyaḥ vapuṣyaḥ vibhāvā priyaḥ viśām atithiḥ mānuṣīṇām
translated: To be desired, beautiful, shining, dear to the people, a guest of human beings.

original: tubhyam bharanti kṣitayo yaviṣṭha balim agne antita ota dūrāt /
analyzed: tubhyam bharanti kṣitayaḥ yaviṣṭha balim agne antitas ā uta dūrāt
translated: To you, O youngest, the people bring tribute, O Agni, from near and far.

original: ā bhandiṣṭhasya sumatiṃ cikiddhi bṛhat te agne mahi śarma bhadram //
analyzed: ā bhandiṣṭhasya sumatim cikiddhi bṛhat te agne mahi śarma bhadram
translated: Seek the favor of the most radiant one. Your protection, O Agni, is great and good.

original: ādya ratham bhānumo bhānumantam agne tiṣṭha yajatebhiḥ samantam /
analyzed: ā adya ratham bhānumas bhānumantam agne tiṣṭha yajatebhiḥ samantam
translated: O Agni, shining, sit in your shining chariot, surrounded by the sacrificers.

original: vidvān pathīnām urv antarikṣam eha devān haviradyāya vakṣi //
analyzed: vidvān pathīnām uru antarikṣam ā iha devān haviḥ adyāya vakṣi
translated: Knowing the paths, the vast expanse of the atmosphere, bring the gods here to eat the oblation.

original: avocāma kavaye medhyāya vaco vandāru vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe /
analyzed: avocāma kavaye medhyāya vacaḥ vandāru vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe
translated: We have spoken to the wise one, to the pure one, the word, the praise to the bull, to the strong one.

original: gaviṣṭhiro namasā stomam agnau divīva rukmam uruvyañcam aśret //
analyzed: gaviṣṭhiraḥ namasā stomam agnau divi iva rukmam uruvyañcam aśret
translated: Gaviṣṭhira has set in the fire, with reverence, the hymn, like a bright ornament in the sky, far-reaching.

original: kumāram mātā yuvatiḥ samubdhaṃ guhā bibharti na dadāti pitre /
analyzed: kumāram mātā yuvatiḥ samubdham guhā bibharti na dadāti pitre
translated: The young boy, embraced by his youthful mother, she bears in secret, does not give to his father.

original: anīkam asya na minaj janāsaḥ puraḥ paśyanti nihitam aratau //
analyzed: anīkam asya na minat janāsaḥ puras paśyanti nihitam aratau
translated: The people do not diminish his appearance, they see his form placed in the womb.

original: kam etaṃ tvaṃ yuvate kumāram peṣī bibharṣi mahiṣī jajāna /
analyzed: kam etam tvam yuvate kumāram peṣī bibharṣi mahiṣī jajāna
translated: Whom do you serve, O young boy? Whom do you carry, the one born of the great cow?

original: pūrvīr hi garbhaḥ śarado vavardhāpaśyaṃ jātaṃ yad asūta mātā //
analyzed: pūrvīḥ hi garbhaḥ śaradaḥ vavardha apaśyam jātam yat asūta mātā
translated: For the embryo has grown for many autumns. I see the one born, whom his mother has given birth to.

original: hiraṇyadantaṃ śucivarṇam ārāt kṣetrād apaśyam āyudhā mimānam /
analyzed: hiraṇya dantam śuci varṇam ārāt kṣetrāt apaśyam āyudhā mimānam
translated: I have seen from afar the golden-toothed one, of pure color, measuring the weapons in the field.

original: dadāno asmā amṛtaṃ vipṛkvat kim mām anindrāḥ kṛṇavann anukthāḥ //
analyzed: dadānaḥ asmai amṛtam vipṛkvat kim mām an indrāḥ kṛṇavan an ukthāḥ
translated: Giving him the nectar, I am confused. What have the powerless ones, the chantless ones, done to me?

original: kṣetrād apaśyaṃ sanutaś carantaṃ sumad yūthaṃ na puru śobhamānam /
analyzed: kṣetrāt apaśyam sanutas carantam sumat yūtham na puru śobhamānam
translated: I have seen from the field the one moving in the distance, the beautiful herd, shining in many ways.

original: na tā agṛbhrann ajaniṣṭa hi ṣaḥ paliknīr id yuvatayo bhavanti //
analyzed: na tāḥ agṛbhran ajaniṣṭa hi saḥ paliknīḥ id yuvatayaḥ bhavanti
translated: They did not grasp him. He was born. The young girls become like those with gray hair.

original: ke me maryakaṃ vi yavanta gobhir na yeṣāṃ gopā araṇaś cid āsa /
analyzed: ke me maryakam vi yavanta gobhiḥ na yeṣām gopāḥ araṇaḥ cit āsa
translated: Who among them will spread out my pasture with cattle, whose cowherds are not even in the distance?

original: ya īṃ jagṛbhur ava te sṛjantv ājāti paśva upa naś cikitvān //
analyzed: ye īm jagṛbhuḥ ava te sṛjantu ājāti paśve upa naḥ cikitvān
translated: Let those who have seized him set him free for you, for the sake of cattle, O wise one.

original: vasāṃ rājānaṃ vasatiṃ janānām arātayo ni dadhur martyeṣu /
analyzed: vasām rājānam vasatim janānām arātayaḥ ni dadhuḥ martyeṣu
translated: The evil spirits have placed Vasānā, the king, the dweller among men, among mortals.

original: brahmāṇy atrer ava taṃ sṛjantu ninditāro nindyāso bhavantu //
analyzed: brahmāṇi atreḥ ava tam sṛjantu ninditāraḥ nindyāsaḥ bhavantu
translated: Let the prayers of Atri set him free from there. Let those who blame be blamed, let them be blamed.

original: śunaś cic chepaṃ niditaṃ sahasrād yūpād amuñco aśamiṣṭa hi ṣaḥ /
analyzed: śunaḥ cit śepam niditam sahasrāt yūpāt amuñcaḥ aśamiṣṭa hi saḥ
translated: From the stake, from the thousand, you have freed the dog's penis that was stuck. For he has sacrificed.

original: evāsmad agne vi mumugdhi pāśān hotaś cikitva iha tū niṣadya //
analyzed: eva asmat agne vi mumugdhi pāśān hotar cikitvaḥ iha tu niṣadya
translated: Even so, O Agni, release us from the bonds. O Hotar, having sat down here, O wise one.

original: hṛṇīyamāno apa hi mad aiyeḥ pra me devānāṃ vratapā uvāca /
analyzed: hṛṇīyamānaḥ apa hi mat aiyeḥ pra me devānām vrata pāḥ uvāca
translated: While being blamed, you have gone away from me. The guardian of the gods' vow has told me.

original: indro vidvāṃ anu hi tvā cacakṣa tenāham agne anuśiṣṭa āgām //
analyzed: indraḥ vidvān anu hi tvā cacakṣa tena aham agne anuśiṣṭaḥ āgām
translated: Indra, the wise one, has indeed seen you. Instructed by him, O Agni, I have come.

original: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāty agnir āvir viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā /🔽prādevīr māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅge rakṣase vinikṣe //
analyzed: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāti agniḥ āvis viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā  pra adevīḥ māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅge rakṣase vinikṣe
translated: Agni shines with great light. He makes all things manifest through his greatness.🔽He endures the godless magic arts, the evil ones. He sharpens his horns to strike down the Raksas.

original: uta svānāso divi ṣantv agnes tigmāyudhā rakṣase hantavā u /
analyzed: uta svānāsaḥ divi ṣantu agneḥ tigma āyudhāḥ rakṣase hantavai u
translated: Even in the heaven may the roaring ones of Agni, with sharp weapons, desire to slay the Raksas.

original: made cid asya pra rujanti bhāmā na varante paribādho adevīḥ //
analyzed: made cit asya pra rujanti bhāmāḥ na varante paribādhaḥ adevīḥ
translated: Even in his intoxication, his flames blaze forth. The godless hindrances do not obstruct him.

original: etaṃ te stomaṃ tuvijāta vipro rathaṃ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣam /
analyzed: etam te stomam tuvi jāta vipraḥ ratham na dhīraḥ su apāḥ atakṣam
translated: This hymn, O thou of mighty birth, the sage hath fashioned for thee, as a skilful charioteer his car.

original: yadīd agne prati tvaṃ deva haryāḥ svarvatīr apa enā jayema //
analyzed: yadi id agne prati tvam deva haryāḥ svarvatīḥ apaḥ enāḥ jayema
translated: If thou, O Agni, O God, wilt accept it, may we win by it the waters that lead to heaven.

original: tuvigrīvo vṛṣabho vāvṛdhāno 'śatrv aryaḥ sam ajāti vedaḥ /
analyzed: tuvi grīvaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ śatru aryaḥ sam ajāti vedaḥ
translated: The mighty-necked bull hath grown in strength, the foe of foes, the friend of the people, the knower of the people.

original: itīmam agnim amṛtā avocan barhiṣmate manave śarma yaṃsad dhaviṣmate manave śarma yaṃsat //
analyzed: iti imam agnim amṛtāḥ avocan barhiṣmate manave śarma yaṃsat haviṣmate manave śarma yaṃsat
translated: Thus have the immortal ones spoken to this Agni: May he grant protection to the man who strews the grass, may he grant protection to the man who offers oblations.

original: tvam agne varuṇo jāyase yat tvam mitro bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne varuṇaḥ jāyase yat tvam mitraḥ bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, art born as Varuna, thou art Mitra when thou art kindled.

original: tve viśve sahasas putra devās tvam indro dāśuṣe martyāya //
analyzed: tve viśve sahasas putra devāḥ tvam indraḥ dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: In thee, O son of strength, all the gods, thou art Indra to the mortal who offers.

original: tvam aryamā bhavasi yat kanīnāṃ nāma svadhāvan guhyam bibharṣi /
analyzed: tvam aryamā bhavasi yat kanīnām nāma svadhāvan guhyam bibharṣi
translated: Thou art Aryaman when thou art the youngest, thou bearest the secret name, O self-moving one.

original: añjanti mitraṃ sudhitaṃ na gobhir yad dampatī samanasā kṛṇoṣi //
analyzed: añjanti mitram sudhitam na gobhiḥ yat dampatī samanasā kṛṇoṣi
translated: They anoint Mitra, the well-disposed one, with the cows, when thou, with a willing mind, makest the two spouses.

original: tava śriye maruto marjayanta rudra yat te janima cāru citram /
analyzed: tava śriye marutaḥ marjayanta rudra yat te janima cāru citram
translated: For thy glory, O Maruts, they purify thee, O Rudra, what is thy beautiful and wonderful birth.

original: padaṃ yad viṣṇor upamaṃ nidhāyi tena pāsi guhyaṃ nāma gonām //
analyzed: padam yat viṣṇoḥ upamam nidhāyi tena pāsi guhyam nāma gonām
translated: The foot of Vishnu, which is like a measure, is laid down, by that thou guardest the secret name of the cows.

original: tava śriyā sudṛśo deva devāḥ purū dadhānā amṛtaṃ sapanta /
analyzed: tava śriyā sudṛśaḥ deva devāḥ purū dadhānāḥ amṛtam sapanta
translated: O God, the many Gods, O fair-eyed one, with thy glory, have obtained immortality.

original: hotāram agnim manuṣo ni ṣedur daśasyanta uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ //
analyzed: hotāram agnim manuṣaḥ ni ṣeduḥ daśasyantaḥ uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ
translated: Men have seated Agni as Hotar, the wise have honoured him, the messenger of life.

original: na tvad dhotā pūrvo agne yajīyān na kāvyaiḥ paro asti svadhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na tvat hotā pūrvaḥ agne yajīyān na kāvyaiḥ paraḥ asti svadhāvas
translated: No Hotar is better than thou, O Agni, no priest is greater by his own power.

original: viśaś ca yasyā atithir bhavāsi sa yajñena vanavad deva martān //
analyzed: viśaḥ ca yasyāḥ atithiḥ bhavāsi sa yajñena vanavat deva martān
translated: In whose house thou art a guest, O God, he shall be honoured by the people with sacrifice, and shall surpass men.

original: vayam agne vanuyāma tvotā vasūyavo haviṣā budhyamānāḥ /
analyzed: vayam agne vanuyāma tvotāḥ vasūyavaḥ haviṣā budhyamānāḥ
translated: We, O Agni, with thee to aid, seeking wealth, shall awake with oblation.

original: vayaṃ samarye vidatheṣv ahnāṃ vayaṃ rāyā sahasas putra martān //🔽yo na āgo abhy eno bharāty adhīd agham aghaśaṃse dadhāta /
analyzed: vayam samarye vidatheṣu ahnām vayam rāyā sahasas putra martān  yaḥ naḥ āgaḥ abhī enaḥ bharāti adhi id agham agha śaṃse dadhāta
translated: We in the battle, in the assemblies of the day, we with wealth, O Son of Strength, shall surpass men.🔽He who brings us as a guest, O Agni, who bears us as a friend, to him give wealth.

original: jahī cikitvo abhiśastim etām agne yo no marcayati dvayena //
analyzed: jahi cikitvaḥ abhiśastim etām agne yaḥ naḥ marcayati dvayena
translated: To him who hates us give thou hatred, O wise one, O Agni, to him who injures us with guile.

original: tvām asyā vyuṣi deva pūrve dūtaṃ kṛṇvānā ayajanta havyaiḥ /
analyzed: tvām asyāḥ vyuṣi deva pūrve dūtam kṛṇvānāḥ ayajanta havyaiḥ
translated: Thee, O God, the ancient ones, making thee their messenger, worshipped with oblations in the morning.

original: saṃsthe yad agna īyase rayīṇāṃ devo martair vasubhir idhyamānaḥ //
analyzed: saṃsthe yat agne īyase rayīṇām devaḥ martaiḥ vasubhiḥ idhyamānaḥ
translated: When, O Agni, thou goest to the gathering of riches, thou art kindled by men, O God, with treasures.

original: ava spṛdhi pitaraṃ yodhi vidvān putro yas te sahasaḥ sūna ūhe /
analyzed: ava spṛdhi pitaram yodhi vidvān putraḥ yaḥ te sahasaḥ sūno ūhe
translated: Approach, O wise one, fight with the father, the son who shall carry thee, O Son of Strength.

original: kadā cikitvo abhi cakṣase no 'gne kadāṃ ṛtacid yātayāse //
analyzed: kadā cikitvaḥ abhi cakṣase naḥ gne ṛta cit yātayāse
translated: When wilt thou look upon us, O thou who knowest? O Agni, when wilt thou make the truthful prosper?

original: bhūri nāma vandamāno dadhāti pitā vaso yadi taj joṣayāse /🔽kuvid devasya sahasā cakānaḥ sumnam agnir vanate vāvṛdhānaḥ //
analyzed: bhūri nāma vandamānaḥ dadhāti pitā vaso yadi tat joṣayāse  kuvid devasya sahasā cakānaḥ sumnam agniḥ vanate vāvṛdhānaḥ
translated: The bountiful one, when praised, bestows abundant wealth, if thou, O Vasu, wilt accept it.🔽Rejoicing in the God's power, Agni, waxing great, wins bliss.

original: tvam aṅga jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭha viśvāny agne duritāti parṣi /
analyzed: tvam aṅga jaritāram yaviṣṭha viśvāni agne duritā ati parṣi
translated: Thou, O most youthful Agni, carriest over all evils him who lauds thee, O Angiras.

original: stenā adṛśran ripavo janāso 'jñātaketā vṛjinā abhūvan //
analyzed: stenāḥ adṛśran ripavaḥ janāsaḥ jñāta ketā vṛjināḥ abhūvan
translated: The thieves, the unknown-going foes, the people have been seen, the wicked.

original: ime yāmāsas tvadrig abhūvan vasave vā tad id āgo avāci /
analyzed: ime yāmāsaḥ tvadrik abhūvan vasave vā tat id āgaḥ avāci
translated: These have been thy worshippers, O thou of wondrous help: to Vasu have I spoken this.

original: nāhāyam agnir abhiśastaye no na rīṣate vāvṛdhānaḥ parā dāt //
analyzed: na aha ayam agniḥ abhiśastaye naḥ na rīṣate vāvṛdhānaḥ parā dāt
translated: This Agni is not to be despised, not to be injured, not to be overcome: he will give us wealth.

original: tvām agne vasupatiṃ vasūnām abhi pra mande adhvareṣu rājan /
analyzed: tvām agne vasu patim vasūnām abhi pra mande adhvareṣu rājan
translated: Thee, O Agni, the lord of treasures, I delight in sacrifices, O king, for the sake of treasures.

original: tvayā vājaṃ vājayanto jayemābhi ṣyāma pṛtsutīr martyānām //🔽havyavāḷ agnir ajaraḥ pitā no vibhur vibhāvā sudṛśīko asme /
analyzed: tvayā vājam vājayantaḥ jayema abhi syāma pṛtsutīḥ martyānām  havyavāṭ agniḥ ajaraḥ pitā naḥ vibhuḥ vibhāvā su dṛśīkaḥ asme
translated: Through thee, O thou who givest strength, may we gain strength, and win the battles of men.🔽Agni, the bearer of the oblation, the undecaying, our father, the all-pervading, the radiant, the very visible,

original: sugārhapatyāḥ sam iṣo didīhy asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi //
analyzed: su gārhapatyāḥ sam iṣaḥ didīhi asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi
translated: Bestow on us good household gods, and light up the sacrificial food: measure thou out glories to us.

original: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatim mānuṣīṇāṃ śucim pāvakaṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭham agnim /
analyzed: viśām kavim viśpatim mānuṣīṇām śucim pāvakam ghṛta pṛṣṭham agnim
translated: The sage of men, the lord of men, the pure, the purifying Agni, whose back is anointed with ghee,

original: ni hotāraṃ viśvavidaṃ dadhidhve sa deveṣu vanate vāryāṇi //
analyzed: ni hotāram viśva vidam dadhidhve sa deveṣu vanate vāryāṇi
translated: You have made him your priest, who knows all things; he wins for you boons among the gods.

original: juṣasvāgna iḷayā sajoṣā yatamāno raśmibhiḥ sūryasya /
analyzed: juṣasva agne iḷayā sajoṣāḥ yatamānaḥ raśmibhiḥ sūryasya
translated: Be pleased, O Agni, with the Iḷâ, in accord with the rays of the sun, striving (with the priests).

original: juṣasva naḥ samidhaṃ jātaveda ā ca devān haviradyāya vakṣi //
analyzed: juṣasva naḥ samidham jātavedaḥ ā ca devān haviḥ adyāya vakṣi
translated: Be pleased with our kindling-stick, O all-knowing one, and bring the gods to eat the oblation.

original: juṣṭo damūnā atithir duroṇa imaṃ no yajñam upa yāhi vidvān /
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ damūnāḥ atithiḥ duroṇe imam naḥ yajñam upa yāhi vidvān
translated: Honoured, the house-friend, the guest in the house, come thou, knowing, to this our sacrifice.

original: viśvā agne abhiyujo vihatyā śatrūyatām ā bharā bhojanāni //
analyzed: viśvāḥ agne abhiyujaḥ vihatya ā śatrūyatām ā bhara bhojanāni
translated: Having destroyed all hostilities, O Agni, bring hither the means of subsistence for those who hate us.

original: vadhena dasyum pra hi cātayasva vayaḥ kṛṇvānas tanve svāyai /
analyzed: vadhena dasyum pra hi cātayasva vayaḥ kṛṇvānaḥ tanve svāyai
translated: Drive away the Dasyu with thy weapon, bestowing life upon thy own body.

original: piparṣi yat sahasas putra devānt so agne pāhi nṛtama vāje asmān //
analyzed: piparṣi yat sahasas putra devān saḥ agne pāhi nṛtama vāje asmān
translated: When thou supportest the gods, O son of strength, then, O Agni, best of men, protect us in this contest.

original: vayaṃ te agna ukthair vidhema vayaṃ havyaiḥ pāvaka bhadraśoce /
analyzed: vayam te agne ukthaiḥ vidhema vayam havyaiḥ pāvaka bhadra śoce
translated: O Agni, we will worship thee with hymns, O purifier, with oblations, O thou of fair flame.

original: asme rayiṃ viśvavāraṃ sam invāsme viśvāni draviṇāni dhehi //
analyzed: asme rayim viśva vāram sam inva asme viśvāni draviṇāni dhehi
translated: Impel to us wealth that grants all desires; bestow upon us all kinds of riches.

original: asmākam agne adhvaraṃ juṣasva sahasaḥ sūno triṣadhastha havyam /
analyzed: asmākam agne adhvaram juṣasva sahasaḥ sūno triṣadhastha havyam
translated: O Agni, accept our sacrifice, O son of strength, the oblation, O thou who art in the three realms.

original: vayaṃ deveṣu sukṛtaḥ syāma śarmaṇā nas trivarūthena pāhi //
analyzed: vayam deveṣu su kṛtaḥ syāma śarmaṇā naḥ tri varūthena pāhi
translated: May we be among the gods, O Jātavedas, the performers of good deeds. Protect us with your threefold protection and your grace.

original: viśvāni no durgahā jātavedaḥ sindhuṃ na nāvā duritāti parṣi /
analyzed: viśvāni naḥ durgahā jātavedaḥ sindhum na nāvā duritā ati parṣi
translated: O Jātavedas, carry us over all our difficulties, as if crossing a river in a boat.

original: agne atrivan namasā gṛṇāno 'smākam bodhy avitā tanūnām //
analyzed: agne atri vat namasā gṛṇānaḥ smākam bodhi avitā tanūnām
translated: O Agni, like Atri, being praised with reverence, be our protector, O Agni, of our bodies.

original: yas tvā hṛdā kīriṇā manyamāno 'martyam martyo johavīmi /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā hṛdā kīriṇā manyamānaḥ martyam martyaḥ johavīmi
translated: The mortal who, thinking of you with his heart and mind, invokes you, the immortal one.

original: jātavedo yaśo asmāsu dhehi prajābhir agne amṛtatvam aśyām //
analyzed: jātavedaḥ yaśaḥ asmāsu dhehi prajābhiḥ agne amṛta tvam aśyām
translated: O Jātavedas, bestow fame upon us, O Agni, through our offspring may I attain immortality.

original: yasmai tvaṃ sukṛte jātaveda u lokam agne kṛṇavaḥ syonam /
analyzed: yasmai tvam su kṛte jātavedaḥ u lokam agne kṛṇavaḥ syonam
translated: O Jātavedas, to the one who has performed good deeds for you, O Agni, you make a peaceful abode.

original: aśvinaṃ sa putriṇaṃ vīravantaṃ gomantaṃ rayiṃ naśate svasti //
analyzed: aśvinam sa putriṇam vīravantam gomantam rayim naśate svasti
translated: He obtains wealth with horses, sons, heroes, and cattle, and prosperity.

original: susamiddhāya śociṣe ghṛtaṃ tīvraṃ juhotana /
analyzed: su samiddhāya śociṣe ghṛtam tīvram juhotana
translated: To the well-kindled one, to the radiant one, offer the fierce ghee.

original: agnaye jātavedase //
analyzed: agnaye jātavedase
translated: To Agni, the all-knower.

original: narāśaṃsaḥ suṣūdatīmaṃ yajñam adābhyaḥ /
analyzed: narāśaṃsaḥ suṣūdati imam yajñam adābhyaḥ
translated: The unerring Narāśaṁsa purifies this sacrifice.

original: kavir hi madhuhastyaḥ //
analyzed: kaviḥ hi madhu hastyaḥ
translated: For the sage has honey in his hand.

original: īḷito agna ā vahendraṃ citram iha priyam /
analyzed: īḍitaḥ agne ā vaha indram citram iha priyam
translated: O Agni, being invoked, bring Indra, the wonderful, dear one, here.

original: sukhai rathebhir ūtaye //
analyzed: sukhaiḥ rathebhiḥ ūtaye
translated: With pleasant chariots, for help.

original: ūrṇamradā vi prathasvābhy arkā anūṣata /
analyzed: ūrṇamradāḥ vi prathasva abhi arkāḥ anūṣata
translated: O Agni, the wool-clad one, spread out widely. The sacred songs have sung to you.

original: bhavā naḥ śubhra sātaye //
analyzed: bhavā naḥ śubhra sātaye
translated: Be you, O white one, for our success.

original: devīr dvāro vi śrayadhvaṃ suprāyaṇā na ūtaye /
analyzed: devīḥ dvāraḥ vi śrayadhvam su prāyaṇāḥ naḥ ūtaye
translated: O divine doors, open wide for us to pass through, well-opened, for help.

original: prapra yajñam pṛṇītana //
analyzed: pra pra yajñam pṛṇītana
translated: Spread out the sacrifice for us.

original: supratīke vayovṛdhā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā /
analyzed: su pratīke vayaḥ vṛdhā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā
translated: O doors with beautiful faces, increasing strength, young mothers of truth,

original: doṣām uṣāsam īmahe //
analyzed: doṣām uṣāsam īmahe
translated: We invoke the evening and the dawn.

original: vātasya patmann īḷitā daivyā hotārā manuṣaḥ /
analyzed: vātasya patman īḍitā daivyā hotārā manuṣaḥ
translated: On the path of the wind, invoked, the two divine priests, human,

original: imaṃ no yajñam ā gatam //
analyzed: imam naḥ yajñam ā gatam
translated: Come to this our sacrifice.

original: iḷā sarasvatī mahī tisro devīr mayobhuvaḥ /
analyzed: iḷā sarasvatī mahī tisraḥ devīḥ mayobhuvaḥ
translated: Iḷā, Sarasvatī, and Mahī, the three goddesses who bring bliss,

original: barhiḥ sīdantv asridhaḥ //
analyzed: barhiḥ sīdantu asridhaḥ
translated: Sit on the grass, uninjured.

original: śivas tvaṣṭar ihā gahi vibhuḥ poṣa uta tmanā /
analyzed: śivaḥ tvaṣṭar iha ā gahi vibhuḥ poṣaḥ uta tmanā
translated: O Tvaṣṭar, come hither with what is auspicious, with what is all-pervading, with nourishment from yourself,

original: yajñeyajñe na ud ava //
analyzed: yajñeyajñe naḥ ud ava
translated: In every sacrifice, rise up.

original: yatra vettha vanaspate devānāṃ guhyā nāmāni /
analyzed: yatra vettha vanaspate devānām guhyā nāmāni
translated: Where, O tree, you know the secret names of the gods,

original: tatra havyāni gāmaya //
analyzed: tatra havyāni gāmaya
translated: There lead our offerings.

original: svāhāgnaye varuṇāya svāhendrāya marudbhyaḥ /
analyzed: svāhā agnaye varuṇāya svāhā indrāya marudbhyaḥ
translated: Svāhā to Agni, to Varuṇa, svāhā to Indra, to the Maruts,

original: svāhā devebhyo haviḥ //
analyzed: svāhā devebhyaḥ haviḥ
translated: Svāhā to the gods, the oblation.

original: agniṃ tam manye yo vasur astaṃ yaṃ yanti dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: agnim tam manye yaḥ vasuḥ astam yam yanti dhenavaḥ
translated: I think of that Agni who is the good, to whom the cows go,

original: astam arvanta āśavo 'staṃ nityāso vājina iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: astam arvantaḥ āśavaḥ stam nityāsaḥ vājinaḥ iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: To whom the swift horses go, to whom the strong ones always go, bring food to the praisers.

original: so agnir yo vasur gṛṇe saṃ yam āyanti dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ agniḥ yaḥ vasuḥ gṛṇe sam yam āyanti dhenavaḥ
translated: That Agni whom we praise as the good, to whom the cows come,

original: sam arvanto raghudruvaḥ saṃ sujātāsaḥ sūraya iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: sam arvantaḥ raghudruvaḥ sam su jātāsaḥ sūrayaḥ iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: The swift-moving, well-born heroes have come together. Bring food to the praisers.

original: agnir hi vājinaṃ viśe dadāti viśvacarṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ hi vājinam viśe dadāti viśvacarṣaṇiḥ
translated: For Agni, the all-conquering one, gives the strong one to the people.

original: agnī rāye svābhuvaṃ sa prīto yāti vāryam iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: agniḥ rāye su ābhuvam sa prītaḥ yāti vāryam iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: Agni, the self-existent one, goes happily to the good. Bring food to the praisers.

original: ā te agna idhīmahi dyumantaṃ devājaram /
analyzed: ā te agne idhīmahi dyumantam deva ajaram
translated: O Agni, we kindle thee, the glorious, undecaying god,

original: yad dha syā te panīyasī samid dīdayati dyavīṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: yat ha syā te panīyasī samidh dīdayati dyavi iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: When that most excellent fuel of thine shines forth. Bring food to the praisers.

original: ā te agna ṛcā haviḥ śukrasya śociṣas pate /
analyzed: ā te agne ṛcā haviḥ śukrasya śociṣaḥ pate
translated: To thee, O Agni, with the Rc, the oblation, O lord of the bright flame,

original: suścandra dasma viśpate havyavāṭ tubhyaṃ hūyata iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: su ścandra dasma viśpate havyavāṭ tubhyam hūyate iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: O well-shining, wondrous lord of the people, the bearer of oblations is offered to thee. Bring food to the praisers.

original: pro tye agnayo 'gniṣu viśvam puṣyanti vāryam /
analyzed: pra u tye agnayaḥ gniṣu viśvam puṣyanti vāryam
translated: Those fires, O Agni, in the fires, cherish all that is good.

original: te hinvire ta invire ta iṣaṇyanty ānuṣag iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: te hinvire te invire te iṣaṇyanti ānuṣak iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: They impel it, they send it forth, they hasten it in due order. Bring food to the praisers.

original: tava tye agne arcayo mahi vrādhanta vājinaḥ /
analyzed: tava tye agne arcayaḥ mahi vrādhanta vājinaḥ
translated: Those strong flames of thine, O Agni, increase greatly.

original: ye patvabhiḥ śaphānāṃ vrajā bhuranta gonām iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: ye patvabhiḥ śaphānām vrajāḥ bhuranta gonām iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: Those which, with the paths of the hooves, hasten to the stalls of the cattle. Bring food to the praisers.

original: navā no agna ā bhara stotṛbhyaḥ sukṣitīr iṣaḥ /
analyzed: navāḥ naḥ agne ā bhara stotṛbhyaḥ su kṣitīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: O Agni, bring to us the singers good and wide food,

original: te syāma ya ānṛcus tvādūtāso damedama iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: te syāma ye ānṛcuḥ tvādūtāsaḥ damedame iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: May we be they, O thou whose messengers we are in this house. Bring food to the praisers.

original: ubhe suścandra sarpiṣo darvī śrīṇīṣa āsani /
analyzed: ubhe su ścandra sarpiṣaḥ darvī śrīṇīṣe āsani
translated: O thou of wondrous light, fill both thy ladles with ghee in the house.

original: uto na ut pupūryā uktheṣu śavasas pata iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: uta u naḥ ud pupūryāḥ uktheṣu śavasaḥ pate iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: And do thou, O lord of strength, fill us with food in our praises. Bring food to the praisers.

original: evāṃ agnim ajuryamur gīrbhir yajñebhir ānuṣak /
analyzed: eva ām agnim gīrbhiḥ yajñebhiḥ ānuṣak
translated: Thus, O Agni, the imperishable, with hymns and sacrifices in due order,

original: dadhad asme suvīryam uta tyad āśvaśvyam iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara //🔽sakhāyaḥ saṃ vaḥ samyañcam iṣaṃ stomaṃ cāgnaye /
analyzed: dadhat asme su vīryam uta tyad āśu aśvyam iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara  sakhāyaḥ sam vaḥ samyañcam iṣam stomam ca agnaye
translated: Granting us good strength and that which is most excellent in horses. Bring food to the praisers.🔽O friends, unite your food and praise for Agni,

original: varṣiṣṭhāya kṣitīnām ūrjo naptre sahasvate //🔽kutrā cid yasya samṛtau raṇvā naro nṛṣadane /🔽arhantaś cid yam indhate saṃjanayanti jantavaḥ //
analyzed: varṣiṣṭhāya kṣitīnām ūrjaḥ naptre sahasvate  kutra cit yasya samṛtau raṇvāḥ naraḥ nṛṣadane  arhantaḥ cit yam indhate saṃjanayanti jantavaḥ
translated: For the most lofty lord of the people, the grandson of strength, the mighty one.🔽Wherever his delightful company is, among men in the assembly of men,🔽Even those worthy ones kindle him, the living beings generate him.

original: saṃ yad iṣo vanāmahe saṃ havyā mānuṣāṇām /
analyzed: sam yat iṣaḥ vanāmahe sam havyā mānuṣāṇām
translated: When we seek to win food and the offerings of men,

original: uta dyumnasya śavasa ṛtasya raśmim ā dade //
analyzed: uta dyumnasya śavasaḥ ṛtasya raśmim ā dade
translated: And the light of glory, the ray of truth, I have obtained.

original: sa smā kṛṇoti ketum ā naktaṃ cid dūra ā sate /🔽pāvako yad vanaspatīn pra smā mināty ajaraḥ //
analyzed: sa smā kṛṇoti ketum ā naktam cit dūre ā sate  pāvakaḥ yat vanaspatīn pra smā mināti ajaraḥ
translated: He makes a sign even from afar in the night to the people,🔽When the pure one, the undecaying one, passes over the trees.

original: ava sma yasya veṣaṇe svedam pathiṣu juhvati /
analyzed: ava sma yasya veṣaṇe svedam pathiṣu juhvati
translated: On the path of him whose searchers offer sweat on the paths,

original: abhīm aha svajenyam bhūmā pṛṣṭheva ruruhuḥ //🔽yam martyaḥ puruspṛhaṃ vidad viśvasya dhāyase /
analyzed: abhi īm aha sva jenyam bhūmā pṛṣṭhā iva ruruhuḥ  yam martyaḥ puruspṛham vidat viśvasya dhāyase
translated: They have mounted on the back of the earth, as if on a wide-spreading couch.🔽The mortal who knows him, the most desired of all, for the support of the universe,

original: pra svādanam pitūnām astatātiṃ cid āyave //
analyzed: pra svādanam pitūnām astatātim cit āyave
translated: The enjoyment of the fathers, even for the one who has done wrong to Āyus.

original: sa hi ṣmā dhanvākṣitaṃ dātā na dāty ā paśuḥ /
analyzed: sa hi sma dhanva akṣitam dātā na dāti ā paśuḥ
translated: For he, indeed, is the one who gives the wealth of the far-sighted one, the giver who gives cattle.

original: hiriśmaśruḥ śucidann ṛbhur anibhṛṣṭataviṣiḥ //🔽śuciḥ ṣma yasmā atrivat pra svadhitīva rīyate /
analyzed: hiri śmaśruḥ śucidan ṛbhuḥ a nibhṛṣṭa taviṣiḥ  śuciḥ ṣma yasmai atri vat pra svadhitī iva rīyate
translated: With a beard of splendor, white teeth, Ṛbhu, with irresistible strength.🔽Pure is he whom they purify like Atri, who is carried away like a sharp axe.

original: suṣūr asūta mātā krāṇā yad ānaśe bhagam //
analyzed: suṣūḥ asūta mātā krāṇā yat ānaśe bhagam
translated: The mother, the well-disposed one, has given birth, when she has obtained the good fortune.

original: ā yas te sarpirāsute 'gne śam asti dhāyase /
analyzed: ā yaḥ te sarpiḥ āsute gne śam asti dhāyase
translated: For you, O Agni, who are devoted to the oblation, there is peace in the support.

original: aiṣu dyumnam uta śrava ā cittam martyeṣu dhāḥ //
analyzed: ā eṣu dyumnam uta śravaḥ ā cittam martyeṣu dhāḥ
translated: Place splendor and fame in these (people), and place thought in mortals.

original: iti cin manyum adhrijas tvādātam ā paśuṃ dade /🔽ād agne apṛṇato 'triḥ sāsahyād dasyūn iṣaḥ sāsahyān nṝn //
analyzed: iti cit manyum adhrijaḥ tvādātam ā paśum dade  āt agne apṛṇataḥ tris sāsahyāt dasyūn iṣaḥ sāsahyāt nṝn
translated: Thus, O Adhrigu, you have taken away the anger, and you have given back the cattle.🔽O Agni, Atri has filled you here, to overcome the Dasyus with food, to overcome men.

original: tvām agna ṛtāyavaḥ sam īdhire pratnam pratnāsa ūtaye sahaskṛta /
analyzed: tvām agne ṛtāyavaḥ sam īdhire pratnam pratnāsaḥ ūtaye sahaskṛta
translated: You, O Agni, the followers of the truth, have kindled the ancient one for help, the ancient one, the performer of a hundred deeds.

original: puruścandraṃ yajataṃ viśvadhāyasaṃ damūnasaṃ gṛhapatiṃ vareṇyam //
analyzed: puru ścandram yajatam viśva dhāyasam damūnasam gṛhapatim vareṇyam
translated: The one with many lights, the worshipper, the supporter of all, the lord of the house, the desirable one.

original: tvām agne atithim pūrvyaṃ viśaḥ śociṣkeśaṃ gṛhapatiṃ ni ṣedire /
analyzed: tvām agne atithim pūrvyam viśaḥ śociṣkeśam gṛhapatim ni sedire
translated: O Agni, the people have seated thee, O guest of old, with hair of flame, as lord of the house,

original: bṛhatketum pururūpaṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ suśarmāṇaṃ svavasaṃ jaradviṣam //
analyzed: bṛhat ketum puru rūpam dhana spṛtam su śarmāṇam su avasam jaradviṣam
translated: The great ensign, of many forms, the winner of wealth, of good protection, the self-ruler, the conqueror of foes.

original: tvām agne mānuṣīr īḷate viśo hotrāvidaṃ viviciṃ ratnadhātamam /
analyzed: tvām agne mānuṣīḥ īḍate viśaḥ hotrā vidam vivicim ratna dhātamam
translated: O Agni, the human tribes, the knowers of the sacrifice, the discerning, the finders of riches,

original: guhā santaṃ subhaga viśvadarśataṃ tuviṣvaṇasaṃ suyajaṃ ghṛtaśriyam //
analyzed: guhā santam subhaga viśva darśatam tuviṣvaṇasam suyajam ghṛta śriyam
translated: Thee, O prosperous one, who art in the cave, visible to all, of mighty roar, well-worshipped, with glory of ghee, seek with our songs.

original: tvām agne dharṇasiṃ viśvadhā vayaṃ gīrbhir gṛṇanto namasopa sedima /
analyzed: tvām agne dharṇasim viśvadhā vayam gīrbhiḥ gṛṇantaḥ namasā upa sedima
translated: O Agni, we, with our songs, singing thee, the supporter, in every way, have approached thee with homage.

original: sa no juṣasva samidhāno aṅgiro devo martasya yaśasā sudītibhiḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ juṣasva samidhānaḥ aṅgiraḥ devaḥ martasya yaśasā su dītibhiḥ
translated: Accept us, O Angiras, when kindled, O god, with the glory of mortals, with thy fair lights.

original: tvam agne pururūpo viśeviśe vayo dadhāsi pratnathā puruṣṭuta /
analyzed: tvam agne puru rūpaḥ viśeviśe vayaḥ dadhāsi pratnathā puruṣṭuta
translated: O Agni, of many forms, in every tribe, thou placest life, as of old, O much-invoked one.

original: purūṇy annā sahasā vi rājasi tviṣiḥ sā te titviṣāṇasya nādhṛṣe //
analyzed: purūṇi annā sahasā vi rājasi tviṣiḥ sā te titviṣāṇasya na ādhṛṣe
translated: With might thou shinest forth, with many foods. Thy radiance, when thou shinest, no one can withstand.

original: tvām agne samidhānaṃ yaviṣṭhya devā dūtaṃ cakrire havyavāhanam /
analyzed: tvām agne samidhānam yaviṣṭhya devāḥ dūtam cakrire havya vāhanam
translated: O Agni, the gods have made thee, when kindled, O youngest one, their messenger, the bearer of oblations,

original: urujrayasaṃ ghṛtayonim āhutaṃ tveṣaṃ cakṣur dadhire codayanmati //
analyzed: uru jrayasam ghṛta yonim āhutam tveṣam cakṣuḥ dadhire codayat mati
translated: The far-reaching one, whose birthplace is ghee, who is offered to, the radiant one, have they made their eye, urging their thought.

original: tvām agne pradiva āhutaṃ ghṛtaiḥ sumnāyavaḥ suṣamidhā sam īdhire /
analyzed: tvām agne pradivaḥ āhutam ghṛtaiḥ sumnāyavaḥ su samidhā sam īdhire
translated: Thee, O Agni, the men who bring oblations, with ghee, with fair fuel, have enkindled, for bliss.

original: sa vāvṛdhāna oṣadhībhir ukṣito 'bhi jrayāṃsi pārthivā vi tiṣṭhase //
analyzed: sa vāvṛdhānaḥ oṣadhībhiḥ ukṣitaḥ bhi jrayāṃsi pārthivā vi tiṣṭhase
translated: Thou, grown great, sprinkled with plants, dost spread abroad the bright flames that are on earth.

original: tvām agne haviṣmanto devam martāsa īḷate /
analyzed: tvām agne haviṣmantaḥ devam martāsaḥ īḍate
translated: Thee, O Agni, mortal men who bring oblations, the gods, seek.

original: manye tvā jātavedasaṃ sa havyā vakṣy ānuṣak //
analyzed: manye tvā jātavedasam sa havyā vakṣi ānuṣak
translated: I deem thee Jâtavedas: thou wilt bear our offerings in due time.

original: agnir hotā dāsvataḥ kṣayasya vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ hotā dāsvataḥ kṣayasya vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: Agni is the priest of the liberal lord of the house with strewn grass.

original: saṃ yajñāsaś caranti yaṃ saṃ vājāsaḥ śravasyavaḥ //
analyzed: sam yajñāsaḥ caranti yam sam vājāsaḥ śravasyavaḥ
translated: To him come the sacrifices, and the prizes to be gained by strength.

original: uta sma yaṃ śiśuṃ yathā navaṃ janiṣṭāraṇī /
analyzed: uta sma yam śiśum yathā navam janiṣṭa araṇī
translated: And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,

original: dhartāram mānuṣīṇāṃ viśām agniṃ svadhvaram //
analyzed: dhartāram mānuṣīṇām viśām agnim su adhvaram
translated: The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-restrained.🔽And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,🔽The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-restrained.🔽And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,🔽The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-restrained.🔽And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,🔽The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-restrained.🔽And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,🔽The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-restrained.

original: uta sma durgṛbhīyase putro na hvāryāṇām /
analyzed: uta sma durgṛbhīyase putraḥ na hvāryāṇām
translated: And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,

original: purū yo dagdhāsi vanāgne paśur na yavase //🔽adha sma yasyārcayaḥ samyak saṃyanti dhūminaḥ /
analyzed: purū yaḥ dagdhā asi vanā agne paśuḥ na yavase  adha sma yasya arcayaḥ samyak saṃyanti dhūminaḥ
translated: The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-restrained.🔽And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,🔽The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-restrained.🔽And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,

original: yad īm aha trito divy upa dhmāteva dhamati śiśīte dhmātarī yathā //🔽tavāham agna ūtibhir mitrasya ca praśastibhiḥ /
analyzed: yat īm aha tritaḥ divi upa dhmātā iva dhamati śiśīte dhmātari yathā  tava aham agne ūtibhiḥ mitrasya ca praśastibhiḥ
translated: The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-restrained.🔽And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,🔽The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-restrained.🔽And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,

original: dveṣoyuto na duritā turyāma martyānām //
analyzed: dveṣoyutaḥ na duritā turyāma martyānām
translated: The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-restrained.🔽And him whom they have generated like a child, new-born, the two Mothers,🔽The supporter of the tribes of men, Agni, the self-re

original: taṃ no agne abhī naro rayiṃ sahasva ā bhara /
analyzed: tam naḥ agne abhi naraḥ rayim sahasvas ā bhara
translated: O Agni, bring to us that wealth, O Hero, do thou bring it.

original: sa kṣepayat sa poṣayad bhuvad vājasya sātaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe //
analyzed: sa kṣepayat sa poṣayat bhuvat vājasya sātaye uta edhi pṛtsu naḥ vṛdhe
translated: May he increase it, may he nourish it, may he be for the winning of strength. Be thou with us in battles for increase.

original: agna ojiṣṭham ā bhara dyumnam asmabhyam adhrigo /
analyzed: agne ojiṣṭham ā bhara dyumnam asmabhyam adhrigo
translated: O Agni, bring us the most mighty glory, O thou who passest over all things.

original: pra no rāyā parīṇasā ratsi vājāya panthām //🔽tvaṃ no agne adbhuta kratvā dakṣasya maṃhanā /
analyzed: pra naḥ rāyā parīṇasā ratsi vājāya panthām  tvam naḥ agne adbhuta kratvā dakṣasya maṃhanā
translated: Do thou find for us the path to wealth with thy favour.🔽O Agni, wonderful, with the greatness of thy wisdom and might,

original: tve asuryam āruhat krāṇā mitro na yajñiyaḥ //
analyzed: tve asuryam āruhat krāṇā mitraḥ na yajñiyaḥ
translated: In thee the godlike power hath been established, thou art to be worshipped like Mitra.

original: tvaṃ no agna eṣāṃ gayam puṣṭiṃ ca vardhaya /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne eṣām gayam puṣṭim ca vardhaya
translated: O Agni, increase for us the prosperity and the wealth of these (men),

original: ye stomebhiḥ pra sūrayo naro maghāny ānaśuḥ //
analyzed: ye stomebhiḥ pra sūrayaḥ naraḥ maghāni ānaśuḥ
translated: Those who, through their praises, have won great riches, the heroes, the princes.

original: ye agne candra te giraḥ śumbhanty aśvarādhasaḥ /
analyzed: ye agne candra te giraḥ śumbhanti aśva rādhasaḥ
translated: Those who, O Agni, O thou of bright flames, with their songs, delight in horses as their best possession,

original: śuṣmebhiḥ śuṣmiṇo naro divaś cid yeṣām bṛhat sukīrtir bodhati tmanā //
analyzed: śuṣmebhiḥ śuṣmiṇaḥ naraḥ divaḥ cit yeṣām bṛhat su kīrtiḥ bodhati tmanā
translated: The mighty men with their might, whose great fame, O thou of the lofty flame, awakens them even from heaven.

original: tava tye agne arcayo bhrājanto yanti dhṛṣṇuyā /
analyzed: tava tye agne arcayaḥ bhrājantaḥ yanti dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: These thy flames, O Agni, shining, move forward in their might,

original: parijmāno na vidyutaḥ svāno ratho na vājayuḥ //🔽nū no agna ūtaye sabādhasaś ca rātaye /
analyzed: parijmānaḥ na vidyutaḥ svānaḥ rathaḥ na vājayuḥ  nu naḥ agne ūtaye sabādhasaḥ ca rātaye
translated: Circling like lightning, like a chariot, urged on to speed, with its own (sound).🔽Now, O Agni, for our help, and for the sake of our prosperity,

original: asmākāsaś ca sūrayo viśvā āśās tarīṣaṇi //
analyzed: asmākāsaḥ ca sūrayaḥ viśvāḥ āśāḥ tarīṣaṇi
translated: And our princes, mayst thou, O thou of all forms, overcome all the regions.

original: tvaṃ no agne aṅgira stuta stavāna ā bhara /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne aṅgira stuta stavāna ā bhara
translated: You, O Agni, O Angiras, being praised, bring to us

original: hotar vibhvāsahaṃ rayiṃ stotṛbhya stavase ca na utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe //
analyzed: hotar vibhvāsaham rayim stotṛbhya stavase ca naḥ uta edhi pṛtsu naḥ vṛdhe
translated: the wealth, O Hotar, which is to be praised by the praisers and the reciters. Be present for our increase in the contests.

original: janasya gopā ajaniṣṭa jāgṛvir agniḥ sudakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase /
analyzed: janasya gopāḥ ajaniṣṭa jāgṛviḥ agniḥ su dakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase
translated: The watchful guardian of the people, Agni, the very skilful one, is born for a new prosperity.

original: ghṛtapratīko bṛhatā divispṛśā dyumad vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ //
analyzed: ghṛta pratīkaḥ bṛhatā divispṛśā dyumat vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ
translated: The pure one, with the face of ghee, shining in the lofty heaven, shines brightly for the Bharatas.

original: yajñasya ketum prathamam purohitam agniṃ naras triṣadhasthe sam īdhire /
analyzed: yajñasya ketum prathamam purohitam agnim naraḥ triṣadhasthe sam īdhire
translated: The men have kindled Agni, the banner of the sacrifice, the first priest, in the threefold abode,

original: indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ sa barhiṣi sīdan ni hotā yajathāya sukratuḥ //
analyzed: indreṇa devaiḥ sa ratham sa barhiṣi sīdat ni hotā yajathāya su kratuḥ
translated: seated with Indra and the gods on the sacrificial grass, the well-disposed one, as the Hotar, for the sacrifice.

original: asammṛṣṭo jāyase mātroḥ śucir mandraḥ kavir ud atiṣṭho vivasvataḥ /🔽ghṛtena tvāvardhayann agna āhuta dhūmas te ketur abhavad divi śritaḥ //🔽agnir no yajñam upa vetu sādhuyāgniṃ naro vi bharante gṛhegṛhe /
analyzed: a sammṛṣṭaḥ jāyase mātroḥ śuciḥ mandraḥ kaviḥ ud atiṣṭhaḥ vivasvataḥ  ghṛtena tvā avardhayan agne āhuta dhūmaḥ te ketuḥ abhavat divi śritaḥ  agniḥ naḥ yajñam upa vetu sādhuyā agnim naraḥ vi bharante gṛhe gṛhe
translated: Unanointed, you are born from your parents, pure, delightful, a sage, you have arisen from Vivasvat.🔽With ghee they have increased you, O Agni, the offered one. Your smoke has become a banner, resting in the sky.🔽May Agni come to our sacrifice with ease. Men carry Agni in every house.

original: agnir dūto abhavad dhavyavāhano 'gniṃ vṛṇānā vṛṇate kavikratum //
analyzed: agniḥ dūtaḥ abhavat havya vāhanaḥ gnim vṛṇānāḥ vṛṇate kavi kratum
translated: Agni has become the messenger, the bearer of oblations. They choose Agni, of wise power, when choosing.

original: tubhyedam agne madhumattamaṃ vacas tubhyam manīṣā iyam astu śaṃ hṛde /
analyzed: tubhya idam agne madhumattamam vacaḥ tubhyam manīṣā iyam astu śam hṛde
translated: To thee, O Agni, this most sweet hymn of praise, to thee this thought of ours be for thy joy.

original: tvāṃ giraḥ sindhum ivāvanīr mahīr ā pṛṇanti śavasā vardhayanti ca //
analyzed: tvām giraḥ sindhum iva avanīḥ mahīḥ ā pṛṇanti śavasā vardhayanti ca
translated: The songs fill thee as the streams fill the ocean, and make thee strong with their own strength.

original: tvām agne aṅgiraso guhā hitam anv avindañ chiśriyāṇaṃ vanevane /
analyzed: tvām agne aṅgirasaḥ guhā hitam anu avindam śiśriyāṇam vanevane
translated: Agni, the Angirases found thee, well laid, in the cave, in every wood, as 'twere reposing.

original: sa jāyase mathyamānaḥ saho mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasas putram aṅgiraḥ //🔽prāgnaye bṛhate yajñiyāya ṛtasya vṛṣṇe asurāya manma /
analyzed: sa jāyase mathyamānaḥ sahaḥ mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasaḥ putram aṅgiraḥ  pra agnaye bṛhate yajñiyāya ṛtasya vṛṣṇe asurāya manma
translated: Thou art born, when they rub thee, mighty, mighty: to thee, O Angiras, they give the name of Son of Strength.🔽To Agni, to the lofty One, meet for worship, to the strong One of holy order, to the Asura, I offer this hymn.

original: ghṛtaṃ na yajña āsye supūtaṃ giram bhare vṛṣabhāya pratīcīm //
analyzed: ghṛtam na yajñe āsye su pūtam giram bhare vṛṣabhāya pratīcīm
translated: As ghee is purified in the mouth of the sacrifice, I bring this song to the Bull, to the Westward.

original: ṛtaṃ cikitva ṛtam ic cikiddhy ṛtasya dhārā anu tṛndhi pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: ṛtam cikitvaḥ ṛtam id cikiddhi ṛtasya dhārāḥ anu tṛndhi pūrvīḥ
translated: Think of holy order, and be thou inclined to holy order: let the streams of holy order flow forth before thee.

original: nāhaṃ yātuṃ sahasā na dvayena ṛtaṃ sapāmy aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ //
analyzed: na aham yātum sahasā na dvayena ṛtam sapāmi aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ
translated: I do not, by violence or fraud, O thou of red steeds, O strong One, violate holy order.

original: kayā no agna ṛtayann ṛtena bhuvo navedā ucathasya navyaḥ /
analyzed: kayā naḥ agne ṛtayan ṛtena bhuvaḥ navedāḥ ucathasya navyaḥ
translated: By what truth, O Agni, art thou, the truthful, the new, the most recent, the knower of speech, to be worshipped with holy order?

original: vedā me deva ṛtupā ṛtūnāṃ nāham patiṃ sanitur asya rāyaḥ //
analyzed: vedā me devaḥ ṛtu pāḥ ṛtūnām na aham patim sanituḥ asya rāyaḥ
translated: I know thee, O God, the guardian of the seasons: I am not the lord of the wealth of this ruler.

original: ke te agne ripave bandhanāsaḥ ke pāyavaḥ saniṣanta dyumantaḥ /
analyzed: ke te agne ripave bandhanāsaḥ ke pāyavaḥ saniṣanta dyumantaḥ
translated: What, O Agni, are the bonds of the foe to thee? What are the glorious companions who delight thee?

original: ke dhāsim agne anṛtasya pānti ka āsato vacasaḥ santi gopāḥ //
analyzed: ke dhāsim agne anṛtasya pānti ke āsataḥ vacasaḥ santi gopāḥ
translated: Who protect the worshipper, O Agni, from the sin of falsehood? Who are the guardians of the speech of the sinner?

original: sakhāyas te viṣuṇā agna ete śivāsaḥ santo aśivā abhūvan /
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ te viṣuṇāḥ agne ete śivāsaḥ santaḥ aśivāḥ abhūvan
translated: These, O Agni, are thy spiteful enemies; though they were friendly, they have become unfriendly.

original: adhūrṣata svayam ete vacobhir ṛjūyate vṛjināni bruvantaḥ //
analyzed: adhūrṣata svayam ete vacobhiḥ ṛjūyate vṛjināni bruvantaḥ
translated: They have themselves been shaken by their own words; they speak crookedly, though they should speak straight.

original: yas te agne namasā yajñam īṭṭa ṛtaṃ sa pāty aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te agne namasā yajñam īṭṭe ṛtam sa pāti aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ
translated: He who invites thee to the sacrifice with homage, O Agni, he guards the truth of the red bull.

original: tasya kṣayaḥ pṛthur ā sādhur etu prasarsrāṇasya nahuṣasya śeṣaḥ //🔽arcantas tvā havāmahe 'rcantaḥ sam idhīmahi /🔽agne arcanta ūtaye //
analyzed: tasya kṣayaḥ pṛthuḥ ā sādhuḥ etu prasarsrāṇasya nahuṣasya śeṣaḥ  arcantaḥ tvā havāmahe rcantaḥ sam idhīmahi  agne arcantaḥ ūtaye
translated: Let his wide and good abode come forth, the remnant of the extended serpent.🔽We call on thee with praises, we kindle thee with praises,🔽O Agni, with praises for help.

original: agne stomam manāmahe sidhram adya divispṛśaḥ /
analyzed: agne stomam manāmahe sidhram adya divispṛśaḥ
translated: O Agni, we think of a successful praise today, O thou who touchest the sky,

original: devasya draviṇasyavaḥ //
analyzed: devasya draviṇasyavaḥ
translated: we who desire the wealth of the god.

original: agnir juṣata no giro hotā yo mānuṣeṣv ā /
analyzed: agniḥ juṣata naḥ giraḥ hotā yaḥ mānuṣeṣu ā
translated: O Agni, accept our songs, thou who art the Hotar among men.

original: sa yakṣad daivyaṃ janam //
analyzed: sa yakṣat daivyam janam
translated: He shall worship the divine people.

original: tvam agne saprathā asi juṣṭo hotā vareṇyaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne saprathāḥ asi juṣṭaḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the spreader, the acceptable Hotar, the excellent one.

original: tvayā yajñaṃ vi tanvate //
analyzed: tvayā yajñam vi tanvate
translated: By thee they spread out the sacrifice.

original: tvām agne vājasātamaṃ viprā vardhanti suṣṭutam /
analyzed: tvām agne vāja sātamam viprāḥ vardhanti suṣṭutam
translated: O Agni, the sages strengthen thee, the most victorious, the well-praised one.

original: sa no rāsva suvīryam //
analyzed: sa naḥ rāsva su vīryam
translated: Grant us good heroism.

original: agne nemir arāṃ iva devāṃs tvam paribhūr asi /
analyzed: agne nemiḥ arām iva devān tvam paribhūḥ asi
translated: O Agni, thou art the rim like the spokes; thou art the overlord of the gods.

original: ā rādhaś citram ṛñjase //
analyzed: ā rādhaḥ citram ṛñjase
translated: To obtain his wondrous favour.

original: agniṃ stomena bodhaya samidhāno amartyam /
analyzed: agnim stomena bodhaya samidhānaḥ amartyam
translated: Awaken Agni with the hymn, kindled, the immortal one,

original: havyā deveṣu no dadhat //🔽tam adhvareṣv īḷate devam martā amartyam /
analyzed: havyā deveṣu naḥ dadhat  tam adhvareṣu īḍate devam martāḥ amartyam
translated: Who shall place our offerings among the gods.🔽Men invoke that god at sacrifices, the immortal one,

original: yajiṣṭham mānuṣe jane //
analyzed: yajiṣṭham mānuṣe jane
translated: The best sacrificer among the human race.

original: taṃ hi śaśvanta īḷate srucā devaṃ ghṛtaścutā /
analyzed: tam hi śaśvantaḥ īḍate srucā devam ghṛtaścutā
translated: For him all people invoke with ladles, the god with drops of ghee,

original: agniṃ havyāya voḷhave //
analyzed: agnim havyāya voḷhave
translated: Agni, to carry our offerings.

original: agnir jāto arocata ghnan dasyūñ jyotiṣā tamaḥ /🔽avindad gā apaḥ svaḥ //
analyzed: agniḥ jātaḥ arocata ghnan dasyūm jyotiṣā tamaḥ  avindat gāḥ apaḥ svar
translated: Agni, being born, shone forth, slaying the Dasyus with his light,🔽Finding the cows, the waters, and heaven.

original: agnim īḷenyaṃ kaviṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭhaṃ saparyata /
analyzed: agnim īḍenyam kavim ghṛta pṛṣṭham saparyata
translated: Worship Agni, the adorable sage, whose back is anointed with ghee,

original: vetu me śṛṇavad dhavam //
analyzed: vetu me śṛṇavat dhavam
translated: May he listen to my call.

original: agniṃ ghṛtena vāvṛdhu stomebhir viśvacarṣaṇim /
analyzed: agnim ghṛtena vāvṛdhuḥ stomebhiḥ viśvacarṣaṇim
translated: They have strengthened Agni with ghee, the all-impelling one, with hymns,

original: svādhībhir vacasyubhiḥ //
analyzed: su ādhībhiḥ vacasyubhiḥ
translated: With their own inspired words.

original: pra vedhase kavaye vedyāya giram bhare yaśase pūrvyāya /
analyzed: pra vedhase kavaye vedyāya giram bhare yaśase pūrvyāya
translated: I bring a song to the wise one, the leader, for fame, for the ancient one.

original: ghṛtaprasatto asuraḥ suśevo rāyo dhartā dharuṇo vasvo agniḥ //
analyzed: ghṛta prasattaḥ asuraḥ su śevaḥ rāyaḥ dhartā dharuṇaḥ vasvaḥ agniḥ
translated: The Asura, well-disposed, anointed with ghee, is the supporter of wealth, the bearer, the holder of good things.

original: ṛtena ṛtaṃ dharuṇaṃ dhārayanta yajñasya śāke parame vyoman /
analyzed: ṛtena ṛtam dharuṇam dhārayanta yajñasya śāke parame vyoman
translated: By truth they uphold the truth, the support, in the highest heaven, the place of sacrifice.

original: divo dharman dharuṇe seduṣo nṝñ jātair ajātāṃ abhi ye nanakṣuḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ dharman dharuṇe seduṣaḥ nṝn jātaiḥ a jātām abhi ye nanakṣuḥ
translated: The men who have been born, who have approached the unborn one, have sat down on the support of the law of heaven.

original: aṅhoyuvas tanvas tanvate vi vayo mahad duṣṭaram pūrvyāya /
analyzed: aṅhoyuvaḥ tanvaḥ tanvate vi vayaḥ mahat duṣṭaram pūrvyāya
translated: The young ones of the body extend their life, great and hard to overcome, to the ancient one.

original: sa saṃvato navajātas tuturyāt siṅhaṃ na kruddham abhitaḥ pari ṣṭhuḥ //
analyzed: sa saṃvataḥ nava jātaḥ tuturyāt siṅham na kruddham abhitas pari sthuḥ
translated: Let him, newly born, roar back, let them stand around him like an angry lion.

original: māteva yad bharase paprathāno janaṃjanaṃ dhāyase cakṣase ca /
analyzed: mātā iva yat bharase paprathānaḥ janaṃjanam dhāyase cakṣase ca
translated: When, like a mother, you spread out for the feast, to support and see each man,

original: vayovayo jarase yad dadhānaḥ pari tmanā viṣurūpo jigāsi //
analyzed: vayaḥ vayaḥ jarase yat dadhānaḥ pari tmanā viṣurūpaḥ jigāsi
translated: When, bearing each bird to old age, you go around in various forms by yourself.

original: vājo nu te śavasas pātv antam uruṃ doghaṃ dharuṇaṃ deva rāyaḥ /
analyzed: vājaḥ nu te śavasaḥ pātu antam urum dogham dharuṇam deva rāyaḥ
translated: Let your strength, O God, protect the end of your wide, long-lasting wealth.

original: padaṃ na tāyur guhā dadhāno maho rāye citayann atrim aspaḥ //
analyzed: padam na tāyuḥ guhā dadhānaḥ mahaḥ rāye citayan atrim aspaḥ
translated: Keeping the foot of the falcon hidden, you have come to Atri, thinking of great wealth.

original: bṛhad vayo hi bhānave 'rcā devāyāgnaye /
analyzed: bṛhat vayaḥ hi bhānave rcā devāya agnaye
translated: For the light, I praise the lofty song to the god Agni,

original: yam mitraṃ na praśastibhir martāso dadhire puraḥ //
analyzed: yam mitram na praśastibhiḥ martāsaḥ dadhire puras
translated: Whom mortals have placed in front by their praises, as if he were a friend.

original: sa hi dyubhir janānāṃ hotā dakṣasya bāhvoḥ /
analyzed: sa hi dyubhiḥ janānām hotā dakṣasya bāhvoḥ
translated: For he, with his rays, is the Hotar in the arms of the people and of Daksha.

original: vi havyam agnir ānuṣag bhago na vāram ṛṇvati //🔽asya stome maghonaḥ sakhye vṛddhaśociṣaḥ /
analyzed: vi havyam agniḥ ānuṣak bhagaḥ na vāram ṛṇvati  asya stome maghonaḥ sakhye vṛddha śociṣaḥ
translated: Agni, as if he were Bṛhaspati, moves the oblation along like a fence.🔽In the praise of this Maghavan, in the friendship of the one with the mighty flame,

original: viśvā yasmin tuviṣvaṇi sam arye śuṣmam ādadhuḥ //
analyzed: viśvā yasmin tuviṣvaṇi sam arye śuṣmam ādadhuḥ
translated: In whom they have placed strength, the great strength, in the noble one.

original: adhā hy agna eṣāṃ suvīryasya maṃhanā /
analyzed: adhā hi agne eṣām su vīryasya maṃhanā
translated: Now, indeed, O Agni, by the favor of this good heroism of these (men),

original: tam id yahvaṃ na rodasī pari śravo babhūvatuḥ //
analyzed: tam id yahvam na rodasī pari śravaḥ babhūvatuḥ
translated: The two world-halves have encompassed that youthful one's fame.

original: nū na ehi vāryam agne gṛṇāna ā bhara /
analyzed: nu naḥ ehi vāryam agne gṛṇānaḥ ā bhara
translated: Now come to us, O Agni, to the prize, bring it, praised,

original: ye vayaṃ ye ca sūrayaḥ svasti dhāmahe sacotaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe //
analyzed: ye vayam ye ca sūrayaḥ svasti dhāmahe sacā uta edhi pṛtsu naḥ vṛdhe
translated: We and the princes. With prosperity may we all attain thee. Be thou in our battles for increase.

original: ā yajñair deva martya itthā tavyāṃsam ūtaye /
analyzed: ā yajñaiḥ deva martyaḥ itthā tavyāṃsam ūtaye
translated: The mortal man with sacrifices here, O God, to thee, the most adorable, for help,

original: agniṃ kṛte svadhvare pūrur īḷītāvase //🔽asya hi svayaśastara āsā vidharman manyase /
analyzed: agnim kṛte su adhvare pūruḥ īḍīta avase  asya hi sva yaśastaraḥ āsā vidharman manyase
translated: Purû, having made ready the oblation, hath called on Agni for his favour.🔽For this one, more famous than thou, thou thinkest, O Law-ordainer, to be thy equal.

original: taṃ nākaṃ citraśociṣam mandram paro manīṣayā //🔽asya vāsā u arciṣā ya āyukta tujā girā /
analyzed: tam nākam citra śociṣam mandram paras manīṣayā  asya vā āsā u arciṣā yaḥ āyukta tujā girā
translated: That lofty one, of wondrous light, the cheerful one, with highest thought.🔽His garments are with flame, he who is yoked with strength and song.

original: divo na yasya retasā bṛhac chocanty arcayaḥ //🔽asya kratvā vicetaso dasmasya vasu ratha ā /
analyzed: divaḥ na yasya retasā bṛhat śocanti arcayaḥ  asya kratvā vicetasaḥ dasmasya vasu rathe ā
translated: Whose bright flames shine like the seed of heaven.🔽Of this wondrous one, whose mind discerns, the chariot of wealth is here.

original: adhā viśvāsu havyo 'gnir vikṣu pra śasyate //
analyzed: adhā viśvāsu havyaḥ gniḥ vikṣu pra śasyate
translated: Now in all the people Agni is to be praised, to be invoked with offerings.

original: nū na id dhi vāryam āsā sacanta sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: nu naḥ id hi vāryam āsā sacanta sūrayaḥ
translated: Now, indeed, the princes follow after the prize which is here.

original: ūrjo napād abhiṣṭaye pāhi śagdhi svastaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe //
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napāt abhiṣṭaye pāhi śagdhi svastaye uta edhi pṛtsu naḥ vṛdhe
translated: From the foot of strength for help, guard us, be ready for our welfare. Be thou in our battles for increase.

original: prātar agniḥ purupriyo viśa stavetātithiḥ /
analyzed: prātar agniḥ puru priyaḥ viśaḥ staveta atithiḥ
translated: In the morning Agni, much-loved, is to be praised by the people, the guest.

original: viśvāni yo amartyo havyā marteṣu raṇyati //
analyzed: viśvāni yaḥ amartyaḥ havyā marteṣu raṇyati
translated: He who, immortal, delights in the oblations of mortals in all (places).

original: dvitāya mṛktavāhase svasya dakṣasya maṃhanā /🔽induṃ sa dhatta ānuṣak stotā cit te amartya //
analyzed: dvitāya mṛktavāhase svasya dakṣasya maṃhanā  indum sa dhatte ānuṣak stotā cit te amartya
translated: For the two-fold, for the swift-moving, for his own powerful one,🔽He holds the Soma in his mouth, the mortal also, O immortal one.

original: taṃ vo dīrghāyuśociṣaṃ girā huve maghonām /
analyzed: tam vaḥ dīrgha āyu śociṣam girā huve maghonām
translated: I invoke with a verse that one of you who has long life and radiance, the generous ones,

original: ariṣṭo yeṣāṃ ratho vy aśvadāvann īyate //
analyzed: ariṣṭaḥ yeṣām rathaḥ vi aśva dāvan īyate
translated: Whose chariot, O giver of horses, moves on without being destroyed, to whom (I invoke).

original: citrā vā yeṣu dīdhitir āsann ukthā pānti ye /
analyzed: citrā vā yeṣu dīdhitiḥ āsan ukthā pānti ye
translated: Those in whom the variegated thought is present, who protect the hymns,

original: stīrṇam barhiḥ svarṇare śravāṃsi dadhire pari //
analyzed: stīrṇam barhiḥ svarṇare śravāṃsi dadhire pari
translated: The strewn sacrificial grass, O golden one, they have obtained fame.

original: ye me pañcāśataṃ dadur aśvānāṃ sadhastuti /
analyzed: ye me pañcāśatam daduḥ aśvānām sadhastuti
translated: Those who gave me five hundred horses for the assembly,

original: dyumad agne mahi śravo bṛhat kṛdhi maghonāṃ nṛvad amṛta nṛṇām //
analyzed: dyumat agne mahi śravaḥ bṛhat kṛdhi maghonām nṛvat amṛta nṛṇām
translated: Make great and glorious fame for them, O glorious Agni, like that of men, O immortal one, of the generous men.

original: abhy avasthāḥ pra jāyante pra vavrer vavriś ciketa /
analyzed: abhi avasthāḥ pra jāyante pra vavreḥ vavriḥ ciketa
translated: The offspring are born from the womb, the womb thinks from the womb.

original: upasthe mātur vi caṣṭe //
analyzed: upasthe mātuḥ vi caṣṭe
translated: It looks in the lap of the mother.

original: juhure vi citayanto 'nimiṣaṃ nṛmṇam pānti /
analyzed: juhure vi citayantaḥ nimiṣam nṛmṇam pānti
translated: They offer, thinking, they protect the winking heroism.

original: ā dṛḷhām puraṃ viviśuḥ //
analyzed: ā dṛḷhām puram viviśuḥ
translated: They have entered the firm fortress.

original: ā śvaitreyasya jantavo dyumad vardhanta kṛṣṭayaḥ /🔽niṣkagrīvo bṛhaduktha enā madhvā na vājayuḥ //
analyzed: ā śvaitreyasya jantavaḥ dyumat vardhanta kṛṣṭayaḥ  niṣka grīvaḥ bṛhat ukthaḥ enā madhvā na vājayuḥ
translated: The people of Śvetareri's son increase in glory.🔽The one with a necklace, of great praise, is like a prize-winning horse.

original: priyaṃ dugdhaṃ na kāmyam ajāmi jāmyoḥ sacā /
analyzed: priyam dugdham na kāmyam ajāmi jāmyoḥ sacā
translated: The dear milk, like a desirable one, I offer to the sister and brother together.

original: gharmo na vājajaṭharo 'dabdhaḥ śaśvato dabhaḥ //
analyzed: gharmaḥ na vāja jaṭharaḥ dabdhaḥ śaśvataḥ dabhaḥ
translated: Like the heated cauldron, the abode of strength, invincible, the ever-conquering conqueror.

original: krīḷan no raśma ā bhuvaḥ sam bhasmanā vāyunā vevidānaḥ /
analyzed: krīḍan naḥ raśmaḥ ā bhuvaḥ sam bhasmanā vāyunā vevidānaḥ
translated: Playing, come to us with the ray, agreeing with the smoke and wind.

original: tā asya san dhṛṣajo na tigmāḥ susaṃśitā vakṣyo vakṣaṇesthāḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ asya san dhṛṣajaḥ na tigmāḥ su saṃśitāḥ vakṣyaḥ vakṣaṇesthāḥ
translated: Those sharp teeth of his are well-sharpened, placed in the mouth and throat.

original: yam agne vājasātama tvaṃ cin manyase rayim /
analyzed: yam agne vāja sātama tvam cit manyase rayim
translated: O Agni, the wealth which you think is best for gaining strength,

original: taṃ no gīrbhiḥ śravāyyaṃ devatrā panayā yujam //
analyzed: tam naḥ gīrbhiḥ śravāyyam devatrā panaya yujam
translated: That, worthy of fame, bring to us by your songs, united with the gods.

original: ye agne nerayanti te vṛddhā ugrasya śavasaḥ /
analyzed: ye agne na īrayanti te vṛddhāḥ ugrasya śavasaḥ
translated: O Agni, those who follow the path of the strong and mighty one,

original: apa dveṣo apa hvaro 'nyavratasya saścire //🔽hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe 'gne dakṣasya sādhanam /
analyzed: apa dveṣaḥ apa hvaraḥ nyavratasya saścire  hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe gne dakṣasya sādhanam
translated: They drive away hatred, they drive away contempt, they follow the one of different vows.🔽We choose you as our Hotar, O Agni, the fulfiller of strength,

original: yajñeṣu pūrvyaṃ girā prayasvanto havāmahe //
analyzed: yajñeṣu pūrvyam girā prayasvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: The ancient one in sacrifices, we call with our song, the bountiful ones.

original: itthā yathā ta ūtaye sahasāvan divedive /
analyzed: itthā yathā te ūtaye sahasāvan dive dive
translated: Thus, O conqueror, day by day, for help,

original: rāya ṛtāya sukrato gobhiḥ ṣyāma sadhamādo vīraiḥ syāma sadhamādaḥ //
analyzed: rāye ṛtāya su krato gobhiḥ syāma sadhamādaḥ vīraiḥ syāma sadhamādaḥ
translated: O wise one, may we be rich with cattle and abundant food, may we be rich with heroes and abundant food.

original: manuṣvat tvā ni dhīmahi manuṣvat sam idhīmahi /
analyzed: manuṣvat tvā ni dhīmahi manuṣvat sam idhīmahi
translated: Like Manu, we establish you, like Manu we kindle you.

original: agne manuṣvad aṅgiro devān devayate yaja //
analyzed: agne manuṣvat aṅgiraḥ devān devayate yaja
translated: O Agni, like Manu, O Angiras, offer to the gods at the divine sacrifice.

original: tvaṃ hi mānuṣe jane 'gne suprīta idhyase /
analyzed: tvam hi mānuṣe jane gne su prītaḥ idhyase
translated: For you, O Agni, are well-pleased among the human people, you are kindled.

original: srucas tvā yanty ānuṣak sujāta sarpirāsute //🔽tvāṃ viśve sajoṣaso devāso dūtam akrata /
analyzed: srucaḥ tvā yanti ānuṣak su jāta sarpiḥ āsute  tvām viśve sajoṣasaḥ devāsaḥ dūtam akrata
translated: The ladles come to thee in order, O well-born one, for the sake of ghee.🔽The All-gods have made thee their messenger, O thou of one mind with them.

original: saparyantas tvā kave yajñeṣu devam īḷate //
analyzed: saparyantaḥ tvā kave yajñeṣu devam īḍate
translated: Honouring thee, O sage, the gods seek the god at sacrifices.

original: devaṃ vo devayajyayāgnim īḷīta martyaḥ /
analyzed: devam vaḥ deva yajyayā agnim īḍīta martyaḥ
translated: Let mortal man serve Agni with the worship of the gods, O god.

original: samiddhaḥ śukra dīdihy ṛtasya yonim āsadaḥ sasasya yonim āsadaḥ //🔽pra viśvasāmann atrivad arcā pāvakaśociṣe /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ śukra dīdihi ṛtasya yonim āsadaḥ sasasya yonim āsadaḥ  pra viśvasāman atri vat arca pāvaka śociṣe
translated: Kindled, O bright one, shine forth; thou hast sat in the womb of truth, thou hast sat in the womb of food.🔽I praise Agni, the all-conquering one, like Atri, the one whose radiance is like fire,

original: yo adhvareṣv īḍyo hotā mandratamo viśi //
analyzed: yaḥ adhvareṣu īḍyaḥ hotā mandratamaḥ viśi
translated: Who is to be worshipped at sacrifices, the most delightful Hotar in the assembly.

original: ny agniṃ jātavedasaṃ dadhātā devam ṛtvijam /🔽pra yajña etv ānuṣag adyā devavyacastamaḥ //
analyzed: ni agnim jātavedasam dadhāta devam ṛtvijam  pra yajñaḥ etu ānuṣak adyā deva vyacastamaḥ
translated: We have placed Agni, the all-knowing god, the priest, the god,🔽Let the sacrifice come in order today, most divine.

original: cikitvinmanasaṃ tvā devam martāsa ūtaye /
analyzed: cikitvinmanasam tvā devam martāsaḥ ūtaye
translated: We mortals have thought of thee, O god, whose mind discerns, for help,

original: vareṇyasya te 'vasa iyānāso amanmahi //
analyzed: vareṇyasya te vaso iyānāsaḥ amanmahi
translated: We who are striving for thy most excellent favour.

original: agne cikiddhy asya na idaṃ vacaḥ sahasya /
analyzed: agne cikiddhi asya naḥ idam vacaḥ sahasya
translated: O Agni, do thou accept this speech of ours, O thou of mighty power.

original: taṃ tvā suśipra dampate stomair vardhanty atrayo gīrbhiḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ //
analyzed: tam tvā su śipra dampate stomaiḥ vardhanti atrayaḥ gīrbhiḥ śumbhanti atrayaḥ
translated: O thou of beautiful brows, O lord of the house, the Atri people exalt thee with praises, the Atri people glorify thee with songs.

original: agne sahantam ā bhara dyumnasya prāsahā rayim /
analyzed: agne sahantam ā bhara dyumnasya prāsahā rayim
translated: O Agni, bring hitherward the wealth of glory that conquers,

original: viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhy āsā vājeṣu sāsahat //
analyzed: viśvāḥ yaḥ carṣaṇīḥ abhī āsā vājeṣu sāsahat
translated: Which surpasses all people, which is victorious in battles.

original: tam agne pṛtanāṣahaṃ rayiṃ sahasva ā bhara /
analyzed: tam agne pṛtanāṣaham rayim sahasva ā bhara
translated: O Agni, bring us that wealth which conquers in battles.

original: tvaṃ hi satyo adbhuto dātā vājasya gomataḥ //🔽viśve hi tvā sajoṣaso janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi satyaḥ adbhutaḥ dātā vājasya gomataḥ  viśve hi tvā sajoṣasaḥ janāsaḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: For thou art true, wondrous, the giver of strength rich in cattle.🔽For all the people, of one mind, with trimmed grass,

original: hotāraṃ sadmasu priyaṃ vyanti vāryā puru //
analyzed: hotāram sadmasu priyam vyanti vāryā puru
translated: choose thee as the dear Hotar in the abodes, for great boons.

original: sa hi ṣmā viśvacarṣaṇir abhimāti saho dadhe /🔽agna eṣu kṣayeṣv ā revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi //🔽agne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhavā varūthyaḥ //
analyzed: sa hi sma viśvacarṣaṇiḥ abhimāti sahaḥ dadhe  agne eṣu kṣayeṣu ā revat naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi  agne tvam naḥ antamaḥ uta trātā śivaḥ bhava varūthyaḥ
translated: For he, indeed, the all-impelling one, hath set himself to conquer the foe.🔽O Agni, shine thou forth in these abodes, O splendid one, shine thou forth, O glorious one.🔽O Agni, be thou our nearest friend, and a kind protector.

original: vasur agnir vasuśravā acchā nakṣi dyumattamaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ //🔽sa no bodhi śrudhī havam uruṣyā ṇo aghāyataḥ samasmāt //
analyzed: vasuḥ agniḥ vasu śravāḥ acchā nakṣi dyumattamam rayim dāḥ  sa naḥ bodhi śrudhi havam uruṣyā naḥ aghāyataḥ samasmāt
translated: Agni is the good, of good fame, come to the best light, give us wealth.🔽Do thou be our protector, hear our call, guard us from the sinner.

original: taṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ //
analyzed: tam tvā śociṣṭha dīdivas sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ
translated: We now invoke thee, O most radiant one, for bliss, for our friends.

original: acchā vo agnim avase devaṃ gāsi sa no vasuḥ /
analyzed: acchā vaḥ agnim avase devam gāsi sa naḥ vasuḥ
translated: I will sing to your Agni for help, to the god. May he, the good one,

original: rāsat putra ṛṣūṇām ṛtāvā parṣati dviṣaḥ //
analyzed: rāsat putraḥ ṛṣūṇām ṛtāvā parṣati dviṣaḥ
translated: give us the son of the Rishis, the truthful one, may he overcome the foes.

original: sa hi satyo yam pūrve cid devāsaś cid yam īdhire /
analyzed: sa hi satyaḥ yam pūrve cit devāsaḥ cit yam īdhire
translated: For he is the true one whom even the ancient gods have kindled.

original: hotāram mandrajihvam it sudītibhir vibhāvasum //
analyzed: hotāram mandra jihvam id su dītibhiḥ vibhāvasum
translated: The Hotar, with his sweet tongue, with his good lights, with his shining wealth.

original: sa no dhītī variṣṭhayā śreṣṭhayā ca sumatyā /
analyzed: sa naḥ dhītī variṣṭhayā śreṣṭhayā ca sumatyā
translated: May he with his most excellent wisdom and best favouring grace,

original: agne rāyo didīhi naḥ suvṛktibhir vareṇya //
analyzed: agne rāyaḥ didīhi naḥ suvṛktibhiḥ vareṇya
translated: O Agni, grant us wealth with good offerings, O most excellent one.

original: agnir deveṣu rājaty agnir marteṣv āviśan /
analyzed: agniḥ deveṣu rājati agniḥ marteṣu āviśan
translated: Agni rules among the gods, Agni has entered into mortals.

original: agnir no havyavāhano 'gniṃ dhībhiḥ saparyata //🔽agnis tuviśravastamaṃ tuvibrahmāṇam uttamam /
analyzed: agniḥ naḥ havya vāhanaḥ gnim dhībhiḥ saparyata  agniḥ tuvi śravastamam tuvi brahmāṇam uttamam
translated: Agni, the bearer of our oblations, honour Agni with our thoughts.🔽Agni gives to the worshipper a son who is most famous, most powerful,

original: atūrtaṃ śrāvayatpatim putraṃ dadāti dāśuṣe //
analyzed: a tūrtam śrāvayat patim putram dadāti dāśuṣe
translated: most excellent, who is never defeated, who is the lord of what is heard.

original: agnir dadāti satpatiṃ sāsāha yo yudhā nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ dadāti sat patim sāsāha yaḥ yudhā nṛbhiḥ
translated: Agni gives a good lord, who conquers in battle with men.

original: agnir atyaṃ raghuṣyadaṃ jetāram aparājitam //🔽yad vāhiṣṭhaṃ tad agnaye bṛhad arca vibhāvaso /🔽mahiṣīva tvad rayis tvad vājā ud īrate //
analyzed: agniḥ atyam raghuṣyadam jetāram aparājitam  yat vāhiṣṭham tat agnaye bṛhat arca vibhāvaso  mahiṣī iva tvat rayiḥ tvat vājāḥ ud īrate
translated: Agni gives a swift horse, a winner, an undefeated one.🔽What is best, that is for Agni, O Agni of great light,🔽like a cow your wealth, from you the powers rise up.

original: tava dyumanto arcayo grāvevocyate bṛhat /
analyzed: tava dyumantaḥ arcayaḥ grāvā iva ucyate bṛhat
translated: Your brilliant flames, O Agni, are proclaimed like a stone, great.

original: uto te tanyatur yathā svāno arta tmanā divaḥ //
analyzed: uta u te tanyatuḥ yathā svānaḥ arta tmanā divaḥ
translated: And your thunder, like the sound of heaven, is to be praised by itself.

original: evāṃ agniṃ vasūyavaḥ sahasānaṃ vavandima /
analyzed: eva ān agnim vasūyavaḥ sahasānam vavandima
translated: Thus we, seeking wealth, have worshipped Agni, the conqueror.

original: sa no viśvā ati dviṣaḥ parṣan nāveva sukratuḥ //🔽agne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā /
analyzed: sa naḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ parṣat nāvā iva su kratuḥ  agne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā
translated: May he, very wise, carry us over all enmities, as in a boat.🔽O Agni, O purifying one, with your brilliant, divine tongue,

original: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca //
analyzed: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
translated: bring the gods and worship them.

original: taṃ tvā ghṛtasnav īmahe citrabhāno svardṛśam /
analyzed: tam tvā ghṛtasno īmahe citrabhāno svar dṛśam
translated: We implore thee, O Agni, who art rich in ghee, of wondrous light, who seest the light,

original: devāṃ ā vītaye vaha //
analyzed: devān ā vītaye vaha
translated: To bring the gods to our feast.

original: vītihotraṃ tvā kave dyumantaṃ sam idhīmahi /🔽agne bṛhantam adhvare //
analyzed: vītihotram tvā kave dyumantam sam idhīmahi  agne bṛhantam adhvare
translated: Thee, O sage, the priest of the people, the glorious one, we kindle,🔽O Agni, the great one at the sacrifice.

original: agne viśvebhir ā gahi devebhir havyadātaye /
analyzed: agne viśvebhiḥ ā gahi devebhiḥ havya dātaye
translated: O Agni, come with all the gods to receive the oblation;

original: hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose thee as our Hotar.

original: yajamānāya sunvata āgne suvīryaṃ vaha /
analyzed: yajamānāya sunvate ā agne su vīryam vaha
translated: O Agni, bring heroic strength to the sacrificer who presses (the Soma),

original: devair ā satsi barhiṣi //
analyzed: devaiḥ ā satsi barhiṣi
translated: Sit on the strew with the gods.

original: samidhānaḥ sahasrajid agne dharmāṇi puṣyasi /
analyzed: samidhānaḥ sahasra jit agne dharmāṇi puṣyasi
translated: O Agni, kindled, thou who conquerest a thousand, thou prosperest the laws of the gods,

original: devānāṃ dūta ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: devānām dūtaḥ ukthyaḥ
translated: The messenger of the gods, worthy of praise.

original: ny agniṃ jātavedasaṃ hotravāhaṃ yaviṣṭhyam /🔽dadhātā devam ṛtvijam //
analyzed: ni agnim jātavedasam hotra vāham yaviṣṭhyam  dadhāta devam ṛtvijam
translated: I place Agni Jâtavedas, the bearer of the oblation, the youngest,🔽The god, the priest, the disposer.

original: pra yajña etv ānuṣag adyā devavyacastamaḥ /
analyzed: pra yajñaḥ etu ānuṣak adyā deva vyacastamaḥ
translated: Let the sacrifice go forward in due order today, most divine,

original: stṛṇīta barhir āsade //
analyzed: stṛṇīta barhiḥ āsade
translated: Strew the strew for the sitting.

original: edam maruto aśvinā mitraḥ sīdantu varuṇaḥ /
analyzed: ā idam marutaḥ aśvinā mitraḥ sīdantu varuṇaḥ
translated: Here, O Maruts, O Asvins, may Mitra, Varuṇa,

original: devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā //
analyzed: devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā
translated: The gods, with all their people, sit down.

original: anasvantā satpatir māmahe me gāvā cetiṣṭho asuro maghonaḥ /
analyzed: anasvantā satpatiḥ māmahe me gāvā cetiṣṭhaḥ asuraḥ maghonaḥ
translated: The lord of the brave, the Asura, most bountiful, the possessor of the best cows, the wealthy one,

original: traivṛṣṇo agne daśabhiḥ sahasrair vaiśvānara tryaruṇaś ciketa //
analyzed: traivṛṣṇaḥ agne daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ vaiśvānara tri aruṇaḥ ciketa
translated: O Agni Vaiṣvânara, the son of three dawns, has thought with ten thousand (cows).

original: yo me śatā ca viṃśatiṃ ca gonāṃ harī ca yuktā sudhurā dadāti /
analyzed: yaḥ me śatā ca viṃśatim ca gonām harī ca yuktā su dhurā dadāti
translated: He who gives me a hundred and twenty cows, and two swift and well-harnessed bay horses,

original: vaiśvānara suṣṭuto vāvṛdhāno 'gne yaccha tryaruṇāya śarma //
analyzed: vaiśvānara suṣṭutaḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ gne yaccha tryaruṇāya śarma
translated: O Vaiśvānara Agni, well-praised and grown strong, grant protection to the one with three red horses.

original: evā te agne sumatiṃ cakāno naviṣṭhāya navamaṃ trasadasyuḥ /
analyzed: eva te agne sumatim cakānaḥ naviṣṭhāya navamam trasadasyuḥ
translated: Thus Trasadasyu, longing for your favor, O Agni, to the newest one, the ninth,

original: yo me giras tuvijātasya pūrvīr yuktenābhi tryaruṇo gṛṇāti //
analyzed: yaḥ me giraḥ tuvi jātasya pūrvīḥ yuktena abhi tri aruṇaḥ gṛṇāti
translated: Who with a yoked (chariot) praises the many songs of the greatly born one, the one with three red horses.

original: yo ma iti pravocaty aśvamedhāya sūraye /
analyzed: yaḥ me iti pravocati aśvamedhāya sūraye
translated: He who speaks to me thus for the sake of the horse sacrifice, the sun,

original: dadad ṛcā saniṃ yate dadan medhām ṛtāyate //
