analyzed: dadat ṛcā sanim yate dadat medhām ṛtāyate
translated: Giving the Ṛc-reciter strength, giving wisdom to the one who is truthful.

original: yasya mā paruṣāḥ śatam uddharṣayanty ukṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: yasya mā paruṣāḥ śatam ud harṣayanti ukṣaṇaḥ
translated: Whose hundred rough (oxen) make me tremble, the oxen,

original: aśvamedhasya dānāḥ somā iva tryāśiraḥ //
analyzed: aśvamedhasya dānāḥ somāḥ iva tri āśiraḥ
translated: The gifts of the horse sacrifice, like the Soma juices of the one with three peaks.

original: indrāgnī śatadāvny aśvamedhe suvīryam /
analyzed: indra agnī śatadāvni aśvamedhe su vīryam
translated: O Indra and Agni, at the horse sacrifice, the one with a hundred gifts,

original: kṣatraṃ dhārayatam bṛhad divi sūryam ivājaram //
analyzed: kṣatram dhārayatam bṛhat divi sūryam iva ajaram
translated: Uphold the great princely power, like the imperishable sun in the sky.

original: samiddho agnir divi śocir aśret pratyaṅṅ uṣasam urviyā vi bhāti /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ divi śociḥ aśret pratyaṅ uṣasam urviyā vi bhāti
translated: Agni, kindled, his radiance shines in the sky, he shines in the west, extending over the dawn.

original: eti prācī viśvavārā namobhir devāṃ īḷānā haviṣā ghṛtācī //
analyzed: eti prācī viśva vārā namobhiḥ devān īḍānā haviṣā ghṛtācī
translated: He goes to the east, the one who fulfills all desires, with salutations, inviting the gods, the one who offers ghee.

original: samidhyamāno amṛtasya rājasi haviṣ kṛṇvantaṃ sacase svastaye /
analyzed: samidhyamānaḥ amṛtasya rājasi haviṣ kṛṇvantam sacase svastaye
translated: Being kindled, you rule as king of the immortal, you attend on the one who makes the offering for the sake of well-being.

original: viśvaṃ sa dhatte draviṇaṃ yam invasy ātithyam agne ni ca dhatta it puraḥ //
analyzed: viśvam sa dhatte draviṇam yam invasi ātithyam agne ni ca dhatte id puras
translated: He supports all wealth, he whom thou quickenest: Agni, thou settest in the house the guest.

original: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāny uttamāni santu /🔽saṃ jāspatyaṃ suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭhā mahāṃsi //
analyzed: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāni uttamāni santu  sam jāspatyam suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭha mahāṃsi
translated: O Agni, strive for great good fortune: let thy glories be most excellent.🔽Make thou our rule of life easy to govern: overcome the great hostilities of our foes.🔽Of thee, O Agni, well-kindled, I praise the glory, the most mighty.

original: samiddhasya pramahaso 'gne vande tava śriyam /🔽vṛṣabho dyumnavāṃ asi sam adhvareṣv idhyase //
analyzed: samiddhasya pramahasaḥ gne vande tava śriyam  vṛṣabhaḥ dyumnavān asi sam adhvareṣu idhyase
translated: Thou art the bull, the glorious: thou art kindled in the sacrifices.

original: samiddho agna āhuta devān yakṣi svadhvara /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agne āhuta devān yakṣi su adhvara
translated: Well-kindled, O Agni, offered to, worship the Gods, O thou of true ordinances;

original: tvaṃ hi havyavāḷ asi //
analyzed: tvam hi havyavāṭ asi
translated: For thou art the carrier of the oblation.

original: ā juhotā duvasyatāgnim prayaty adhvare /
analyzed: ā juhota ā duvasyata agnim prayati adhvare
translated: Come hither, O ye worshippers, and serve Agni when the sacrifice is begun.

original: vṛṇīdhvaṃ havyavāhanam //
analyzed: vṛṇīdhvam havyavāhanam
translated: Choose ye the bearer of the oblation.

original: try aryamā manuṣo devatātā trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta /
analyzed: trī aryamā manuṣaḥ devatātā trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta
translated: Aryaman, the God, is thrice honoured by men: three luminous realms of heaven he upholds.

original: arcanti tvā marutaḥ pūtadakṣās tvam eṣām ṛṣir indrāsi dhīraḥ //
analyzed: arcanti tvā marutaḥ pūta dakṣāḥ tvam eṣām ṛṣiḥ indra asi dhīraḥ
translated: The Maruts, with pure strength, sing thy praise: thou art their sage, their wise, O Indra.

original: anu yad īm maruto mandasānam ārcann indram papivāṃsaṃ sutasya /
analyzed: anu yat īm marutaḥ mandasānam ārcan indram papivāṃsam sutasya
translated: When the joyous Maruts sing to Indra who hath drunk of the juice,

original: ādatta vajram abhi yad ahiṃ hann apo yahvīr asṛjat sartavā u //
analyzed: ādatta vajram abhi yat ahim han apaḥ yahvīḥ asṛjat sartavai u
translated: He taketh up the bolt to slay the Dragon, and letteth loose the young and vigorous waters.

original: uta brahmāṇo maruto me asyendraḥ somasya suṣutasya peyāḥ /
analyzed: uta brahmāṇaḥ marutaḥ me asya indraḥ somasya suṣutasya peyāḥ
translated: And the Brahmans, and the Maruts, and Indra, are to drink of my well-pressed Soma.

original: tad dhi havyam manuṣe gā avindad ahann ahim papivāṃ indro asya //
analyzed: tat hi havyam manuṣe gāḥ avindat ahan ahim papivān indraḥ asya
translated: For that is the offering which he found for man: Indra, having drunk, slew the dragon.

original: ād rodasī vitaraṃ vi ṣkabhāyat saṃvivyānaś cid bhiyase mṛgaṃ kaḥ /
analyzed: āt rodasī vitaram vi skabhāyat saṃvivyānaḥ cit bhiyase mṛgam kaḥ
translated: He hath stretched out the two world-halves, the wide expanse, and the beast for fear, even when united.

original: jigartim indro apajargurāṇaḥ prati śvasantam ava dānavaṃ han //
analyzed: jigartim indraḥ apajargurāṇaḥ prati śvasantam ava dānavam han
translated: Indra, having slain the dragon, hath slain the Dânava who breathed against him.

original: adha kratvā maghavan tubhyaṃ devā anu viśve adaduḥ somapeyam /
analyzed: adha kratvā maghavan tubhyam devāḥ anu viśve adaduḥ soma peyam
translated: Now, O Maghavan, the All-Gods have granted thee the drinking of the Soma for thy wisdom.

original: yat sūryasya haritaḥ patantīḥ puraḥ satīr uparā etaśe kaḥ //
analyzed: yat sūryasya haritaḥ patantīḥ puras satīḥ uparāḥ etaśe kaḥ
translated: When the two bay steeds of Sûrya, flying forward, are set in front, and the two are above Etaṣa.

original: nava yad asya navatiṃ ca bhogān sākaṃ vajreṇa maghavā vivṛścat /
analyzed: nava yat asya navatim ca bhogān sākam vajreṇa maghavā vivṛścat
translated: When Maghavan with his wisdom hath rent asunder his nine-and-ninety stalls.

original: arcantīndram marutaḥ sadhasthe traiṣṭubhena vacasā bādhata dyām //
analyzed: arcanti indram marutaḥ sadhasthe traiṣṭubhena vacasā bādhata dyām
translated: The Maruts in the place of worship sing to Indra, and with the Tristubh hymn restrain the sky.

original: sakhā sakhye apacat tūyam agnir asya kratvā mahiṣā trī śatāni /
analyzed: sakhā sakhye apacat tūyam agniḥ asya kratvā mahiṣā trī śatāni
translated: The friend hath quickly cooked his food for his friend: through his wisdom the three hundred buffaloes.

original: trī sākam indro manuṣaḥ sarāṃsi sutam pibad vṛtrahatyāya somam //
analyzed: trī sākam indraḥ manuṣaḥ sarāṃsi sutam pibat vṛtra hatyāya somam
translated: Indra with the three lakes of men hath drunk the Soma pressed for him to slay Vr̥itra.

original: trī yac chatā mahiṣāṇām agho mās trī sarāṃsi maghavā somyāpāḥ /
analyzed: trī yat śatā mahiṣāṇām aghaḥ māḥ trī sarāṃsi maghavā somyā apāḥ
translated: The three hundred buffaloes, O Maghavan, the three lakes, the Soma-drinkers, are for me.

original: kāraṃ na viśve ahvanta devā bharam indrāya yad ahiṃ jaghāna //
analyzed: kāram na viśve ahvanta devāḥ bharam indrāya yat ahim jaghāna
translated: The All-Gods called for help when he slew the dragon, when he gave Indra the burden to bear.

original: uśanā yat sahasyair ayātaṃ gṛham indra jūjuvānebhir aśvaiḥ /
analyzed: uśanā yat sahasyaiḥ ayātam gṛham indra jūjuvānebhiḥ aśvaiḥ
translated: When, O Indra, with the impetuous horses, with the Sahasya ones, you came to the house,

original: vanvāno atra sarathaṃ yayātha kutsena devair avanor ha śuṣṇam //
analyzed: vanvānaḥ atra sa ratham yayātha kutsena devaiḥ avanoḥ ha śuṣṇam
translated: You came here with your chariot, to be won, to crush with Kutsa the gods, to slay Sushna.

original: prānyac cakram avṛhaḥ sūryasya kutsāyānyad varivo yātave 'kaḥ /
analyzed: pra anyat cakram avṛhaḥ sūryasya kutsāya anyat varivaḥ yātave kaḥ
translated: You have rolled away the other wheel of the sun, you have made the other free for Kutsa to move.

original: anāso dasyūṃr amṛṇo vadhena ni duryoṇa āvṛṇaṅ mṛdhravācaḥ //🔽stomāsas tvā gaurivīter avardhann arandhayo vaidathināya piprum /
analyzed: an āsaḥ dasyūṃr amṛṇaḥ vadhena ni duryoṇe āvṛṇak mṛdhra vācaḥ  stomāsaḥ tvā gaurivīteḥ avardhan arandhayaḥ vaidathināya piprum
translated: You have killed the Dasyus with your weapon, you have covered the wicked-speaking ones in their own abode.🔽The Stoma hymns have exalted you, the lord of the brown cows, you have helped Pipru for the sake of the son of Vadhri.

original: ā tvām ṛjiśvā sakhyāya cakre pacan paktīr apibaḥ somam asya //
analyzed: ā tvām ṛjiśvā sakhyāya cakre pacan paktīḥ apibaḥ somam asya
translated: Rijiksha has made you his friend, you have cooked his food, you have drunk his Soma.

original: navagvāsaḥ sutasomāsa indraṃ daśagvāso abhy arcanty arkaiḥ /
analyzed: navagvāsaḥ suta somāsaḥ indram daśagvāsaḥ abhī arcanti arkaiḥ
translated: The nine-versed and ten-versed ones, the pressers of Soma, praise Indra with hymns.

original: gavyaṃ cid ūrvam apidhānavantaṃ taṃ cin naraḥ śaśamānā apa vran //🔽katho nu te pari carāṇi vidvān vīryā maghavan yā cakartha /
analyzed: gavyam cit ūrvam apidhānavantam tam cit naraḥ śaśamānāḥ apa vran  kathā u nu te pari carāṇi vidvān vīryā maghavan yā cakartha
translated: Even the covered pasture of the cows, that also the men have obtained by worshipping.🔽How shall I, knowing, extol for you your deeds of prowess, O Maghavan, which you have done?

original: yā co nu navyā kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha pred u tā te vidatheṣu bravāma //
analyzed: yā ca u nu navyā kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha pra id u tā te vidatheṣu bravāma
translated: And what new deeds you will do, O Most Powerful, even those we will proclaim in the assemblies.

original: etā viśvā cakṛvāṃ indra bhūry aparīto januṣā vīryeṇa /
analyzed: etā viśvā cakṛvān indra bhūri aparītaḥ januṣā vīryeṇa
translated: O Indra, thou hast done all these things, unlimited by birth or might.

original: yā cin nu vajrin kṛṇavo dadhṛṣvān na te vartā taviṣyā asti tasyāḥ //
analyzed: yā cit nu vajrin kṛṇavaḥ dadhṛṣvān na te vartā taviṣyāḥ asti tasyāḥ
translated: Whatever thou, O wielder of the thunderbolt, hast done daringly, there is no turning back for thee from that.

original: indra brahma kriyamāṇā juṣasva yā te śaviṣṭha navyā akarma /
analyzed: indra brahma kriyamāṇā juṣasva yā te śaviṣṭha navyā akarma
translated: O Indra, rejoice in the prayers that are made to thee, O most powerful one, in the new rites.

original: vastreva bhadrā sukṛtā vasūyū rathaṃ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣam //
analyzed: vastrā iva bhadrā su kṛtā vasūyuḥ ratham na dhīraḥ su apāḥ atakṣam
translated: Like a well-made garment, like a chariot, I have fashioned thee, O self-moving one, for good fortune.

original: kva sya vīraḥ ko apaśyad indraṃ sukharatham īyamānaṃ haribhyām /
analyzed: kva sya vīraḥ kaḥ apaśyat indram sukha ratham īyamānam haribhyām
translated: Where is that hero who has seen Indra, going on his easy chariot drawn by the two bay horses,

original: yo rāyā vajrī sutasomam icchan tad oko gantā puruhūta ūtī //
analyzed: yaḥ rāyā vajrī suta somam icchan tat okaḥ gantā puruhūtaḥ ūtī
translated: The wielder of the thunderbolt, who, desiring wealth, goes to the Soma-presser's house, accompanied by many invoked ones?

original: avācacakṣam padam asya sasvar ugraṃ nidhātur anv āyam icchan /
analyzed: avācacakṣam padam asya sasvar ugram nidhātuḥ anu āyam icchan
translated: I have looked at his place, shining brightly, desiring to follow the path of the mighty one.

original: apṛccham anyāṃ uta te ma āhur indraṃ naro bubudhānā aśema //
analyzed: apṛccham anyām uta te me āhuḥ indram naraḥ bubudhānāḥ aśema
translated: I have asked others, and they have told me: Let us, O men, understand Indra.

original: pra nu vayaṃ sute yā te kṛtānīndra bravāma yāni no jujoṣaḥ /
analyzed: pra nu vayam sute yā te kṛtāni indra bravāma yāni naḥ jujoṣaḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, we will tell thee of the deeds thou hast done for us, which thou dost approve.

original: vedad avidvāñ chṛṇavac ca vidvān vahate 'yam maghavā sarvasenaḥ //
analyzed: vedat a vidvān śṛṇavat ca vidvān vahate yam maghavā sarva senaḥ
translated: The ignorant one knows not, the wise one hears: this bountiful one carries all his armies.

original: sthiram manaś cakṛṣe jāta indra veṣīd eko yudhaye bhūyasaś cit /
analyzed: sthiram manaḥ cakṛṣe jātaḥ indra veṣi id ekaḥ yudhaye bhūyasaḥ cit
translated: Thou hast made thy mind firm, O born Indra: alone thou seekest to fight with many.

original: aśmānaṃ cic chavasā didyuto vi vido gavām ūrvam usriyāṇām //
analyzed: aśmānam cit śavasā didyutaḥ vi vidaḥ gavām ūrvam usriyāṇām
translated: With might thou splittest the stone asunder, and findest the stall of the cows, of the milch-kine.

original: paro yat tvam parama ājaniṣṭhāḥ parāvati śrutyaṃ nāma bibhrat /
analyzed: paras yat tvam paramaḥ ājaniṣṭhāḥ parāvati śrutyam nāma bibhrat
translated: When thou wast born most remote of all, bearing a name to be heard afar in the farthest distance,

original: ataś cid indrād abhayanta devā viśvā apo ajayad dāsapatnīḥ //
analyzed: atas cit indrāt abhayanta devāḥ viśvāḥ apaḥ ajayat dāsa patnīḥ
translated: Even from that time the gods were afraid of Indra: he won all the waters, the wives of the Dâsa.

original: tubhyed ete marutaḥ suśevā arcanty arkaṃ sunvanty andhaḥ /
analyzed: tubhya id ete marutaḥ su śevāḥ arcanti arkam sunvanti andhaḥ
translated: To thee, O thou of fair gifts, these Maruts sing the hymn, and press the juice in the vat.

original: ahim ohānam apa āśayānam pra māyābhir māyinaṃ sakṣad indraḥ //🔽vi ṣū mṛdho januṣā dānam invann ahan gavā maghavan saṃcakānaḥ /
analyzed: ahim ohānam apaḥ āśayānam pra māyābhiḥ māyinam sakṣat indraḥ  vi ṣū mṛdhaḥ januṣā dānam invan ahan gavā maghavan saṃcakānaḥ
translated: Indra with his powers overcame the enchanter, the serpent, the dweller in the waters.🔽Thou, O bountiful one, having by nature destroyed the enemies, hast slain the bull, O Indra.

original: atrā dāsasya namuceḥ śiro yad avartayo manave gātum icchan //
analyzed: atrā dāsasya namuceḥ śiraḥ yat avartayaḥ manave gātum icchan
translated: Here, when thou wouldst give passage to Manu, thou didst roll away the head of the Dâsa Namuci.

original: yujaṃ hi mām akṛthā ād id indra śiro dāsasya namucer mathāyan /
analyzed: yujam hi mām akṛthāḥ āt id indra śiraḥ dāsasya namuceḥ mathāyan
translated: For thou hast made me thy comrade, O Indra, when thou didst crush the head of the Dâsa Namuci.

original: aśmānaṃ cit svaryaṃ vartamānam pra cakriyeva rodasī marudbhyaḥ //
analyzed: aśmānam cit svaryam vartamānam pra cakriyā iva rodasī marudbhyaḥ
translated: Even the stony heaven thou didst roll away, as 'twere a wheel, O Indra, for the Maruts.

original: striyo hi dāsa āyudhāni cakre kim mā karann abalā asya senāḥ /
analyzed: striyaḥ hi dāsaḥ āyudhāni cakre kim mā karan abalāḥ asya senāḥ
translated: The Dâsa made his women his weapons: what could the weak forces of his army do?

original: antar hy akhyad ubhe asya dhene athopa praid yudhaye dasyum indraḥ //
analyzed: antar hi akhyat ubhe asya dhene athā upa prait yudhaye dasyum indraḥ
translated: He hath encompassed both his milch-kine within him: then Indra went forth to battle with the Dâsa.

original: sam atra gāvo 'bhito 'navanteheha vatsair viyutā yad āsan /🔽saṃ tā indro asṛjad asya śākair yad īṃ somāsaḥ suṣutā amandan //
analyzed: sam atra gāvaḥ bhitas navanta iha iha vatsaiḥ viyutāḥ yat āsan  sam tāḥ indraḥ asṛjat asya śākaiḥ yat īm somāsaḥ suṣutāḥ amandan
translated: Here the cows have come together from all sides, separated from their calves, as they were here.🔽Indra has united them with his own cattle, when the well-pressed Soma juices delighted him.

original: yad īṃ somā babhrudhūtā amandann aroravīd vṛṣabhaḥ sādaneṣu /
analyzed: yat īm somāḥ babhru dhūtāḥ amandan aroravīt vṛṣabhaḥ sādaneṣu
translated: When the Soma juices, mixed with curds, delighted him, the bull roared in the assemblies.

original: purandaraḥ papivāṃ indro asya punar gavām adadād usriyāṇām //
analyzed: purandaraḥ papivān indraḥ asya punar gavām adadāt usriyāṇām
translated: Indra, the drinker, gave back to him the cows, the milch cows, of Rusama.

original: bhadram idaṃ ruśamā agne akran gavāṃ catvāri dadataḥ sahasrā /
analyzed: bhadram idam ruśamāḥ agne akran gavām catvāri dadataḥ sahasrā
translated: This good deed the Rusamas have done to you, O Agni, in giving four thousand cows.

original: ṛṇañcayasya prayatā maghāni praty agrabhīṣma nṛtamasya nṛṇām //
analyzed: ṛṇañcayasya prayatā maghāni prati agrabhīṣma nṛtamasya nṛṇām
translated: We have accepted the gifts of Rñcayi, the best of men, the most truthful of men.

original: supeśasam māva sṛjanty astaṃ gavāṃ sahasrai ruśamāso agne /
analyzed: supeśasam mā ava sṛjanti astam gavām sahasraiḥ ruśamāsaḥ agne
translated: The Rusamas, O Agni, do not let go the well-formed one, with thousands of cows.

original: tīvrā indram amamanduḥ sutāso 'ktor vyuṣṭau paritakmyāyāḥ //
analyzed: tīvrāḥ indram amamanduḥ sutāsaḥ ktoḥ vyuṣṭau paritakmyāyāḥ
translated: The strong Soma juices have delighted Indra, at the rising of the sun, at the end of the night.

original: aucchat sā rātrī paritakmyā yāṃ ṛṇañcaye rājani ruśamānām /🔽atyo na vājī raghur ajyamāno babhruś catvāry asanat sahasrā //
analyzed: aucchat sā rātrī paritakmyā yām ṛṇañcaye rājani ruśamānām  atyaḥ na vājī raghuḥ ajyamānaḥ babhruḥ catvāri asanat sahasrā
translated: That night at the end of the night, when the Rusamas, in the kingdom of Rñcayi,🔽The swift horse, the swift one, when anointed, the brown one, has sat down on four thousand.

original: catuḥsahasraṃ gavyasya paśvaḥ praty agrabhīṣma ruśameṣv agne /
analyzed: catur sahasram gavyasya paśvaḥ prati agrabhīṣma ruśameṣu agne
translated: We have accepted the four thousand head of cattle, the cows, among the Rusamas, O Agni.

original: gharmaś cit taptaḥ pravṛje ya āsīd ayasmayas tam v ādāma viprāḥ //
analyzed: gharmaḥ cit taptaḥ pravṛje yaḥ āsīt ayasmayaḥ tam u ādāma viprāḥ
translated: Even the heated iron which was the heated iron which was the cauldron, that we, the priests, take away.

original: indro rathāya pravataṃ kṛṇoti yam adhyasthān maghavā vājayantam /
analyzed: indraḥ rathāya pravatam kṛṇoti yam adhyasthāt maghavā vājayantam
translated: Indra makes the path for the chariot which the bountiful one mounts, which is urged on for booty,

original: yūtheva paśvo vy unoti gopā ariṣṭo yāti prathamaḥ siṣāsan //
analyzed: yūthā iva paśvaḥ vi unoti gopāḥ ariṣṭaḥ yāti prathamaḥ siṣāsan
translated: like a herdsman he drives away the cattle, uninjured he goes first, striving for the prize.

original: ā pra drava harivo mā vi venaḥ piśaṅgarāte abhi naḥ sacasva /
analyzed: ā pra drava harivas mā vi venaḥ piśaṅga rāte abhi naḥ sacasva
translated: Rush forward, O you who bring the tawny ones, do not be slow, be with us, O you who give the tawny ones.

original: nahi tvad indra vasyo anyad asty amenāṃś cij janivataś cakartha //
analyzed: nahi tvat indra vasyaḥ anyat asti amenān cit janivataḥ cakartha
translated: For there is no better thing than you, O Indra, you have made even the unfriendly friendly.

original: ud yat sahaḥ sahasa ājaniṣṭa dediṣṭa indra indriyāṇi viśvā /
analyzed: ud yat sahaḥ sahasaḥ ājaniṣṭa dediṣṭe indraḥ indriyāṇi viśvā
translated: When the strength of a thousand was born together, Indra bestowed all his powers, O Indra.

original: prācodayat sudughā vavre antar vi jyotiṣā saṃvavṛtvat tamo 'vaḥ //
analyzed: prācodayat sudughāḥ vavre antar vi jyotiṣā saṃvavṛtvat tamaḥ vaḥ
translated: He set in motion the well-milking (cow), he filled the womb, he surrounded the light, he removed the darkness.

original: anavas te ratham aśvāya takṣan tvaṣṭā vajram puruhūta dyumantam /
analyzed: anavaḥ te ratham aśvāya takṣan tvaṣṭā vajram puruhūta dyumantam
translated: They fashioned your chariot, O Indra, for the horse, Tvastr fashioned the mighty thunderbolt, O you who are invoked by many.

original: brahmāṇa indram mahayanto arkair avardhayann ahaye hantavā u //
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ indram mahayantaḥ arkaiḥ avardhayan ahaye hantavai u
translated: The Brahmans, extolling Indra with hymns, magnified him, they increased him for the slaying of the foe.

original: vṛṣṇe yat te vṛṣaṇo arkam arcān indra grāvāṇo aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣṇe yat te vṛṣaṇaḥ arkam arcān indra grāvāṇaḥ aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: When the mighty ones praise your praise, O Indra, the pressing-stones, O Indra, and Aditi of one mind,

original: anaśvāso ye pavayo 'rathā indreṣitā abhy avartanta dasyūn //
analyzed: an aśvāsaḥ ye pavayaḥ rathāḥ indra iṣitāḥ abhī avartanta dasyūn
translated: The swift ones who are without horses, without chariots, sent forth by Indra, have turned back the Dasyus.

original: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni vocam pra nūtanā maghavan yā cakartha /
analyzed: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni vocam pra nūtanā maghavan yā cakartha
translated: I will tell of thy former deeds, and of the new ones, O Maghavan, which thou hast done.

original: śaktīvo yad vibharā rodasī ubhe jayann apo manave dānucitrāḥ //
analyzed: śaktīvas yat vibharāḥ rodasī ubhe jayan apaḥ manave dānu citrāḥ
translated: When thou didst bear the two world-halves asunder with might, and didst give the waters to Manu, wondrous in bounty, having conquered.

original: tad in nu te karaṇaṃ dasma viprāhiṃ yad ghnann ojo atrāmimīthāḥ /
analyzed: tat id nu te karaṇam dasma vipra ahim yat ghnan ojaḥ atra āmimīthāḥ
translated: This is thy deed, O wondrous one, O sage, when thou didst measure out thy strength here, O thou who slayest.

original: śuṣṇasya cit pari māyā agṛbhṇāḥ prapitvaṃ yann apa dasyūṃr asedhaḥ //
analyzed: śuṣṇasya cit pari māyāḥ agṛbhṇāḥ prapitvam yan apa dasyūṃr asedhaḥ
translated: Thou hast seized the magic of even the wicked one, when thou didst drive away the Dasyus, O thou who art to be invoked.

original: tvam apo yadave turvaśāyāramayaḥ sudughāḥ pāra indra /
analyzed: tvam apaḥ yadave turvaśāya aramayaḥ su dughāḥ pāre indra
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast made the well-milking cows to be milked for Yadu and Turvaga on the farther shore.

original: ugram ayātam avaho ha kutsaṃ saṃ ha yad vām uśanāranta devāḥ //
analyzed: ugram ayātam avahaḥ ha kutsam sam ha yat vām uśanā aranta devāḥ
translated: Ye have brought Kuṭsa, the mighty one, to help, when the gods have sent you to him, O ye who delight in the offered (sacrificial food).

original: indrākutsā vahamānā rathenā vām atyā api karṇe vahantu /
analyzed: indrākutsā vahamānā rathena ā vām atyāḥ api karṇe vahantu
translated: May the two of you, Indra and Kuṭsa, borne on the chariot, carry him to the ear,

original: niḥ ṣīm adbhyo dhamatho niḥ ṣadhasthān maghono hṛdo varathas tamāṃsi //
analyzed: niḥ sīm adbhyaḥ dhamathaḥ niḥ sadhasthāt maghonaḥ hṛdaḥ varathaḥ tamāṃsi
translated: Ye have driven away the waters, ye have driven away the demons from their abode. Ye have cast away the hearts of the rich, the darkness.

original: vātasya yuktān suyujaś cid aśvān kaviś cid eṣo ajagann avasyuḥ /
analyzed: vātasya yuktān su yujaḥ cit aśvān kaviḥ cit eṣaḥ ajagan avasyuḥ
translated: The sage has come, the one who is to be invoked, with the well-yoked horses of Vāta, even with the well-yoked ones.

original: viśve te atra marutaḥ sakhāya indra brahmāṇi taviṣīm avardhan //
analyzed: viśve te atra marutaḥ sakhāyaḥ indra brahmāṇi taviṣīm avardhan
translated: All the Maruts here are thy friends, O Indra. The prayers have increased thy strength.

original: sūraś cid ratham paritakmyāyām pūrvaṃ karad uparaṃ jūjuvāṃsam /
analyzed: sūraḥ cit ratham paritakmyāyām pūrvam karat uparam jūjuvāṃsam
translated: Even the sun has made the chariot go first in the battle against darkness, the one that is to be invoked.

original: bharac cakram etaśaḥ saṃ riṇāti puro dadhat saniṣyati kratuṃ naḥ //
analyzed: bharat cakram etaśaḥ sam riṇāti puras dadhat saniṣyati kratum naḥ
translated: The wheel-bearer, the swift one, hurls the wheel, placing it in front, will accomplish our sacrifice.

original: āyaṃ janā abhicakṣe jagāmendraḥ sakhāyaṃ sutasomam icchan /
analyzed: ā ayam janāḥ abhicakṣe jagāma indraḥ sakhāyam suta somam icchan
translated: This people have come to behold Indra, who has come desiring a friend who has pressed Soma.

original: vadan grāvāva vedim bhriyāte yasya jīram adhvaryavaś caranti //
analyzed: vadan grāvā ava vedim bhriyāte yasya jīram adhvaryavaḥ caranti
translated: The pressing stone speaks, it is carried to the altar, for whom the Adhvaryus move about in the dust.

original: ye cākananta cākananta nū te martā amṛta mo te aṃha āran /
analyzed: ye cākananta cākananta nu te martāḥ amṛta mā u te aṃhaḥ āran
translated: Those who have desired, have desired, now you mortals, O immortal one, have not brought harm to you.

original: vāvandhi yajyūṃr uta teṣu dhehy ojo janeṣu yeṣu te syāma //
analyzed: vāvandhi yajyūṃr uta teṣu dhehi ojaḥ janeṣu yeṣu te syāma
translated: Bind the sacrificers, and place strength in those people among whom we may be.

original: adardar utsam asṛjo vi khāni tvam arṇavān badbadhānāṃ aramṇāḥ /
analyzed: adardar utsam asṛjaḥ vi khāni tvam arṇavān badbadhānām aramṇāḥ
translated: You have burst open the spring, you have opened the openings, you have made the swollen waters of the ocean powerless.

original: mahāntam indra parvataṃ vi yad vaḥ sṛjo vi dhārā ava dānavaṃ han //🔽tvam utsāṃ ṛtubhir badbadhānāṃ araṃha ūdhaḥ parvatasya vajrin /
analyzed: mahāntam indra parvatam vi yat var sṛjaḥ vi dhārāḥ ava dānavam han  tvam utsām ṛtubhiḥ badbadhānām araṃhaḥ ūdhaḥ parvatasya vajrin
translated: O great Indra, when you released the great mountain, you released the streams, you killed the demon.🔽You, O wielder of the thunderbolt, with the seasons have made the swollen waters of the spring powerless, the waters of the mountain.

original: ahiṃ cid ugra prayutaṃ śayānaṃ jaghanvāṃ indra taviṣīm adhatthāḥ //
analyzed: ahim cit ugra prayutam śayānam jaghanvān indra taviṣīm adhatthāḥ
translated: You, O fierce one, have placed your power in the belly of the Ahi, the sleeping one, O Indra.

original: tyasya cin mahato nir mṛgasya vadhar jaghāna taviṣībhir indraḥ /
analyzed: tyasya cit mahataḥ niḥ mṛgasya vadhar jaghāna taviṣībhiḥ indraḥ
translated: Even of that great wild beast, Indra has killed the killer with his powers.

original: ya eka id apratir manyamāna ād asmād anyo ajaniṣṭa tavyān //
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id apratiḥ manyamānaḥ āt asmāt anyaḥ ajaniṣṭa tavyān
translated: He who alone, thinking himself invincible, has been born from this one, more powerful than you.

original: tyaṃ cid eṣāṃ svadhayā madantam miho napātaṃ suvṛdhaṃ tamogām /
analyzed: tyam cit eṣām svadhayā madantam mihaḥ napātam suvṛdham tamaḥ gām
translated: Even him, who was rejoicing in his own nature, the son of the waters, the very powerful one, the one who goes in the darkness,

original: vṛṣaprabharmā dānavasya bhāmaṃ vajreṇa vajrī ni jaghāna śuṣṇam //
analyzed: vṛṣa prabharmā dānavasya bhāmam vajreṇa vajrī ni jaghāna śuṣṇam
translated: The wielder of the thunderbolt, with his thunderbolt, struck down the violent one, the Dānava's violence.

original: tyaṃ cid asya kratubhir niṣattam amarmaṇo vidad id asya marma /🔽yad īṃ sukṣatra prabhṛtā madasya yuyutsantaṃ tamasi harmye dhāḥ //
analyzed: tyam cit asya kratubhiḥ niṣattam amarmaṇaḥ vidat id asya marma  yat īm su kṣatra prabhṛtā madasya yuyutsantam tamasi harmye dhāḥ
translated: Even him, who was firmly established by his own will, he, the one without a wound, found his wound,🔽When, O Suṣravas, you placed the one who was eager to fight in the darkness of intoxication in the house.

original: tyaṃ cid itthā katpayaṃ śayānam asūrye tamasi vāvṛdhānam /
analyzed: tyam cit itthā katpayam śayānam asūrye tamasi vāvṛdhānam
translated: Even him, who was lying there in this way, being nourished, in the darkness of the sunless one,

original: taṃ cin mandāno vṛṣabhaḥ sutasyoccair indro apagūryā jaghāna //
analyzed: tam cit mandānaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ sutasya uccais indraḥ apagūrya jaghāna
translated: The bull, intoxicated with the drink, Indra, having roared loudly, struck down the one who was to be overcome.

original: ud yad indro mahate dānavāya vadhar yamiṣṭa saho apratītam /
analyzed: ud yat indraḥ mahate dānavāya vadhar yamiṣṭa sahaḥ apratītam
translated: When Indra gave the great Dānava a blow, a blow that was not to be resisted,

original: yad īṃ vajrasya prabhṛtau dadābha viśvasya jantor adhamaṃ cakāra //🔽tyaṃ cid arṇam madhupaṃ śayānam asinvaṃ vavram mahy ādad ugraḥ /
analyzed: yat īm vajrasya prabhṛtau dadābha viśvasya jantoḥ adhamam cakāra  tyam cit arṇam madhupam śayānam asinvam vavram mahi ādat ugraḥ
translated: When he seized him in the throwing of the thunderbolt, he made him the lowest of all living beings.🔽Even the sweet honey-like water, which was lying down, the unmoving one, the great one, the fierce one took away.

original: apādam atram mahatā vadhena ni duryoṇa āvṛṇaṅ mṛdhravācam //
analyzed: a pādam atram mahatā vadhena ni duryoṇe āvṛṇak mṛdhra vācam
translated: The one without feet, the wicked one, with a great blow, he covered in the house, the one who spoke harshly.

original: ko asya śuṣmaṃ taviṣīṃ varāta eko dhanā bharate apratītaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ asya śuṣmam taviṣīm varāte ekaḥ dhanā bharate apratītaḥ
translated: Who alone, not to be resisted, brings forth the wealth of his impetuous strength and power?

original: ime cid asya jrayaso nu devī indrasyaujaso bhiyasā jihāte //
analyzed: ime cit asya jrayasaḥ nu devī indrasya ojasaḥ bhiyasā jihāte
translated: Even these, O Goddess, of his mighty powers, the powers of Indra, are to be feared.

original: ny asmai devī svadhitir jihīta indrāya gātur uśatīva yeme /
analyzed: ni asmai devī svadhitiḥ jihīte indrāya gātuḥ uśatī iva yeme
translated: The Goddess Svadha has turned to him, and the way to Indra has been made ready, as if eager.

original: saṃ yad ojo yuvate viśvam ābhir anu svadhāvne kṣitayo namanta //
analyzed: sam yat ojaḥ yuvate viśvam ābhiḥ anu svadhāvne kṣitayaḥ namanta
translated: When he gathers together all his strength with these (powers), the people bow to him who acts according to his own will.

original: ekaṃ nu tvā satpatim pāñcajanyaṃ jātaṃ śṛṇomi yaśasaṃ janeṣu /
analyzed: ekam nu tvā sat patim pāñcajanyam jātam śṛṇomi yaśasam janeṣu
translated: I hear of you, the one Lord of the people, born of the five peoples, as famous among the people.

original: tam me jagṛbhra āśaso naviṣṭhaṃ doṣā vastor havamānāsa indram //
analyzed: tam me jagṛbhre āśasaḥ naviṣṭham doṣā vastoḥ havamānāsaḥ indram
translated: I have taken hold of you, the youngest, as my protector, calling on Indra at evening and morning.

original: evā hi tvām ṛtuthā yātayantam maghā viprebhyo dadataṃ śṛṇomi /
analyzed: eva hi tvām ṛtuthā yātayantam maghā viprebhyaḥ dadatam śṛṇomi
translated: For I hear that they who are to be served in due season call on you, O bountiful one, who grant riches to the priests.

original: kiṃ te brahmāṇo gṛhate sakhāyo ye tvāyā nidadhuḥ kāmam indra //
analyzed: kim te brahmāṇaḥ sakhāyaḥ ye tvāyā nidadhuḥ kāmam indra
translated: What do your Brahman friends do for you, O Indra, who have placed their desire in you?

original: mahi mahe tavase dīdhye nṝn indrāyetthā tavase atavyān /
analyzed: mahi mahe tavase dīdhye nṝn indrāya itthā tavase a tavyān
translated: I think of the great for the great powerful one, the powerless for Indra here, the powerful one.

original: yo asmai sumatiṃ vājasātau stuto jane samaryaś ciketa //
analyzed: yaḥ asmai sumatim vājasātau stutaḥ jane samaryaḥ ciketa
translated: He who has thought of him in the assembly of men, praised in the battle for booty, has won his favor.

original: sa tvaṃ na indra dhiyasāno arkair harīṇāṃ vṛṣan yoktram aśreḥ /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ indra dhiyasānaḥ arkaiḥ harīṇām vṛṣan yoktram aśreḥ
translated: You, O Indra, who are to be served by our thoughts and hymns, O bull, have yoked your two bay horses.

original: yā itthā maghavann anu joṣaṃ vakṣo abhi prāryaḥ sakṣi janān //
analyzed: yāḥ itthā maghavan anu joṣam vakṣaḥ abhi pra aryaḥ sakṣi janān
translated: O bountiful one, O worthy of sacrifice, you who are to be served, O Indra, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served, you who are to be served,

original: na te ta indrābhy asmad ṛṣvāyuktāso abrahmatā yad asan /
analyzed: na te te indra abhi asmat ṛṣvāḥ a yuktāsaḥ a brahma tā yat asan
translated: O Indra, they are not your friends who are not devoted to you, who are not devoted to the Brahmans.

original: tiṣṭhā ratham adhi taṃ vajrahastā raśmiṃ deva yamase svaśvaḥ //
analyzed: tiṣṭha ratham adhi tam vajra hasta ā raśmim deva yamase su aśvaḥ
translated: Mount that chariot, O wielder of the thunderbolt, O god, yoke your own excellent horses!

original: purū yat ta indra santy ukthā gave cakarthorvarāsu yudhyan /
analyzed: purū yat te indra santi ukthā gave cakartha urvarāsu yudhyan
translated: O Indra, many are your praises, you who have made the cattle your own in the battles over the fields.

original: tatakṣe sūryāya cid okasi sve vṛṣā samatsu dāsasya nāma cit //
analyzed: tatakṣe sūryāya cit okasi sve vṛṣā samatsu dāsasya nāma cit
translated: You have carved out even the abode of the sun, O bull, and have made even the name of the Dāsa insignificant in the battles.

original: vayaṃ te ta indra ye ca naraḥ śardho jajñānā yātāś ca rathāḥ /
analyzed: vayam te te indra ye ca naraḥ śardhaḥ jajñānāḥ yātāḥ ca rathāḥ
translated: O Indra, we are your men, and the hosts of men have been born, and the chariots have gone forth.

original: āsmāñ jagamyād ahiśuṣma satvā bhago na havyaḥ prabhṛtheṣu cāruḥ //
analyzed: ā asmām jagamyāt ahi śuṣma satvā bhagaḥ na havyaḥ prabhṛtheṣu cāruḥ
translated: Let him come to us, the one with the strength of a snake, as charming as Bhaga in the sacrifices, to be invoked.

original: papṛkṣeṇyam indra tve hy ojo nṛmṇāni ca nṛtamāno amartaḥ /
analyzed: papṛkṣeṇyam indra tve hi ojaḥ nṛmṇāni ca nṛtamānaḥ amartaḥ
translated: O Indra, your strength is to be desired, for you are immortal, delighting in manly deeds.

original: sa na enīṃ vasavāno rayiṃ dāḥ prārya stuṣe tuvimaghasya dānam //
analyzed: sa naḥ enīm vasavānaḥ rayim dāḥ pra aryaḥ stuṣe tuvi maghasya dānam
translated: Give us that variegated wealth, O wealthy one! I praise the gift of the very generous one.

original: evā na indrotibhir ava pāhi gṛṇataḥ śūra kārūn /🔽uta tvacaṃ dadato vājasātau piprīhi madhvaḥ suṣutasya cāroḥ //
analyzed: eva naḥ indra ūtibhiḥ ava pāhi gṛṇataḥ śūra kārūn  uta tvacam dadataḥ vājasātau piprīhi madhvaḥ suṣutasya cāroḥ
translated: Thus, O Indra, protect us with your powers, O hero, protect the singers, the priests.🔽And when the skin is offered in the battle for booty, delight in the sweetness of the well-pressed drink.

original: uta tye mā paurukutsyasya sūres trasadasyor hiraṇino rarāṇāḥ /
analyzed: uta tye mā paurukutsyasya sūreḥ trasadasyoḥ hiraṇinaḥ rarāṇāḥ
translated: And those of Purukutsa's son, O Trasadasyu, who are bestowing golden gifts,

original: vahantu mā daśa śyetāso asya gairikṣitasya kratubhir nu saśce //
analyzed: vahantu mā daśa śyetāsaḥ asya gairikṣitasya kratubhiḥ nu saśce
translated: May the ten dark-coloured (horses) of this all-ruling one carry me by the power of his thoughts.

original: uta tye mā mārutāśvasya śoṇāḥ kratvāmaghāso vidathasya rātau /
analyzed: uta tye mā mārutāśvasya śoṇāḥ kratvāmaghāsaḥ vidathasya rātau
translated: And may the red horses of the Maruts, the wise and impetuous ones, of this all-ruling one, at the feast of the sacrifice,

original: sahasrā me cyavatāno dadāna ānūkam aryo vapuṣe nārcat //
analyzed: sahasrā me cyavatānaḥ dadānaḥ ānūkam aryaḥ vapuṣe nā arcat
translated: give me a thousand, O you who are to be invoked, as a favour, for the sake of the beautiful body of the noble one.

original: uta tye mā dhvanyasya juṣṭā lakṣmaṇyasya suruco yatānāḥ /
analyzed: uta tye mā dhvanyasya juṣṭāḥ lakṣmaṇyasya su rucaḥ yatānāḥ
translated: And may these, dear to Dhvanin and Lakṣmaṇīya, the well-shining ones,

original: mahnā rāyaḥ saṃvaraṇasya ṛṣer vrajaṃ na gāvaḥ prayatā api gman //
analyzed: mahnā rāyaḥ saṃvaraṇasya ṛṣeḥ vrajam na gāvaḥ prayatāḥ api gman
translated: having come, for the sake of the great wealth of the sage Saṃvaraṇa, go to the cow-pen like cows that are let loose.

original: ajātaśatrum ajarā svarvaty anu svadhāmitā dasmam īyate /
analyzed: ajāta śatrum ajarā svarvatī anu svadhā amitā dasmam īyate
translated: The invincible one, the immortal one, the one from heaven, goes to the wondrous one, following its own nature.

original: sunotana pacata brahmavāhase puruṣṭutāya prataraṃ dadhātana //
analyzed: sunotana pacata brahma vāhase puruṣṭutāya prataram dadhātana
translated: Press out (the Soma), cook (the oblations) for the Brahman priest, give a passage to the much-praised one.

original: ā yaḥ somena jaṭharam apipratāmandata maghavā madhvo andhasaḥ /
analyzed: ā yaḥ somena jaṭharam apiprata amandata maghavā madhvaḥ andhasaḥ
translated: He who has filled his belly with Soma, the bountiful one, has rejoiced in the sweet juice of the Soma,

original: yad īm mṛgāya hantave mahāvadhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭim uśanā vadhaṃ yamat //
analyzed: yat īm mṛgāya hantave mahā vadhaḥ sahasra bhṛṣṭim uśanāḥ vadham yamat
translated: when for the sake of the deer, the great slayer, Uśanas gave him the weapon with a thousand points.

original: yo asmai ghraṃsa uta vā ya ūdhani somaṃ sunoti bhavati dyumāṃ aha /
analyzed: yaḥ asmai ghraṃse uta vā yaḥ ūdhani somam sunoti bhavati dyumān aha
translated: He who presses Soma for him, either in the trough or on the lap, becomes resplendent.

original: apāpa śakras tatanuṣṭim ūhati tanūśubhram maghavā yaḥ kavāsakhaḥ //
analyzed: apa apa śakraḥ tatanuṣṭim ūhati tanū śubhram maghavā yaḥ kavāsakhaḥ
translated: The sinless Śakra removes the affliction, the bountiful one, who has good companions, the beautiful body.

original: yasyāvadhīt pitaraṃ yasya mātaraṃ yasya śakro bhrātaraṃ nāta īṣate /🔽vetīd v asya prayatā yataṅkaro na kilbiṣād īṣate vasva ākaraḥ //
analyzed: yasya avadhīt pitaram yasya mātaram yasya śakraḥ bhrātaram na atas īṣate  veti id u asya prayatā yataṅkaraḥ na kilbiṣāt īṣate vasvaḥ ākaraḥ
translated: He who slew his father, he who slew his mother, he whom Indra does not fear as a brother,🔽He who knows his own mind, who is self-controlled, he does not fear from sin, he is a source of wealth.

original: na pañcabhir daśabhir vaṣṭy ārabhaṃ nāsunvatā sacate puṣyatā cana /
analyzed: na pañcabhiḥ daśabhiḥ vaṣṭi ārabham na a sunvatā sacate puṣyatā cana
translated: He does not favor the one who offers with five or ten, he does not associate with the one who does not offer, even if he is prosperous.

original: jināti ved amuyā hanti vā dhunir ā devayum bhajati gomati vraje //
analyzed: jināti vā id amuyā hanti vā dhuniḥ ā devayum bhajati gomati vraje
translated: He conquers with his own strength, he destroys with his own strength, the one who is devoted to the gods he favors with a herd of cattle.

original: vitvakṣaṇaḥ samṛtau cakramāsajo 'sunvato viṣuṇaḥ sunvato vṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: vitvakṣaṇaḥ samṛtau cakramāsajaḥ sunvataḥ viṣuṇaḥ sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ
translated: The one who punishes the wicked, the one who is wise in the two (truths), the one who is swift in action, the one who is hostile to the one who does not offer, the one who prospers the one who offers,

original: indro viśvasya damitā vibhīṣaṇo yathāvaśaṃ nayati dāsam āryaḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ viśvasya damitā vibhīṣaṇaḥ yathāvaśam nayati dāsam āryaḥ
translated: Indra, the tamer of all, the one who inspires fear, leads the slave according to his will, the noble one.

original: sam īm paṇer ajati bhojanam muṣe vi dāśuṣe bhajati sūnaraṃ vasu /
analyzed: sam īm paṇeḥ ajati bhojanam muṣe vi dāśuṣe bhajati sūnaram vasu
translated: He brings the food of the one who is to be fed, he takes away the food of the one who offers, he bestows beautiful wealth.

original: durge cana dhriyate viśva ā puru jano yo asya taviṣīm acukrudhat //
analyzed: durge cana dhriyate viśvaḥ ā puru janaḥ yaḥ asya taviṣīm acukrudhat
translated: Even in a difficult situation, he is supported by all, the people who have become angry with his power.

original: saṃ yaj janau sudhanau viśvaśardhasāv aved indro maghavā goṣu śubhriṣu /
analyzed: sam yat janau su dhanau viśva śardhasau avet indraḥ maghavā goṣu śubhriṣu
translated: When the two rich people, the two who have everything they need, are united, Indra, the wealthy one, knows about the white cows.

original: yujaṃ hy anyam akṛta pravepany ud īṃ gavyaṃ sṛjate satvabhir dhuniḥ //
analyzed: yujam hi anyam akṛta pravepanī ud īm gavyam sṛjate satvabhiḥ dhuniḥ
translated: For he has made another one tremble, the one who shakes, he sends forth the cattle with his own strength.

original: sahasrasām āgniveśiṃ gṛṇīṣe śatrim agna upamāṃ ketum aryaḥ /
analyzed: sahasra sām āgniveśim gṛṇīṣe śatrim agne upamām ketum aryaḥ
translated: I praise the thousand-winning, Agni-born, the enemy, Agni, the matchless, the banner of the noble.

original: tasmā āpaḥ saṃyataḥ pīpayanta tasmin kṣatram amavat tveṣam astu //
analyzed: tasmai āpaḥ saṃyataḥ pīpayanta tasmin kṣatram amavat tveṣam astu
translated: From him the waters, well-ordered, have flowed forth; in him may the imperishable, glorious power be.

original: yas te sādhiṣṭho 'vasa indra kratuṣ ṭam ā bhara /
analyzed: yaḥ te sādhiṣṭhaḥ vaso indra kratuḥ ṭam ā bhara
translated: O Indra, bring that power of thine which is best for us,

original: asmabhyaṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sasniṃ vājeṣu duṣṭaram //
analyzed: asmabhyam carṣaṇī saham sasnim vājeṣu duṣṭaram
translated: Which conquers men, which is strong, hard to overcome in battles.

original: yad indra te catasro yac chūra santi tisraḥ /
analyzed: yat indra te catasraḥ yat śūra santi tisraḥ
translated: O Indra, if thou hast four, O hero, or three,

original: yad vā pañca kṣitīnām avas tat su na ā bhara //
analyzed: yat vā pañca kṣitīnām avaḥ tat su naḥ ā bhara
translated: Or if thou hast five of the abodes, bring that to us.

original: ā te 'vo vareṇyaṃ vṛṣantamasya hūmahe /
analyzed: ā te vaḥ vareṇyam vṛṣantamasya hūmahe
translated: We call to thee for that most excellent help of thine, O mighty one.

original: vṛṣajūtir hi jajñiṣa ābhūbhir indra turvaṇiḥ //
analyzed: vṛṣa jūtiḥ hi jajñiṣe ābhūbhiḥ indra turvaṇiḥ
translated: For thou art born with strength, O Indra, for the sake of the people, for the sake of the Turvasas.

original: vṛṣā hy asi rādhase jajñiṣe vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā hi asi rādhase jajñiṣe vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ
translated: For thou art a bull for the gift, thou art born, O bull, thy strength.

original: svakṣatraṃ te dhṛṣan manaḥ satrāham indra pauṃsyam //
analyzed: svakṣatram te dhṛṣat manaḥ satrāham indra pauṃsyam
translated: Thy mind is self-ruling, bold, thy manhood is protection, O Indra.

original: tvaṃ tam indra martyam amitrayantam adrivaḥ /
analyzed: tvam tam indra martyam amitrayantam adrivas
translated: Thou, O Indra, the bolt-wielder, that mortal who is hostile to us,

original: sarvarathā śatakrato ni yāhi śavasas pate //🔽tvām id vṛtrahantama janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: sarvarathā śatakrato ni yāhi śavasaḥ pate  tvām id vṛtra hantama janāsaḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: O hundred-powered, go thou to him with might, O lord of power.🔽The people with trimmed sacred grass call thee, O best Vritra-slayer,

original: ugram pūrvīṣu pūrvyaṃ havante vājasātaye //
analyzed: ugram pūrvīṣu pūrvyam havante vājasātaye
translated: The strong, the most ancient of the ancient, for the sake of gaining strength.

original: asmākam indra duṣṭaram puroyāvānam ājiṣu /🔽sayāvānaṃ dhanedhane vājayantam avā ratham //
analyzed: asmākam indra duṣṭaram puras yāvānam ājiṣu  sa yāvānam dhanedhane vājayantam ava ratham
translated: O Indra, our most excellent chariot, which goes in front in battles,🔽Which is victorious in every contest, we urge on for booty.

original: asmākam indrehi no ratham avā purandhyā /
analyzed: asmākam indra ihi naḥ ratham ava purandhyā
translated: O Indra, come to us with our chariot, come to us with inspiration.

original: vayaṃ śaviṣṭha vāryaṃ divi śravo dadhīmahi divi stomam manāmahe //
analyzed: vayam śaviṣṭha vāryam divi śravaḥ dadhīmahi divi stomam manāmahe
translated: O most powerful one, we wish to attain excellent glory in heaven, in heaven we conceive the praise.

original: sa ā gamad indro yo vasūnāṃ ciketad dātuṃ dāmano rayīṇām /
analyzed: saḥ ā gamat indraḥ yaḥ vasūnām ciketat dātum dāmanaḥ rayīṇām
translated: May Indra come, who knows how to bestow wealth and treasures as a bountiful giver.

original: dhanvacaro na vaṃsagas tṛṣāṇaś cakamānaḥ pibatu dugdham aṃśum //
analyzed: dhanva caraḥ na vaṃsagaḥ tṛṣāṇaḥ cakamānaḥ pibatu dugdham aṃśum
translated: Like a thirsty deer roaming the desert, eager, may he drink the milk-filled stalk.

original: ā te hanū harivaḥ śūra śipre ruhat somo na parvatasya pṛṣṭhe /
analyzed: ā te hanū harivas śūra śipre ruhat somaḥ na parvatasya pṛṣṭhe
translated: O Indra, the tawny-hued, the hero, let the Soma rise up to your jaws on the back of the mountain.

original: anu tvā rājann arvato na hinvan gīrbhir madema puruhūta viśve //
analyzed: anu tvā rājan arvataḥ na hinvan gīrbhiḥ madema puruhūta viśve
translated: O king, may all of us, like a swift horse urged on, delight in you with songs, O much-invoked one.

original: cakraṃ na vṛttam puruhūta vepate mano bhiyā me amater id adrivaḥ /
analyzed: cakram na vṛttam puruhūta vepate manaḥ bhiyā me amateḥ id adrivas
translated: The wheel, O much-invoked one, trembles like a circle, my mind is frightened by the thought of death, O wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: rathād adhi tvā jaritā sadāvṛdha kuvin nu stoṣan maghavan purūvasuḥ //
analyzed: rathāt adhi tvā jaritā sadāvṛdha kuvid nu stoṣat maghavan purūvasuḥ
translated: O ever-increasing one, how can the praiser praise you, O bountiful one, from the chariot?

original: eṣa grāveva jaritā ta indreyarti vācam bṛhad āśuṣāṇaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa grāvā iva jaritā te indra iyarti vācam bṛhat āśuṣāṇaḥ
translated: This praiser of yours, O Indra, like a stone, hurls forth the voice, seeking the great,

original: pra savyena maghavan yaṃsi rāyaḥ pra dakṣiṇid dharivo mā vi venaḥ //🔽vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ vardhatu dyaur vṛṣā vṛṣabhyāṃ vahase haribhyām /
analyzed: pra savyena maghavan yaṃsi rāyaḥ pra dakṣiṇit harivas mā vi venaḥ  vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇam vardhatu dyauḥ vṛṣā vṛṣabhyām vahase haribhyām
translated: With thy left, O bountiful one, do thou draw hither wealth, and be not niggardly with thy right hand.🔽May the bull, O heaven, make thee, the bull, wax great. Thou carriest with two bulls, with two tawny ones.

original: sa no vṛṣā vṛṣarathaḥ suśipra vṛṣakrato vṛṣā vajrin bhare dhāḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ vṛṣā vṛṣa rathaḥ su śipra vṛṣa krato vṛṣā vajrin bhare dhāḥ
translated: Do thou, O bull, O thou of the beautiful car, O thou of the bull's mind, O bull, O thou that hast the thunderbolt, support us.

original: yo rohitau vājinau vājinīvān tribhiḥ śataiḥ sacamānāv adiṣṭa /
analyzed: yaḥ rohitau vājinau vājinīvān tribhiḥ śataiḥ sacamānau adiṣṭa
translated: He who, rich in horses, with three hundred, hath appointed the two strong red horses to be his companions,

original: yūne sam asmai kṣitayo namantāṃ śrutarathāya maruto duvoyā //
analyzed: yūne sam asmai kṣitayaḥ namantām śruta rathāya marutaḥ duvoyā
translated: To him, O Maruts, whose car is renowned, let the people bow down, who is to be served.

original: sam bhānunā yatate sūryasyājuhvāno ghṛtapṛṣṭhaḥ svañcāḥ /
analyzed: sam bhānunā yatate sūryasya ājuhvānaḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ svañcāḥ
translated: He who is self-luminous, whose back is anointed with ghee, is eager to unite with the light of the sun.

original: tasmā amṛdhrā uṣaso vy ucchān ya indrāya sunavāmety āha //
analyzed: tasmai amṛdhrāḥ uṣasaḥ vi ucchān yaḥ indrāya sunavāma iti āha
translated: To him let the unfailing dawns shine forth, who says, 'Let us press for Indra.'

original: samiddhāgnir vanavat stīrṇabarhir yuktagrāvā sutasomo jarāte /
analyzed: samiddha agniḥ vanavat stīrṇa barhiḥ yukta grāvā suta somaḥ jarāte
translated: He whose fire is kindled, who has strewn the sacrificial grass, whose pressing-stone is firmly fixed, whose Soma is pressed, who is ready,

original: grāvāṇo yasyeṣiraṃ vadanty ayad adhvaryur haviṣāva sindhum //
analyzed: grāvāṇaḥ yasya iṣiram vadanti ayat adhvaryuḥ haviṣā ava sindhum
translated: Whose pressing-stones speak aloud, whose Adhvaryu has brought the oblation to the river.

original: vadhūr iyam patim icchanty eti ya īṃ vahāte mahiṣīm iṣirām /
analyzed: vadhūḥ iyam patim icchantī eti yaḥ īm vahāte mahiṣīm iṣirām
translated: This young wife goes forth, desiring a husband, who will carry her, the strong one, the great one.

original: āsya śravasyād ratha ā ca ghoṣāt purū sahasrā pari vartayāte //
analyzed: ā asya śravasyāt rathaḥ ā ca ghoṣāt purū sahasrā pari vartayāte
translated: From the sound of his car and the noise of his chariot, may he turn away many thousands.

original: na sa rājā vyathate yasminn indras tīvraṃ somam pibati gosakhāyam /
analyzed: na sa rājā vyathate yasmin indraḥ tīvram somam pibati go sakhāyam
translated: The king in whom Indra drinks the strong Soma, accompanied by the cows, is not distressed.

original: ā satvanair ajati hanti vṛtraṃ kṣeti kṣitīḥ subhago nāma puṣyan //
analyzed: ā satvanaiḥ ajati hanti vṛtram kṣeti kṣitīḥ subhagaḥ nāma puṣyan
translated: He goes with the heroes, slays Vrtra, and dwells in the dwellings, prosperous, nourishing the name.

original: puṣyāt kṣeme abhi yoge bhavāty ubhe vṛtau saṃyatī saṃ jayāti /🔽priyaḥ sūrye priyo agnā bhavāti ya indrāya sutasomo dadāśat //
analyzed: puṣyāt kṣeme abhi yoge bhavāti ubhe vṛtau saṃyatī sam jayāti  priyaḥ sūrye priyaḥ agnā bhavāti yaḥ indrāya suta somaḥ dadāśat
translated: He prospers in peace, in battle he becomes, he conquers both armies when they meet in conflict.🔽He becomes dear to the sun, dear to Agni, he who offers Soma to Indra.

original: uroṣ ṭa indra rādhaso vibhvī rātiḥ śatakrato /
analyzed: uroḥ te indra rādhasaḥ vibhvī rātiḥ śatakrato
translated: O Indra, the gift of the generous one, O Shatakratu, is ready to be bestowed.

original: adhā no viśvacarṣaṇe dyumnā sukṣatra maṃhaya //
analyzed: adhā naḥ viśvacarṣaṇe dyumnā su kṣatra maṃhaya
translated: Now, O you who are worshipped by all, O you of good rule, exalt our glory.

original: yad īm indra śravāyyam iṣaṃ śaviṣṭha dadhiṣe /
analyzed: yat īm indra śravāyyam iṣam śaviṣṭha dadhiṣe
translated: O Indra, when you, O most powerful one, possess the food worthy of fame,

original: paprathe dīrghaśruttamaṃ hiraṇyavarṇa duṣṭaram //
analyzed: paprathe dīrghaśruttamam hiraṇya varṇa duṣṭaram
translated: You extend it, most famous, golden-hued, hard to bear.

original: śuṣmāso ye te adrivo mehanā ketasāpaḥ /
analyzed: śuṣmāsaḥ ye te adrivas mehanā ketasāpaḥ
translated: O you who have thunderbolts, your powers, which are to be measured, are like the waters.

original: ubhā devāv abhiṣṭaye divaś ca gmaś ca rājathaḥ //
analyzed: ubhā devau abhiṣṭaye divaḥ ca gmaḥ ca rājathaḥ
translated: You two gods rule over heaven and earth for the sake of protection.

original: uto no asya kasya cid dakṣasya tava vṛtrahan /
analyzed: uta u naḥ asya kasya cit dakṣasya tava vṛtrahan
translated: And for us, O slayer of Vrtra, for the sake of this or that power of yours,

original: asmabhyaṃ nṛmṇam ā bharāsmabhyaṃ nṛmaṇasyase //
analyzed: asmabhyam nṛmṇam ā bhara asmabhyam nṛmaṇasyase
translated: Bring us manliness; for us you are to be served with manliness.

original: nū ta ābhir abhiṣṭibhis tava śarmañ chatakrato /
analyzed: nu te ābhiḥ abhiṣṭibhiḥ tava śarmam śatakrato
translated: Now, O you of a hundred powers, with these aids of yours, O protector,

original: indra syāma sugopāḥ śūra syāma sugopāḥ //
analyzed: indra syāma su gopāḥ śūra syāma su gopāḥ
translated: May we be well protected by Indra, may we be well protected by the hero.

original: yad indra citra mehanāsti tvādātam adrivaḥ /
analyzed: yat indra citra mehanā asti tvādātam adrivas
translated: Whatever wondrous thing there is, O Indra, to be gained by thee, O wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: rādhas tan no vidadvasa ubhayāhasty ā bhara //
analyzed: rādhaḥ tat naḥ vidadvaso ubhayāhasti ā bhara
translated: That bounty, O thou who hast all good things, bring thou to us with both thy hands.

original: yan manyase vareṇyam indra dyukṣaṃ tad ā bhara /
analyzed: yat manyase vareṇyam indra dyukṣam tat ā bhara
translated: Whatever thou deemest most excellent, O Indra, fit for the worshipper, bring that to us.

original: vidyāma tasya te vayam akūpārasya dāvane //
analyzed: vidyāma tasya te vayam akūpārasya dāvane
translated: May we know that of thine, O thou of boundless bounty, in order to obtain it.

original: yat te ditsu prarādhyam mano asti śrutam bṛhat /
analyzed: yat te ditsu prarādhyam manaḥ asti śrutam bṛhat
translated: That mind of thine which is willing to give, which is renowned, and great,

original: tena dṛḷhā cid adriva ā vājaṃ darṣi sātaye //
analyzed: tena dṛḍhā cit adrivas ā vājam darṣi sātaye
translated: With that, O thou of the thunderbolt, do thou break through even strong things, and win booty for us.

original: maṃhiṣṭhaṃ vo maghonāṃ rājānaṃ carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭham vaḥ maghonām rājānam carṣaṇīnām
translated: The most bountiful of you rich ones, the king of men,

original: indram upa praśastaye pūrvībhir jujuṣe giraḥ //
analyzed: indram upa praśastaye pūrvībhiḥ jujuṣe giraḥ
translated: Indra, you delight with many praises.

original: asmā it kāvyaṃ vaca uktham indrāya śaṃsyam /
analyzed: asmai id kāvyam vacaḥ uktham indrāya śaṃsyam
translated: This thought, this hymn, this laud is to be extolled for Indra.

original: tasmā u brahmavāhase giro vardhanty atrayo giraḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ //
analyzed: tasmai u brahma vāhase giraḥ vardhanti atrayaḥ giraḥ śumbhanti atrayaḥ
translated: Therefore the Atri-s exalt their songs to him, the bearer of prayer, the Atri-s adorn their songs.

original: ā yāhy adribhiḥ sutaṃ somaṃ somapate piba /
analyzed: ā yāhi adribhiḥ sutam somam soma pate piba
translated: Come hither, O lord of the Soma, to the Soma pressed with stones, drink.

original: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama //
analyzed: vṛṣan indra vṛṣabhiḥ vṛtra hantama
translated: O bull, O Indra, with the bulls, O Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: vṛṣā grāvā vṛṣā mado vṛṣā somo ayaṃ sutaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā grāvā vṛṣā madaḥ vṛṣā somaḥ ayam sutaḥ
translated: The pressing-stone is a bull, the rapture is a bull, this Soma is pressed out, a bull.

original: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama //
analyzed: vṛṣan indra vṛṣabhiḥ vṛtra hantama
translated: O bull, O Indra, with the bulls, O Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ huve vajriñ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇam huve vajrim citrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: I call on thee, O Bull, the Bull, O Indra, with wondrous aids.

original: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama //
analyzed: vṛṣan indra vṛṣabhiḥ vṛtra hantama
translated: O Indra, O Bull, with bulls, best Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhas turāṣāṭ chuṣmī rājā vṛtrahā somapāvā /
analyzed: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhaḥ turāṣāh śuṣmī rājā vṛtra hā soma pāvā
translated: The vigorous, the thunder-armed, the strong, the conqueror, the mighty, the king, the Vr̥itra-slayer, the Soma-drinker,

original: yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsad arvāṅ mādhyandine savane matsad indraḥ //
analyzed: yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsat arvāṅ mādhyandine savane matsat indraḥ
translated: Having yoked thy two bay steeds, may Indra come hither to the midday libation, to rejoice.

original: yat tvā sūrya svarbhānus tamasāvidhyad āsuraḥ /
analyzed: yat tvā sūrya svarbhānuḥ tamasā vidhyat āsuraḥ
translated: When, O Sûrya, the Asura Svarbhânu pierced thee with darkness,

original: akṣetravid yathā mugdho bhuvanāny adīdhayuḥ //
analyzed: a kṣetra vid yathā mugdhaḥ bhuvanāni adīdhayuḥ
translated: As one ignorant of the field, the worlds were agitated.

original: svarbhānor adha yad indra māyā avo divo vartamānā avāhan /
analyzed: svarbhānoḥ adha yat indra māyāḥ avas divaḥ vartamānāḥ avāhan
translated: When, O Indra, thou didst overthrow the magic of Svarbhânu, which was spread out from heaven,

original: gūḷhaṃ sūryaṃ tamasāpavratena turīyeṇa brahmaṇāvindad atriḥ //
analyzed: gūḍham sūryam tamasā apavratena turīyeṇa brahmaṇā avindat atriḥ
translated: With the fourth prayer, Atri found the hidden Sûrya, with darkness as a covering, with a vow.

original: mā mām imaṃ tava santam atra irasyā drugdho bhiyasā ni gārīt /
analyzed: mā mām imam tava santam atra irasyā drugdhaḥ bhiyasā ni gārīt
translated: Let not the spiteful, wicked, fearful Drisad, O Mitra, harm me, who am here with thee.

original: tvam mitro asi satyarādhās tau mehāvataṃ varuṇaś ca rājā //
analyzed: tvam mitraḥ asi satya rādhāḥ tau mā iha āvatam varuṇaḥ ca rājā
translated: Thou art Mitra, who bestowest true boons. Do ye two, Mitra and King Varuna, help me.

original: grāvṇo brahmā yuyujānaḥ saparyan kīriṇā devān namasopaśikṣan /
analyzed: grāvṇaḥ brahmā yuyujānaḥ saparyan kīriṇā devān namasā upaśikṣan
translated: The Brahman, the Gravas, being yoked, served (the gods). The Kîri, with homage, instructed the gods.

original: atriḥ sūryasya divi cakṣur ādhāt svarbhānor apa māyā aghukṣat //
analyzed: atriḥ sūryasya divi cakṣuḥ ādhāt svarbhānoḥ apa māyāḥ aghukṣat
translated: Atri placed the eye of Sûrya in the heaven. He extinguished the magic of Svarbhânu.

original: yaṃ vai sūryaṃ svarbhānus tamasāvidhyad āsuraḥ /
analyzed: yam vai sūryam svarbhānuḥ tamasā vidhyat āsuraḥ
translated: When the Asura Rāhu with darkness pierced the sun,

original: atrayas tam anv avindan nahy anye aśaknuvan //
analyzed: atrayaḥ tam anu avindan nahi anye aśaknuvan
translated: The Ātryas found him again; others were not able.

original: ko nu vām mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāyan divo vā mahaḥ pārthivasya vā de /
analyzed: kaḥ nu vām mitrāvaruṇau ṛtāyan divaḥ vā mahaḥ pārthivasya vā de
translated: Who, O Mitra and Varuna, observing the truth, will protect us in the abode of the great heaven or of the earth,

original: ṛtasya vā sadasi trāsīthāṃ no yajñāyate vā paśuṣo na vājān //
analyzed: ṛtasya vā sadasi trāsīthām naḥ yajñāyate vā paśu sas na vājān
translated: Or in the seat of truth, or will grant us sacrificial offerings, cattle, or strength?

original: te no mitro varuṇo aryamāyur indra ṛbhukṣā maruto juṣanta /
analyzed: te naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ aryamā āyuḥ indraḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ marutaḥ juṣanta
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aryaman, Indra, the Rbhukṣaṇs, and the Maruts accept our life,

original: namobhir vā ye dadhate suvṛktiṃ stomaṃ rudrāya mīḷhuṣe sajoṣāḥ //
analyzed: namobhiḥ vā ye dadhate suvṛktim stomam rudrāya mīḍhuṣe sajoṣāḥ
translated: Or those who, with homage, offer good praise to Rudra, the rain-giver, in unison.

original: ā vāṃ yeṣṭhāśvinā huvadhyai vātasya patman rathyasya puṣṭau /
analyzed: ā vām yeṣṭha aśvinā huvadhyai vātasya patman rathyasya puṣṭau
translated: You two, O most desirable Aśvins, are to be invoked on the path of the wind, on the path of the chariot, for prosperity.

original: uta vā divo asurāya manma prāndhāṃsīva yajyave bharadhvam //
analyzed: uta vā divaḥ asurāya manma pra andhāṃsi iva yajyave bharadhvam
translated: Or bring to the Asura of heaven a hymn, as if bringing forward oblations to the sacrificer.

original: pra sakṣaṇo divyaḥ kaṇvahotā trito divaḥ sajoṣā vāto agniḥ /
analyzed: pra sakṣaṇaḥ divyaḥ kaṇva hotā tritaḥ divaḥ sajoṣāḥ vātaḥ agniḥ
translated: The divine messenger, the Āditya, the divine priest Kaṇva, Trita, of the same mind as heaven, Vāta, Agni,

original: pūṣā bhagaḥ prabhṛthe viśvabhojā ājiṃ na jagmur āśvaśvatamāḥ //
analyzed: pūṣā bhagaḥ prabhṛthe viśva bhojāḥ ājim na jagmuḥ āśvaśvatamāḥ
translated: Pūṣan, Bhaga, all-nourishing in the sacrifice, have gone to the race, the most horse-like.

original: pra vo rayiṃ yuktāśvam bharadhvaṃ rāya eṣe 'vase dadhīta dhīḥ /
analyzed: pra vaḥ rayim yukta aśvam bharadhvam rāyaḥ eṣe vase dadhīta dhīḥ
translated: Bring forth your wealth with yoked horses, set your thought on seeking riches for help.

original: suśeva evair auśijasya hotā ye va evā marutas turāṇām //
analyzed: su śevaḥ evaiḥ auśijasya hotā ye vaḥ evā marutaḥ turāṇām
translated: The very gracious priest of Auśija, O Maruts, who are the swift ones of the swift.

original: pra vo vāyuṃ rathayujaṃ kṛṇudhvam pra devaṃ vipram panitāram arkaiḥ /
analyzed: pra vaḥ vāyum ratha yujam kṛṇudhvam pra devam vipram panitāram arkaiḥ
translated: Make Vayu your charioteer, make the god, the poet, the impeller with your songs.

original: iṣudhyava ṛtasāpaḥ purandhīr vasvīr no atra patnīr ā dhiye dhuḥ //
analyzed: iṣudhyavaḥ ṛtasāpaḥ purandhīḥ vasvīḥ naḥ atra patnīḥ ā dhiye dhuḥ
translated: The diligent, the truthful, the wise, may the prosperous wives here bring us wealth in our thought.

original: upa va eṣe vandyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ pra yahvī divaś citayadbhir arkaiḥ /
analyzed: upa vaḥ eṣe vandyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ pra yahvī divaḥ citayadbhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: I approach you with these praiseworthy powers, with the youthful, far-seeing thoughts of heaven.

original: uṣāsānaktā viduṣīva viśvam ā hā vahato martyāya yajñam //🔽abhi vo arce poṣyāvato nṝn vāstoṣ patiṃ tvaṣṭāraṃ rarāṇaḥ /
analyzed: uṣāsānaktā viduṣī iva viśvam ā hā vahataḥ martyāya yajñam  abhi vaḥ arce poṣyāvataḥ nṝn vāstoḥ patim tvaṣṭāram rarāṇaḥ
translated: Dawn and Night, as if knowing all, bring the sacrifice to the mortal one.🔽I praise you, O men who are to be nourished, I delight in Vastospati and Tvastr.

original: dhanyā sajoṣā dhiṣaṇā namobhir vanaspatīṃr oṣadhī rāya eṣe //
analyzed: dhanyā sajoṣāḥ dhiṣaṇā namobhiḥ vanaspatīṃr oṣadhīḥ rāyaḥ eṣe
translated: The bountiful, the Dhisanas of one accord with salutations, the trees and plants I seek for wealth.

original: tuje nas tane parvatāḥ santu svaitavo ye vasavo na vīrāḥ /
analyzed: tuje naḥ tane parvatāḥ santu svaitavaḥ ye vasavaḥ na vīrāḥ
translated: May the mountains be easy for us in our work, the Vasus who are like heroes to us.

original: panita āptyo yajataḥ sadā no vardhān naḥ śaṃsaṃ naryo abhiṣṭau //
analyzed: panitaḥ āptyaḥ yajataḥ sadā naḥ vardhāt naḥ śaṃsam naryaḥ abhiṣṭau
translated: May Aptârya, the worshipper, always help us. May the men increase our praise and protection.

original: vṛṣṇo astoṣi bhūmyasya garbhaṃ trito napātam apāṃ suvṛkti /
analyzed: vṛṣṇaḥ astoṣi bhūmyasya garbham tritaḥ napātam apām suvṛkti
translated: I praise the son of the earth, the child of the waters, Trita, with good hymns.

original: gṛṇīte agnir etarī na śūṣaiḥ śociṣkeśo ni riṇāti vanā //
analyzed: gṛṇīte agniḥ etarī na śūṣaiḥ śociṣkeśaḥ ni riṇāti vanā
translated: Agni, the other one, with his powers, the one with flaming hair, burns the woods.

original: kathā mahe rudriyāya bravāma kad rāye cikituṣe bhagāya /🔽āpa oṣadhīr uta no 'vantu dyaur vanā girayo vṛkṣakeśāḥ //🔽śṛṇotu na ūrjām patir giraḥ sa nabhas tarīyāṃ iṣiraḥ parijmā /
analyzed: kathā mahe rudriyāya bravāma kad rāye cikituṣe bhagāya  āpaḥ oṣadhīḥ uta naḥ vantu dyauḥ vanā girayaḥ vṛkṣa keśāḥ  śṛṇotu naḥ ūrjām patiḥ giraḥ sa nabhaḥ tarīyān iṣiraḥ parijmā
translated: What shall we say to the great Rudra, to the discerning Bhaga for wealth?🔽May the waters and plants protect us, may heaven, the woods, the mountains with trees for hair.🔽May the lord of strength listen to our songs, he who is most distant, swift, and moves around.

original: śṛṇvantv āpaḥ puro na śubhrāḥ pari sruco babṛhāṇasyādreḥ //
analyzed: śṛṇvantu āpaḥ puras na śubhrāḥ pari srucaḥ babṛhāṇasya adreḥ
translated: May the bright waters in front listen, the ladles of the one who stretches out, the mountain.

original: vidā cin nu mahānto ye va evā bravāma dasmā vāryaṃ dadhānāḥ /🔽vayaś cana subhva āva yanti kṣubhā martam anuyataṃ vadhasnaiḥ //
analyzed: vidā cit nu mahāntaḥ ye vaḥ evāḥ bravāma dasmāḥ vāryam dadhānāḥ  vayaḥ cana su bhvaḥ āva yanti kṣubhā martam anuyatam vadhasnaiḥ
translated: We will proclaim even the great ones who know this, bestowing wondrous treasure.🔽Even the strong ones come to the mortal who is restrained by the noose of death.

original: ā daivyāni pārthivāni janmāpaś cācchā sumakhāya vocam /
analyzed: ā daivyāni pārthivāni janmā apaḥ ca acchā su makhāya vocam
translated: I call to the divine and earthly beings, and the waters, for good fortune.

original: vardhantāṃ dyāvo giraś candrāgrā udā vardhantām abhiṣātā arṇāḥ //
analyzed: vardhantām dyāvaḥ giraḥ candra agrāḥ udāḥ vardhantām abhiṣātāḥ arṇāḥ
translated: May the heavens and the songs with their sweet tips grow, may the waters that are pressed grow.

original: padepade me jarimā ni dhāyi varūtrī vā śakrā yā pāyubhiś ca /
analyzed: pade pade me jarimā ni dhāyi varūtrī vā śakrā yā pāyubhiḥ ca
translated: At every step, old age is laid upon me, the protector, O Shakra, who with his aids.

original: siṣaktu mātā mahī rasā naḥ smat sūribhir ṛjuhasta ṛjuvaniḥ //
analyzed: siṣaktu mātā mahī rasā naḥ smat sūribhiḥ ṛju hastaḥ ṛju vaniḥ
translated: May the great mother, the essence of our being, be joined with us, with upright hands and mind.

original: kathā dāśema namasā sudānūn evayā maruto acchoktau praśravaso maruto acchoktau /
analyzed: kathā dāśema namasā sudānūn eva yāḥ marutaḥ acchoktau praśravasaḥ marutaḥ acchoktau
translated: How shall we serve the bountiful ones with homage, the Maruts who go by their own will, the Maruts who go by their own will with flowing streams?

original: mā no 'hir budhnyo riṣe dhād asmākam bhūd upamātivaniḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ hiḥ budhnyaḥ riṣe dhāt asmākam bhūt upamāti vaniḥ
translated: Let not the dragon of the deep injure us for our sacrifice. Let him be the repeller of attacks upon us.

original: iti cin nu prajāyai paśumatyai devāso vanate martyo va ā devāso vanate martyo vaḥ /
analyzed: iti cit nu prajāyai paśumatyai devāsaḥ vanate martyaḥ vaḥ ā devāsaḥ vanate martyaḥ vaḥ
translated: Thus, indeed, the gods seek to win for offspring abounding in cattle. A mortal man seeks to win you, O gods, a mortal man seeks to win you.

original: atrā śivāṃ tanvo dhāsim asyā jarāṃ cin me nirṛtir jagrasīta //
analyzed: atrā śivām tanvaḥ dhāsim asyāḥ jarām cit me nirṛtiḥ jagrasīta
translated: Here may I lay down for this (cow) a propitious abode for her body, and may even old age be seized by Nirrti.

original: tāṃ vo devāḥ sumatim ūrjayantīm iṣam aśyāma vasavaḥ śasā goḥ /
analyzed: tām vaḥ devāḥ sumatim ūrjayantīm iṣam aśyāma vasavaḥ śasā goḥ
translated: That prosperity of yours, O gods, which brings increase, may we obtain, O Vasus, by the praise of the cow.

original: sā naḥ sudānur mṛḷayantī devī prati dravantī suvitāya gamyāḥ //
analyzed: sā naḥ sudānuḥ mṛḍayantī devī prati dravantī suvitāya gamyāḥ
translated: May that bountiful, propitious, divine (cow), running to us, come for our welfare.

original: abhi na iḷā yūthasya mātā sman nadībhir urvaśī vā gṛṇātu /
analyzed: abhi naḥ iḷā yūthasya mātā smat nadībhiḥ urvaśī vā gṛṇātu
translated: May Ila, the mother of the herd, or Urvasi, with the rivers, sing to us.

original: urvaśī vā bṛhaddivā gṛṇānābhyūrṇvānā prabhṛthasyāyoḥ //
analyzed: urvaśī vā bṛhat divā gṛṇānā abhyūrṇvānā prabhṛthasya āyoḥ
translated: Or may Urvasi, singing with the wide-ruling (gods), be milked, while flowing, for the sacrifice.

original: siṣaktu na ūrjavyasya puṣṭeḥ //
analyzed: siṣaktu naḥ ūrjavyasya puṣṭeḥ
translated: May she unite us with the nourishment of strength.

original: pra śantamā varuṇaṃ dīdhitī gīr mitram bhagam aditiṃ nūnam aśyāḥ /
analyzed: pra śantamā varuṇam dīdhitī gīḥ mitram bhagam aditim nūnam aśyāḥ
translated: May I now obtain the most propitious Varuna, Mitra, Bhaga, and Aditi with my hymns.

original: pṛṣadyoniḥ pañcahotā śṛṇotv atūrtapanthā asuro mayobhuḥ //
analyzed: pṛṣat yoniḥ pañca hotā śṛṇotu a tūrta panthāḥ asuraḥ mayobhuḥ
translated: May the five-priest, whose abode is in the waters, the immortal, the blissful, whose path is uninterrupted, listen.

original: prati me stomam aditir jagṛbhyāt sūnuṃ na mātā hṛdyaṃ suśevam /
analyzed: prati me stomam aditiḥ jagṛbhyāt sūnum na mātā hṛdyam su śevam
translated: May Aditi receive my hymn, as a mother her dear son, who is born from her heart.

original: brahma priyaṃ devahitaṃ yad asty aham mitre varuṇe yan mayobhu //
analyzed: brahma priyam deva hitam yat asti aham mitre varuṇe yat mayobhu
translated: That which is dear to Brahman, beneficial to the gods, and is in Mitra and Varuna, the bountiful one.

original: ud īraya kavitamaṃ kavīnām unattainam abhi madhvā ghṛtena /
analyzed: ud īraya kavitamam kavīnām unatta enam abhi madhvā ghṛtena
translated: Lift up the most wise of the wise, exalt him with sweet ghee.

original: sa no vasūni prayatā hitāni candrāṇi devaḥ savitā suvāti //
analyzed: sa naḥ vasūni prayatā hitāni candrāṇi devaḥ savitā suvāti
translated: May the god Savitar send us the desired, the well-prepared treasures, the bright ones.

original: sam indra ṇo manasā neṣi gobhiḥ saṃ sūribhir harivaḥ saṃ svasti /
analyzed: sam indra naḥ manasā neṣi gobhiḥ sam sūribhiḥ harivas sam svasti
translated: O Indra, lead us with your mind to the cattle, lead us to the patrons, O you who love the Maruts, lead us to welfare.

original: sam brahmaṇā devahitaṃ yad asti saṃ devānāṃ sumatyā yajñiyānām //
analyzed: sam brahmaṇā deva hitam yat asti sam devānām sumatyā yajñiyānām
translated: Lead us with the Brahman that is beneficial to the gods, lead us with the good will of the worthy gods.

original: devo bhagaḥ savitā rāyo aṃśa indro vṛtrasya saṃjito dhanānām /
analyzed: devaḥ bhagaḥ savitā rāyaḥ aṃśaḥ indraḥ vṛtrasya saṃjitaḥ dhanānām
translated: The god Bhaga, Savitar, a portion of wealth, Indra, the conqueror of Vritra, of treasures,

original: ṛbhukṣā vāja uta vā purandhir avantu no amṛtāsas turāsaḥ //
analyzed: ṛbhukṣāḥ vājaḥ uta vā purandhiḥ avantu naḥ amṛtāsaḥ turāsaḥ
translated: Rbhukṣan, Vāja, and also Purandhi, may the immortal strong ones protect us.

original: marutvato apratītasya jiṣṇor ajūryataḥ pra bravāmā kṛtāni /
analyzed: marutvataḥ apratītasya jiṣṇoḥ a jūryataḥ pra bravāma kṛtāni
translated: Of the Maruts, of the unconquered victor, of the undecaying one, we proclaim the deeds.

original: na te pūrve maghavan nāparāso na vīryaṃ nūtanaḥ kaś canāpa //🔽upa stuhi prathamaṃ ratnadheyam bṛhaspatiṃ sanitāraṃ dhanānām /
analyzed: na te pūrve maghavan na aparāsaḥ na vīryam nūtanaḥ kaḥ cana āpa  upa stuhi prathamam ratna dheyam bṛhaspatim sanitāram dhanānām
translated: Neither your former, O Maghavan, nor your later deeds, nor your heroic deed, is new to anyone.🔽Praise first the bestower of treasures, Brhaspati, the winner of riches,

original: yaḥ śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhaḥ purūvasur āgamaj johuvānam //
analyzed: yaḥ śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhaḥ purūvasuḥ āgamat johuvānam
translated: Who, most auspicious, has come to the one who praises and extols, the one who calls, the one who has many treasures.

original: tavotibhiḥ sacamānā ariṣṭā bṛhaspate maghavānaḥ suvīrāḥ /
analyzed: tava ūtibhiḥ sacamānāḥ ariṣṭāḥ bṛhaspate maghavānaḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: Unharmed, O Brihaspati, are the wealthy ones, with good sons, attended by your most powerful aids.

original: ye aśvadā uta vā santi godā ye vastradāḥ subhagās teṣu rāyaḥ //
analyzed: ye aśva dāḥ uta vā santi go dāḥ ye vastra dāḥ subhagāḥ teṣu rāyaḥ
translated: Those who give horses, or who give cows, or who give garments, to them are the blessings of good fortune.

original: visarmāṇaṃ kṛṇuhi vittam eṣāṃ ye bhuñjate apṛṇanto na ukthaiḥ /
analyzed: visarmāṇam kṛṇuhi vittam eṣām ye bhuñjate apṛṇantaḥ naḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: Make their wealth to be scattered abroad, those who enjoy without giving with their praises.

original: apavratān prasave vāvṛdhānān brahmadviṣaḥ sūryād yāvayasva //
analyzed: apavratān prasave vāvṛdhānān brahma dviṣaḥ sūryāt yāvayasva
translated: Drive away from the light of the sun those who are averse to the vow, who are growing in strength, who hate the holy power.

original: ya ohate rakṣaso devavītāv acakrebhis tam maruto ni yāta /
analyzed: yaḥ ohate rakṣasaḥ deva vītau acakrebhiḥ tam marutaḥ ni yāta
translated: Him who is a Raksasa at the feast of the gods, with his fetters, O Maruts, drive him away.

original: yo vaḥ śamīṃ śaśamānasya nindāt tucchyān kāmān karate siṣvidānaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śamīm śaśamānasya nindāt tucchyān kāmān karate siṣvidānaḥ
translated: Who, greedy, has sent away your worshipper's desires, who, trembling, has sent away his empty wishes.

original: tam u ṣṭuhi yaḥ sviṣuḥ sudhanvā yo viśvasya kṣayati bheṣajasya /
analyzed: tam u stuhi yaḥ su iṣuḥ su dhanvā yaḥ viśvasya kṣayati bheṣajasya
translated: Praise him who is the good archer, the good bowman, who rules over the remedy of all.

original: yakṣvā mahe saumanasāya rudraṃ namobhir devam asuraṃ duvasya //
analyzed: yakṣva mahe saumanasāya rudram namobhiḥ devam asuram duvasya
translated: Worship Rudra with homage for great favour, the god, the Asura, with service.

original: damūnaso apaso ye suhastā vṛṣṇaḥ patnīr nadyo vibhvataṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: damūnasaḥ apasaḥ ye su hastāḥ vṛṣṇaḥ patnīḥ nadyaḥ vibhva taṣṭāḥ
translated: The skilful, the well-handed, the faultless ones, the wives of the strong, the rivers, fashioned by Vibhvan.

original: sarasvatī bṛhaddivota rākā daśasyantīr varivasyantu śubhrāḥ //
analyzed: sarasvatī bṛhat divā uta rākā daśasyantīḥ varivasyantu śubhrāḥ
translated: Sarasvatî, Bṛhaspati's wife, Râkâ, the bright ones, may they favour us, may they be kind.

original: pra sū mahe suśaraṇāya medhāṃ giram bhare navyasīṃ jāyamānām /
analyzed: pra su mahe su śaraṇāya medhām giram bhare navyasīm jāyamānām
translated: I bring to the great protector, to the mighty one, a new hymn, a new song, a new thought.

original: ya āhanā duhitur vakṣaṇāsu rūpā mināno akṛṇod idaṃ naḥ //🔽pra suṣṭuti stanayantaṃ ruvantam iḷas patiṃ jaritar nūnam aśyāḥ /🔽yo abdimāṃ udanimāṃ iyarti pra vidyutā rodasī ukṣamāṇaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ āhanāḥ duhituḥ vakṣaṇāsu rūpā minānaḥ akṛṇot idam naḥ  pra suṣṭuti stanayantam ruvantam iḷaḥ patim jaritar nūnam aśyāḥ  yaḥ abdimān udanimān iyarti pra vidyutā rodasī ukṣamāṇaḥ
translated: Who, in the bosom of his daughter, the cloud, hath formed this beauty for us.🔽The praiser should now call to the roaring, well-praised lord of the rain-cloud,🔽Who moves the cloud-filled, water-filled one, pouring forth with lightning to the two world-halves.

original: eṣa stomo mārutaṃ śardho acchā rudrasya sūnūṃr yuvanyūṃr ud aśyāḥ /
analyzed: eṣa stomaḥ mārutam śardhaḥ acchā rudrasya sūnūn yuvanyūn ud aśyāḥ
translated: This praise should go forth to the Marut host, to the young sons of Rudra, to the young women.

original: kāmo rāye havate mā svasty upa stuhi pṛṣadaśvāṃ ayāsaḥ //
analyzed: kāmaḥ rāye havate mā svasti upa stuhi pṛṣat aśvān ayāsaḥ
translated: Desire calls to me for wealth, for well-being; praise the swift-horsed, untiring ones.

original: praiṣa stomaḥ pṛthivīm antarikṣaṃ vanaspatīṃr oṣadhī rāye aśyāḥ /
analyzed: pra eṣa stomaḥ pṛthivīm antarikṣam vanaspatīn oṣadhīḥ rāye aśyāḥ
translated: The sent forth praise should win the earth, the atmosphere, the trees, the plants for wealth.

original: devodevaḥ suhavo bhūtu mahyam mā no mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt //
analyzed: devodevaḥ su havaḥ bhūtu mahyam mā naḥ mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt
translated: May each god be a good helper for me. May the mother earth not place us in evil thought.

original: urau devā anibādhe syāma //🔽sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema /🔽ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni //
analyzed: urau devāḥ anibādhe syāma  sam aśvinoḥ avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā su praṇītī gamema  ā naḥ rayim vahatam ā uta vīrān ā viśvāni amṛtā saubhagāni
translated: May we be in the wide, unobstructed (space) of the gods.🔽With the new favour of the two Ashvins, rich in joy, may we go with their good guidance.🔽Bring to us wealth and heroes; bring all good things, O immortal ones.

original: ā dhenavaḥ payasā tūrṇyarthā amardhantīr upa no yantu madhvā /
analyzed: ā dhenavaḥ payasā tūrṇi arthāḥ a mardhantīḥ upa naḥ yantu madhvā
translated: Let the milch cows, swift in purpose, come to us with milk that does not fail, with sweetness.

original: maho rāye bṛhatīḥ sapta vipro mayobhuvo jaritā johavīti //
analyzed: mahaḥ rāye bṛhatīḥ sapta vipraḥ mayobhuvaḥ jaritā johavīti
translated: The great, lofty, seven, wise, joy-giving ones, the singer invokes for great wealth.

original: ā suṣṭutī namasā vartayadhyai dyāvā vājāya pṛthivī amṛdhre /
analyzed: ā suṣṭutī namasā vartayadhyai dyāvā vājāya pṛthivī amṛdhre
translated: Turn them hither with fair praise and adoration, Heaven and Earth, unresisted, for the booty.

original: pitā mātā madhuvacāḥ suhastā bharebhare no yaśasāv aviṣṭām //
analyzed: pitā mātā madhu vacāḥ su hastā bharebhare naḥ yaśasau aviṣṭām
translated: May the Father and Mother, sweet of speech, skilful of hand, be with us for glory in every fight.

original: adhvaryavaś cakṛvāṃso madhūni pra vāyave bharata cāru śukram /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ cakṛvāṃsaḥ madhūni pra vāyave bharata cāru śukram
translated: O Adhvaryus, who have performed the sweet rites, bring to Vayu the fair bright (Soma).

original: hoteva naḥ prathamaḥ pāhy asya deva madhvo rarimā te madāya //
analyzed: hotā iva naḥ prathamaḥ pāhi asya deva madhvaḥ rarimā te madāya
translated: O God, as a Hotri priest, be the first to drink of this sweet drink: we have pressed it for thy joy.

original: daśa kṣipo yuñjate bāhū adriṃ somasya yā śamitārā suhastā /
analyzed: daśa kṣipaḥ yuñjate bāhū adrim somasya yā śamitārā su hastā
translated: The ten fingers of the two skilful pressers yoke the two arms for the stone of Soma, which is the distributer.

original: madhvo rasaṃ sugabhastir giriṣṭhāṃ caniścadad duduhe śukram aṃśuḥ //
analyzed: madhvaḥ rasam su gabhastiḥ giriṣṭhām caniścadat duduhe śukram aṃśuḥ
translated: The one with fair hands, the one with good arms, has drawn off the sweet juice from the mountain: the bright ray has milked the bright (milk).

original: asāvi te jujuṣāṇāya somaḥ kratve dakṣāya bṛhate madāya /
analyzed: asāvi te jujuṣāṇāya somaḥ kratve dakṣāya bṛhate madāya
translated: Soma has flowed for thee, O thou who lovest it, for great wisdom and joy.

original: harī rathe sudhurā yoge arvāg indra priyā kṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ //
analyzed: harī rathe su dhurā yoge arvāk indra priyā kṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ
translated: O Indra, thou who art to be invoked, make thy two dear strong horses, yoked to the car, go forward to the contest.

original: ā no mahīm aramatiṃ sajoṣā gnāṃ devīṃ namasā rātahavyām /
analyzed: ā naḥ mahīm aramatim sajoṣāḥ gnām devīm namasā rāta havyām
translated: To the great favour of the Goddess Gna, who loves the sacrifice, who is of one mind with us, to the bountiful one, with homage,

original: madhor madāya bṛhatīm ṛtajñām āgne vaha pathibhir devayānaiḥ //
analyzed: madhoḥ madāya bṛhatīm ṛta jñām ā agne vaha pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ
