translated: To the great one who knows the truth, to the bountiful one, to the sweet drink, O Agni, carry (her) by the paths which the gods travel.

original: añjanti yam prathayanto na viprā vapāvantaṃ nāgninā tapantaḥ /
analyzed: añjanti yam prathayantaḥ na viprāḥ vapāvantam na agninā tapantaḥ
translated: Whom the priests anoint, spreading him out, not burning, as it were, with fire,

original: pitur na putra upasi preṣṭha ā gharmo agnim ṛtayann asādi //🔽acchā mahī bṛhatī śantamā gīr dūto na gantv aśvinā huvadhyai /🔽mayobhuvā sarathā yātam arvāg gantaṃ nidhiṃ dhuram āṇir na nābhim //
analyzed: pituḥ na putraḥ upasi preṣṭhaḥ ā gharmaḥ agnim ṛtayan asādi  acchā mahī bṛhatī śantamā gīḥ dūtaḥ na gantu aśvinā huvadhyai  mayobhuvā sa rathā yātam arvāk gantam nidhim dhuram āṇiḥ na nābhim
translated: The son is dearer to the father than the self. The hotar, praising, has sat down by the fire.🔽Come to the great, vast, most auspicious praise, as an envoy to invoke the Ashvins.🔽Come in your delightful chariot, come hither, come to the treasure, the yoke, the cord, the nave.

original: pra tavyaso namauktiṃ turasyāham pūṣṇa uta vāyor adikṣi /
analyzed: pra tavyasaḥ namauktim turasya aham pūṣṇaḥ uta vāyoḥ adikṣi
translated: I have looked to the praise-song of the swift one, to the prayer of the bountiful, to the prayer of bountiful Pusan and Vayu.

original: yā rādhasā coditārā matīnāṃ yā vājasya draviṇodā uta tman //
analyzed: yā rādhasā coditārā matīnām yā vājasya draviṇaḥ dā uta tman
translated: Who are the instigators of bounty and of thoughts, who are the givers of wealth of strength and of themselves.

original: ā nāmabhir maruto vakṣi viśvān ā rūpebhir jātavedo huvānaḥ /
analyzed: ā nāmabhiḥ marutaḥ vakṣi viśvān ā rūpebhiḥ jātavedaḥ huvānaḥ
translated: O Jātavedas, invoke all the Maruts by their names and forms.

original: yajñaṃ giro jarituḥ suṣṭutiṃ ca viśve ganta maruto viśva ūtī //
analyzed: yajñam giraḥ jarituḥ suṣṭutim ca viśve ganta marutaḥ viśve ūtī
translated: O Maruts, come to the sacrifice with all your aids, to the sacrifice of the singer, to the song and praise of the worshipper.

original: ā no divo bṛhataḥ parvatād ā sarasvatī yajatā gantu yajñam /
analyzed: ā naḥ divaḥ bṛhataḥ parvatāt ā sarasvatī yajatā gantu yajñam
translated: From the lofty heaven, from the mountain, may Sarasvatī, the worshipped one, come to the sacrifice.

original: havaṃ devī jujuṣāṇā ghṛtācī śagmāṃ no vācam uśatī śṛṇotu //🔽ā vedhasaṃ nīlapṛṣṭham bṛhantam bṛhaspatiṃ sadane sādayadhvam /
analyzed: havam devī jujuṣāṇā ghṛtācī śagmām naḥ vācam uśatī śṛṇotu  ā vedhasam nīla pṛṣṭham bṛhantam bṛhaspatim sadane sādayadhvam
translated: May the goddess, longing for the call, the one with pure flames, listen to our auspicious speech, the one who loves it.

original: sādadyoniṃ dama ā dīdivāṃsaṃ hiraṇyavarṇam aruṣaṃ sapema //
analyzed: sādadyonim dame ā dīdivāṃsam hiraṇya varṇam aruṣam sapema
translated: Seat yourselves in the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the seat, on the

original: ā dharṇasir bṛhaddivo rarāṇo viśvebhir gantv omabhir huvānaḥ /
analyzed: ā dharṇasiḥ bṛhat divaḥ rarāṇaḥ viśvebhiḥ gantu omabhiḥ huvānaḥ
translated: Let the bull, the lord of the house, the great one of the sky, roaring, come with all the waters, invited.

original: gnā vasāna oṣadhīr amṛdhras tridhātuśṛṅgo vṛṣabho vayodhāḥ //
analyzed: gnāḥ vasānaḥ oṣadhīḥ amṛdhraḥ tri dhātu śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ vayodhāḥ
translated: Wearing the wives, the plants, the unerring one, with horns of three kinds, the bull, the giver of life.

original: mātuṣ pade parame śukra āyor vipanyavo rāspirāso agman /
analyzed: mātuṣ pade parame śukre āyoḥ vipanyavaḥ rāspirāsaḥ agman
translated: In the mother's place, in the highest, in the pure abode of life, the various directions have come, the breathers.

original: suśevyaṃ namasā rātahavyāḥ śiśum mṛjanty āyavo na vāse //
analyzed: su śevyam namasā rāta havyāḥ śiśum mṛjanti āyavaḥ na vāse
translated: With reverence, the mortals, offering gifts, anoint the very gracious one, the living one, for dwelling.

original: bṛhad vayo bṛhate tubhyam agne dhiyājuro mithunāsaḥ sacanta /🔽devodevaḥ suhavo bhūtu mahyam mā no mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt //
analyzed: bṛhat vayaḥ bṛhate tubhyam agne dhiyā juraḥ mithunāsaḥ sacanta  devodevaḥ su havaḥ bhūtu mahyam mā naḥ mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt
translated: The great life, for the great one, O Agni, the pairs, with devotion, follow.🔽May each god be easy to invoke for me. May the mother earth not place us in evil thought.

original: urau devā anibādhe syāma //🔽sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema /
analyzed: urau devāḥ anibādhe syāma  sam aśvinoḥ avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā su praṇītī gamema
translated: In the wide room, O gods, may we be free from affliction.🔽With the new favour of the Ashvins, rich in joy, may we go with good guidance.

original: ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni //
analyzed: ā naḥ rayim vahatam ā uta vīrān ā viśvāni amṛtā saubhagāni
translated: Bring to us wealth and heroes. Bring all good things, O immortal ones.

original: tam pratnathā pūrvathā viśvathemathā jyeṣṭhatātim barhiṣadaṃ svarvidam /
analyzed: tam pratnathā pūrvathā viśvathā imathā jyeṣṭhatātim barhiṣadam svar vidam
translated: Him, as of old, as in the beginning, in every way, in the highest contest, seated on the sacred grass, the finder of heaven,

original: pratīcīnaṃ vṛjanaṃ dohase girāśuṃ jayantam anu yāsu vardhase //
analyzed: pratīcīnam vṛjanam dohase girā āśum jayantam anu yāsu vardhase
translated: The advancing multitude, for milking with the song, the swift one, whom you follow, whom you increase in the contests.

original: śriye sudṛśīr uparasya yāḥ svar virocamānaḥ kakubhām acodate /
analyzed: śriye su dṛśīḥ uparasya yāḥ svar virocamānaḥ kakubhām a codate
translated: The fair-looking ones of the upper sky, for glory, he who shines in the heavens, moves to the quarters.

original: sugopā asi na dabhāya sukrato paro māyābhir ṛta āsa nāma te //
analyzed: su gopāḥ asi na dabhāya sukrato paras māyābhiḥ ṛte āsa nāma te
translated: Thou art well-guarded, O wise one, not to be deceived; beyond the illusions is thy name, O truthful one.

original: atyaṃ haviḥ sacate sac ca dhātu cāriṣṭagātuḥ sa hotā sahobhariḥ /
analyzed: atyam haviḥ sacate sat ca dhātu ca ariṣṭa gātuḥ sa hotā sahaḥ bhariḥ
translated: That oblation follows the truth-speaking one, the priest whose path is uninjured, who bears strength.

original: prasarsrāṇo anu barhir vṛṣā śiśur madhye yuvājaro visruhā hitaḥ //
analyzed: prasarsrāṇaḥ anu barhiḥ vṛṣā śiśuḥ madhye yuvā ajaraḥ visruhā hitaḥ
translated: The bull, the child, spreading along the sacrificial grass, in the middle, young, ageless, with wide-spreading rays, is set.

original: pra va ete suyujo yāmann iṣṭaye nīcīr amuṣmai yamya ṛtāvṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: pra vaḥ ete su yujaḥ yāman iṣṭaye nīcīḥ amuṣmai yamyaḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: These well-yoked ones, for the sake of worship, go low for him, the truth-increasing ones, to Yama.

original: suyantubhiḥ sarvaśāsair abhīśubhiḥ krivir nāmāni pravaṇe muṣāyati //
analyzed: suyantubhiḥ sarva śāsaiḥ abhīśubhiḥ kriviḥ nāmāni pravaṇe muṣāyati
translated: With well-controlled, all-governing, whip-bearing ones, Krivi hides his names in the sloping (sky).

original: saṃjarbhurāṇas tarubhiḥ sutegṛbhaṃ vayākinaṃ cittagarbhāsu susvaruḥ /
analyzed: saṃjarbhurāṇaḥ tarubhiḥ sutegṛbham vayākinam citta garbhāsu susvaruḥ
translated: Roaring together with the trees, the well-grasping one, the singing one, in the well-sounding ones in the womb of thought,

original: dhāravākeṣv ṛjugātha śobhase vardhasva patnīr abhi jīvo adhvare //
analyzed: dhāravākeṣu ṛju gātha śobhase vardhasva patnīḥ abhi jīvaḥ adhvare
translated: in the vessels, O straight-singing one, thou shinest. Increase thy wives, O life, at the sacrifice.

original: yādṛg eva dadṛśe tādṛg ucyate saṃ chāyayā dadhire sidhrayāpsv ā /
analyzed: yādṛś eva dadṛśe tādṛś ucyate sam chāyayā dadhire sidhrayā apsu ā
translated: As he is seen, so is he spoken of. They have placed him with his prosperous shadow in the waters.

original: mahīm asmabhyam uruṣām uru jrayo bṛhat suvīram anapacyutaṃ sahaḥ //
analyzed: mahīm asmabhyam uru sām uru jrayaḥ bṛhat su vīram an apacyutam sahaḥ
translated: For us, O wide one, make great strength, wide fame, great heroic strength that does not fail.

original: vety agrur janivān vā ati spṛdhaḥ samaryatā manasā sūryaḥ kaviḥ /🔽ghraṃsaṃ rakṣantam pari viśvato gayam asmākaṃ śarma vanavat svāvasuḥ //🔽jyāyāṃsam asya yatunasya ketuna ṛṣisvaraṃ carati yāsu nāma te /🔽yādṛśmin dhāyi tam apasyayā vidad ya u svayaṃ vahate so araṃ karat //🔽samudram āsām ava tasthe agrimā na riṣyati savanaṃ yasminn āyatā /🔽atrā na hārdi kravaṇasya rejate yatrā matir vidyate pūtabandhanī //🔽sa hi kṣatrasya manasasya cittibhir evāvadasya yajatasya sadhreḥ /🔽avatsārasya spṛṇavāma raṇvabhiḥ śaviṣṭhaṃ vājaṃ viduṣā cid ardhyam //🔽śyena āsām aditiḥ kakṣyo mado viśvavārasya yajatasya māyinaḥ /
analyzed: veti agruḥ janivān vai ati spṛdhaḥ samaryatā manasā sūryaḥ kaviḥ  ghraṃsam rakṣantam pari viśvatas gayam asmākam śarma vanavat svāvasuḥ  jyāyāṃsam asya yatunasya ketuna ṛṣi svaram carati yāsu nāma te  yādṛśmin dhāyi tam apasyayā vidat yaḥ u svayam vahate saḥ aram karat  samudram āsām ava tasthe agrimā na riṣyati savanam yasmin āyatā  atrā na hārdi kravaṇasya rejate yatrā matiḥ vidyate pūta bandhanī  sa hi kṣatrasya manasasya cittibhiḥ evāvadasya yajatasya sadhreḥ  avatsārasya spṛṇavāma raṇvabhiḥ śaviṣṭham vājam viduṣā cit ardhyam  śyenaḥ āsām aditiḥ kakṣyaḥ madaḥ viśva vārasya yajatasya māyinaḥ
translated: The one who has gone beyond, or the one who has conquered the enemies, the one who is victorious in battle, the one who is the sun in his mind, the wise one,🔽The one who protects the oblation, the one who is the support on all sides, may he, the one who possesses good wealth, grant us protection.🔽The one who is greater than this one who is to be praised, the one whose banner is the sage's voice, the one in whom your name moves,🔽The one who knows him who is supported by the rays, the one who is seen by insight, the one who carries himself, may he make us free from enemies.🔽The ocean has stood at the forefront of these, the libation in which is not destroyed, in which they are extended.🔽Here the heart of the greedy one does not tremble, where there is a thought that is pure-bound.🔽For he, by the thoughts of the Kshatriya and the sacrificer, the one who is to be worshipped,🔽We will win by the gentle ones the most powerful prize, even though it is to be obtained by the wise one.🔽The hawk, the Aditi, the intoxicating drink of the one who has all boons, the sacrificer, the magician,🔽

original: sadāpṛṇo yajato vi dviṣo vadhīd bāhuvṛktaḥ śrutavit taryo vaḥ sacā /
analyzed: sadāpṛṇaḥ yajataḥ vi dviṣaḥ vadhīt bāhuvṛktaḥ śrutavid taryaḥ vaḥ sacā
translated: The ever-victorious one, the worshipper, has slain the foes, the mighty one, the hearer of the people, the one who is with you.

original: ubhā sa varā praty eti bhāti ca yad īṃ gaṇam bhajate suprayāvabhiḥ //🔽sutambharo yajamānasya satpatir viśvāsām ūdhaḥ sa dhiyām udañcanaḥ /
analyzed: ubhā sa varā prati eti bhāti ca yat īm gaṇam bhajate su prayāvabhiḥ  sutambharaḥ yajamānasya sat patiḥ viśvāsām ūdhaḥ sa dhiyām
translated: He goes to both the prizes and shines, when he shares the company with those who go well.🔽The supporter of the pressed (Soma), the lord of the sacrificer's seat, the udder of all wishes, the impeller of thoughts.

original: bharad dhenū rasavac chiśriye payo 'nubruvāṇo adhy eti na svapan //
analyzed: bharat dhenuḥ rasavat śiśriye payaḥ nubruvāṇaḥ adhi eti na svapan
translated: Bearing the milch-cow, he has filled himself with nourishing milk; he goes along, reciting, not sleeping.

original: yo jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante yo jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti /
analyzed: yaḥ jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante yaḥ jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti
translated: The Rcs desire him who has been awake; the Sāmans go to him who has been awake.

original: yo jāgāra tam ayaṃ soma āha tavāham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ jāgāra tam ayam somaḥ āha tava aham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ
translated: This Soma says to him who has been awake: 'I am thine in friendship, I am thine in love.'

original: agnir jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante 'gnir jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti /
analyzed: agniḥ jāgāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante gniḥ jāgāra tam u sāmāni yanti
translated: The Rcs desire Agni who has been awake; the Sāmans go to Agni who has been awake.

original: agnir jāgāra tam ayaṃ soma āha tavāham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ //🔽vidā divo viṣyann adrim ukthair āyatyā uṣaso arcino guḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ jāgāra tam ayam somaḥ āha tava aham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ  vidā divaḥ viṣyan adrim ukthaiḥ āyatyāḥ uṣasaḥ arcinaḥ guḥ
translated: This Soma says to Agni who has been awake: 'I am thine in friendship, I am thine in love.'🔽Finding the region of the sky, he has burst the rock asunder. The rays of the rising dawn have sung.

original: apāvṛta vrajinīr ut svar gād vi duro mānuṣīr deva āvaḥ //
analyzed: apāvṛta vrajinīḥ ud svar gāt vi duraḥ mānuṣīḥ devaḥ āvaḥ
translated: Thou hast opened the stalls, thou hast risen from the light. Thou hast thrown open the doors of men, O god.

original: vi sūryo amatiṃ na śriyaṃ sād orvād gavām mātā jānatī gāt /
analyzed: vi sūryaḥ amatim na śriyam sāt ā ūrvāt gavām mātā jānatī gāt
translated: The sun has risen, surpassing the darkness, the mother of the cows has risen, knowing the way.

original: dhanvarṇaso nadyaḥ khādoarṇā sthūṇeva sumitā dṛṃhata dyauḥ //
analyzed: dhanu arṇasaḥ nadyaḥ khādoarṇā sthūṇā iva su mitā dṛṃhata dyauḥ
translated: The rivers with their wealth of water, the waters with their wealth of food, firm as a pillar well-set, let the sky stand.

original: asmā ukthāya parvatasya garbho mahīnāṃ januṣe pūrvyāya /
analyzed: asmai ukthāya parvatasya garbhaḥ mahīnām januṣe pūrvyāya
translated: For this hymn, the child of the mountain, for the birth of the great ones, for the ancient time,

original: vi parvato jihīta sādhata dyaur āvivāsanto dasayanta bhūma //
analyzed: vi parvataḥ jihīta sādhata dyauḥ āvivāsantaḥ dasayanta bhūma
translated: The mountain was divided, the sky was made ready, the people, rejoicing, served the earth.

original: sūktebhir vo vacobhir devajuṣṭair indrā nv agnī avase huvadhyai /
analyzed: sūktebhiḥ vaḥ vacobhiḥ deva juṣṭaiḥ indrā nu agnī avase huvadhyai
translated: With hymns and words dear to the gods, I invoke Indra and Agni for help.

original: ukthebhir hi ṣmā kavayaḥ suyajñā āvivāsanto maruto yajanti //
analyzed: ukthebhiḥ hi sma kavayaḥ su yajñāḥ āvivāsantaḥ marutaḥ yajanti
translated: For they, the wise, the well-sacrificed, the Maruts, rejoicing, serve with hymns.

original: eto nv adya sudhyo bhavāma pra ducchunā minavāmā varīyaḥ /
analyzed: nu adya sudhyaḥ bhavāma pra ducchunāḥ minavāma varīyaḥ
translated: Let us be well-disposed today, let us drive away evil report more widely.

original: āre dveṣāṃsi sanutar dadhāmāyāma prāñco yajamānam accha //
analyzed: āre dveṣāṃsi sanutar dadhāma āyāma prāñcaḥ yajamānam accha
translated: Let us place enmities far away, O bountiful one, let us go forward to the sacrificer.

original: etā dhiyaṃ kṛṇavāmā sakhāyo 'pa yā mātāṃ ṛṇuta vrajaṃ goḥ /
analyzed: etā dhiyam kṛṇavāmā sakhāyo pa yā mātā ṛṇuta vrajam goḥ
translated: Let us make this hymn, O friends, to the mother who opened the stall of the cow.

original: yayā manur viśiśipraṃ jigāya yayā vaṇig vaṅkur āpā purīṣam //
analyzed: yayā manuḥ viśiśipram jigāya yayā vaṇij vaṅkuḥ āpa purīṣam
translated: By which Manu conquered Vishishthira, by which the merchant Vankur obtained wealth.

original: anūnod atra hastayato adrir ārcan yena daśa māso navagvāḥ /
analyzed: anūnot atra hasta yataḥ adriḥ ārcan yena daśa māsaḥ navagvāḥ
translated: The mountain, the worker of wonders, has risen up, by which the Dasha and Navagvas

original: ṛtaṃ yatī saramā gā avindad viśvāni satyāṅgirāś cakāra //
analyzed: ṛtam yatī saramā gāḥ avindat viśvāni satyā aṅgirāḥ cakāra
translated: Saramā, going by the truth, found the cows. All things did Angiras make true.

original: viśve asyā vyuṣi māhināyāḥ saṃ yad gobhir aṅgiraso navanta /
analyzed: viśve asyāḥ vyuṣi māhināyāḥ sam yat gobhiḥ aṅgirasaḥ navanta
translated: When the all-gods rejoice in her, in the morning, in her might, when the Angirases sing with the cows,

original: utsa āsām parame sadhastha ṛtasya pathā saramā vidad gāḥ //
analyzed: utsaḥ āsām parame sadhasthe ṛtasya pathā saramā vidat gāḥ
translated: May Saramā find those cows on the path of holy order, in their highest abode, in the spring.

original: ā sūryo yātu saptāśvaḥ kṣetraṃ yad asyorviyā dīrghayāthe /
analyzed: ā sūryaḥ yātu sapta aśvaḥ kṣetram yat asya urviyā dīrgha yāthe
translated: Let the sun go to his realm, drawn by his seven horses, which he hath by his far-reaching might.

original: raghuḥ śyenaḥ patayad andho acchā yuvā kavir dīdayad goṣu gacchan //🔽ā sūryo aruhac chukram arṇo 'yukta yad dharito vītapṛṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: raghuḥ śyenaḥ patayat andhaḥ acchā yuvā kaviḥ dīdayat goṣu gacchan  ā sūryaḥ aruhat śukram arṇaḥ yukta yat haritaḥ vīta pṛṣṭhāḥ
translated: The swift falcon flieth on, the young, the wise, shining, going to the cows.🔽The sun hath mounted the bright realm, when his tawny steeds with variegated backs are yoked.

original: udnā na nāvam anayanta dhīrā āśṛṇvatīr āpo arvāg atiṣṭhan //
analyzed: udnā na nāvam anayanta dhīrāḥ āśṛṇvatīḥ āpaḥ arvāk atiṣṭhan
translated: The wise have led the ship over the waters, as if over a flood; the obedient waters have stood aside.

original: dhiyaṃ vo apsu dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ yayātaran daśa māso navagvāḥ /
analyzed: dhiyam vaḥ apsu dadhiṣe svarṣām yayā ataran daśa māsaḥ navagvāḥ
translated: I place in the waters your thought, which of itself shines, with which the Dasagvas, the Navagvas have come.

original: ayā dhiyā syāma devagopā ayā dhiyā tuturyāmāty aṃhaḥ //
analyzed: ayā dhiyā syāma deva gopāḥ ayā dhiyā tuturyāma ati aṃhaḥ
translated: By that thought may we be protected by the gods; by that thought may we overcome evil.

original: hayo na vidvāṃ ayuji svayaṃ dhuri tāṃ vahāmi prataraṇīm avasyuvam /
analyzed: hayaḥ na vidvān ayuji svayam dhuri tām vahāmi prataraṇīm avasyuvam
translated: The horse, as if knowing, hath yoked himself to the pole; I drive that which leadeth forward, which is to be sought.

original: nāsyā vaśmi vimucaṃ nāvṛtam punar vidvān pathaḥ puraeta ṛju neṣati //
analyzed: na asyāḥ vaśmi vimucam na āvṛtam punar vidvān pathaḥ puraetā ṛju neṣati
translated: I find no release from its noose, nor from its return; the wise one leadeth straight forward on the paths, the leader.

original: agna indra varuṇa mitra devāḥ śardhaḥ pra yanta mārutota viṣṇo /
analyzed: agne indra varuṇa mitra devāḥ śardhaḥ pra yanta māruta uta viṣṇo
translated: O Agni, Indra, Varuna, Mitra, O gods, the Marut host goeth forward, and also Vishnu.

original: ubhā nāsatyā rudro adha gnāḥ pūṣā bhagaḥ sarasvatī juṣanta //
analyzed: ubhā nāsatyā rudraḥ adha gnāḥ pūṣā bhagaḥ sarasvatī juṣanta
translated: The two Nâsatyas, Rudra, the Adhris, the Gnas, Pûshan, Bhaga, Sarasvatî accept (the sacrifice).

original: indrāgnī mitrāvaruṇāditiṃ svaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyām marutaḥ parvatāṃ apaḥ /
analyzed: indra agnī mitrāvaruṇā aditim svar pṛthivīm dyām marutaḥ parvatān apaḥ
translated: Indra and Agni, Mitra, Varuna, Âditya, the sky, the earth, the Maruts, the mountains, the waters,

original: huve viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇas patim bhagaṃ nu śaṃsaṃ savitāram ūtaye //
analyzed: huve viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇaḥ patim bhagam nu śaṃsam savitāram ūtaye
translated: I invoke Vishnu, Pûshan, the lord of prayer, Bhaga, and Narshansa, and Savitar to help.

original: uta no viṣṇur uta vāto asridho draviṇodā uta somo mayas karat /
analyzed: uta naḥ viṣṇuḥ uta vātaḥ asridhaḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ uta somaḥ mayaḥ karat
translated: May Vishnu, and Vâta who gives wealth, and Soma make us happy, and may he who is to be invoked.

original: uta ṛbhava uta rāye no aśvinota tvaṣṭota vibhvānu maṃsate //
analyzed: uta ṛbhavaḥ uta rāye naḥ aśvinā uta tvaṣṭā uta vibhvā anu maṃsate
translated: The Rkvans, and the two Asvins, and Tvashṭar, and the all-powerful (Vishnu) favour us with wealth.

original: uta tyan no mārutaṃ śardha ā gamad divikṣayaṃ yajatam barhir āsade /
analyzed: uta tyad naḥ mārutam śardhaḥ ā gamat divikṣayam yajatam barhiḥ āsade
translated: And may that host of Maruts come to us, seeking the sky, sacrificing, to sit on the sacred grass.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ śarma pūṣota no yamad varūthyaṃ varuṇo mitro aryamā //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ śarma pūṣā uta naḥ yamat varūthyam varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: May Brhaspati, and Pûshan, and Varuna grant us protection, a shelter, and Aryaman.

original: uta tye naḥ parvatāsaḥ suśastayaḥ sudītayo nadyas trāmaṇe bhuvan /
analyzed: uta tye naḥ parvatāsaḥ su śastayaḥ su dītayaḥ nadyaḥ trāmaṇe bhuvan
translated: And may those mountains, those very famous ones, and those well-praised rivers be gracious to us for our help.

original: bhago vibhaktā śavasāvasā gamad uruvyacā aditiḥ śrotu me havam //
analyzed: bhagaḥ vibhaktā śavasā avasā gamat uru vyacāḥ aditiḥ śrotu me havam
translated: May Bhaga, the distributor, come to us with the strength of his power; may Aditi, of wide dominion, hear my call.

original: devānām patnīr uśatīr avantu naḥ prāvantu nas tujaye vājasātaye /
analyzed: devānām patnīḥ uśatīḥ avantu naḥ prāvantu naḥ tujaye vājasātaye
translated: May the loving wives of the gods help us, and favour us for victory and winning spoil.

original: yāḥ pārthivāso yā apām api vrate tā no devīḥ suhavāḥ śarma yacchata //
analyzed: yāḥ pārthivāsaḥ yāḥ apām api vrate tāḥ naḥ devīḥ su havāḥ śarma yacchata
translated: Those who are on earth and those who are in the waters' rule, may those goddesses, swift to listen, grant us protection.

original: uta gnā vyantu devapatnīr indrāṇy agnāyy aśvinī rāṭ /
analyzed: uta gnāḥ vyantu deva patnīḥ indrāṇī agnāyī aśvinī rāj
translated: And may the wives of the gods be favorable, Indrani, Agnani, and the queen of the Ashvins.

original: ā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīr ya ṛtur janīnām //
analyzed: ā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīḥ yaḥ ṛtuḥ janīnām
translated: May Varunani hear the two world-halves, and may the goddesses who are the seasons of women be favorable.

original: prayuñjatī diva eti bruvāṇā mahī mātā duhitur bodhayantī /
analyzed: prayuñjatī divaḥ eti bruvāṇā mahī mātā duhituḥ bodhayantī
translated: She who sends forth, going to heaven, speaking, the great mother, awakening her daughter,

original: āvivāsantī yuvatir manīṣā pitṛbhya ā sadane johuvānā //
analyzed: āvivāsantī yuvatiḥ manīṣā pitṛbhyaḥ ā sadane johuvānā
translated: The young maiden, the thought, dwelling together, calling to the fathers in the assembly.

original: ajirāsas tadapa īyamānā ātasthivāṃso amṛtasya nābhim /
analyzed: ajirāsaḥ tad apaḥ īyamānāḥ ātasthivāṃsaḥ amṛtasya nābhim
translated: The swift ones, then, going away, having settled on the navel of immortality,

original: anantāsa uravo viśvataḥ sīm pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti panthāḥ //
analyzed: anantāsaḥ uravaḥ viśvatas sīm pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti panthāḥ
translated: The endless serpents, on all sides, the paths go around the sky and earth.

original: ukṣā samudro aruṣaḥ suparṇaḥ pūrvasya yonim pitur ā viveśa /
analyzed: ukṣā samudraḥ aruṣaḥ suparṇaḥ pūrvasya yonim pituḥ ā viveśa
translated: The bull, the ocean, the red bird has entered the birthplace of the eastern father.

original: madhye divo nihitaḥ pṛśnir aśmā vi cakrame rajasas pāty antau //
analyzed: madhye divaḥ nihitaḥ pṛśniḥ aśmā vi cakrame rajasaḥ pāti antau
translated: The speckled stone, placed in the middle of the sky, moves along, guarding the ends of the atmosphere.

original: catvāra īm bibhrati kṣemayanto daśa garbhaṃ carase dhāpayante /
analyzed: catvāraḥ īm bibhrati kṣemayantaḥ daśa garbham carase dhāpayante
translated: Four support him, making him secure, ten nourish the embryo for movement.

original: tridhātavaḥ paramā asya gāvo divaś caranti pari sadyo antān //
analyzed: tri dhātavaḥ paramāḥ asya gāvaḥ divaḥ caranti pari sadyas antān
translated: The highest cows of this one, of three forms, move around the ends of the sky in a moment.

original: idaṃ vapur nivacanaṃ janāsaś caranti yan nadyas tasthur āpaḥ /🔽dve yad īm bibhṛto mātur anye iheha jāte yamyā sabandhū //
analyzed: idam vapuḥ nivacanam janāsaḥ caranti yat nadyaḥ tasthuḥ āpaḥ  dve yat īm bibhṛtaḥ mātuḥ anye iha iha jāte yamyā sabandhū
translated: This body, this speech, these people move, the rivers have stood still, the waters.🔽When thou bearest the two other brothers of thy mother, here born together with Yama.

original: vi tanvate dhiyo asmā apāṃsi vastrā putrāya mātaro vayanti /
analyzed: vi tanvate dhiyaḥ asmai apāṃsi vastrā putrāya mātaraḥ vayanti
translated: They spread out their thoughts for him, the garments, the mothers weave garments for the son.

original: upaprakṣe vṛṣaṇo modamānā divas pathā vadhvo yanty accha //
analyzed: upaprakṣe vṛṣaṇaḥ modamānāḥ divaḥ pathā vadhvaḥ yanti accha
translated: The two bulls, rejoicing, descend, the brides go to him by the path of the sky.

original: tad astu mitrāvaruṇā tad agne śaṃ yor asmabhyam idam astu śastam /
analyzed: tat astu mitrāvaruṇā tat agne śam yos asmabhyam idam astu śastam
translated: Let that be, O Mitra-Varuṇa, let that be, O Agni, let that be a blessing to us, let that be a good thing for us.

original: aśīmahi gādham uta pratiṣṭhāṃ namo dive bṛhate sādanāya //
analyzed: aśīmahi gādham uta pratiṣṭhām namaḥ dive bṛhate sādanāya
translated: May we find the ford and the support. Homage to the great sky, to the seat.

original: kad u priyāya dhāmne manāmahe svakṣatrāya svayaśase mahe vayam /
analyzed: kad u priyāya dhāmne manāmahe svakṣatrāya sva yaśase mahe vayam
translated: How shall we think of the dear abode, of the one of mighty power, of the one of great glory?

original: āmenyasya rajaso yad abhra āṃ apo vṛṇānā vitanoti māyinī //
analyzed: āmenyasya rajasaḥ yat abhre ām apaḥ vṛṇānā vitanoti māyinī
translated: When the cloud, of the changeable realm, taking the waters, spreads out, the one who works wonders.

original: tā atnata vayunaṃ vīravakṣaṇaṃ samānyā vṛtayā viśvam ā rajaḥ /🔽apo apācīr aparā apejate pra pūrvābhis tirate devayur janaḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ atnata vayunam vīra vakṣaṇam samānyā vṛtayā viśvam ā rajaḥ  apaḥ apācīḥ aparāḥ apejate pra pūrvābhiḥ tirate devayuḥ janaḥ
translated: They have spread out the abode, the one with heroic strength, with one common covering, through the whole realm.🔽The one who goes to the west goes beyond the waters, the one who is devoted to the gods goes forth with the eastern ones.

original: ā grāvabhir ahanyebhir aktubhir variṣṭhaṃ vajram ā jigharti māyini /
analyzed: ā grāvabhiḥ ahanyebhiḥ aktubhiḥ variṣṭham vajram ā jigharti māyini
translated: With the pressing-stones, with the daily oblations, the one who works wonders hurls the most excellent thunderbolt.

original: śataṃ vā yasya pracaran sve dame saṃvartayanto vi ca vartayann ahā //
analyzed: śatam vā yasya pracaran sve dame saṃvartayantaḥ vi ca vartayan ahā
translated: He who, in his own abode, turning a hundred times, and turning away the days,

original: tām asya rītim paraśor iva praty anīkam akhyam bhuje asya varpasaḥ /
analyzed: tām asya rītim paraśoḥ iva prati anīkam akhyam bhuje asya varpasaḥ
translated: I have declared his form to be like that of an axe, I have seen the face of his wondrous power.

original: sacā yadi pitumantam iva kṣayaṃ ratnaṃ dadhāti bharahūtaye viśe //
analyzed: sacā yadi pitumantam iva kṣayam ratnam dadhāti bhara hūtaye viśe
translated: If he bestows wealth like a house filled with food, for the sake of the assembly that is invited.

original: sa jihvayā caturanīka ṛñjate cāru vasāno varuṇo yatann arim /
analyzed: sa jihvayā catur anīkaḥ ṛñjate cāru vasānaḥ varuṇaḥ yatan arim
translated: He, the four-cornered one, shines with his tongue, Varuna, clothed in beauty, striving for freedom from foes.

original: na tasya vidma puruṣatvatā vayaṃ yato bhagaḥ savitā dāti vāryam //
analyzed: na tasya vidma puruṣatva tā vayam yatas bhagaḥ savitā dāti vāryam
translated: We do not know his manhood, from where Bhaga, Savitar, bestows the prize.

original: devaṃ vo adya savitāram eṣe bhagaṃ ca ratnaṃ vibhajantam āyoḥ /
analyzed: devam vaḥ adya savitāram eṣe bhagam ca ratnam vibhajantam āyoḥ
translated: Today I seek to you, O Savitar, the god, and Bhaga, who distributes the treasure of life.

original: ā vāṃ narā purubhujā vavṛtyāṃ divedive cid aśvinā sakhīyan //
analyzed: ā vām narā puru bhujā vavṛtyām dive dive cit aśvinā sakhīyan
translated: I turn to you, O men, who have many hands, O Asvins, even day by day, seeking friendship.

original: prati prayāṇam asurasya vidvān sūktair devaṃ savitāraṃ duvasya /
analyzed: prati prayāṇam asurasya vidvān sūktaiḥ devam savitāram duvasya
translated: Knowing the course of the Asura, serve the god Savitar with hymns,

original: upa bruvīta namasā vijānañ jyeṣṭhaṃ ca ratnaṃ vibhajantam āyoḥ //
analyzed: upa bruvīta namasā vijānam jyeṣṭham ca ratnam vibhajantam āyoḥ
translated: Knowing, one should address him with reverence, the eldest, who distributes the treasure of life.

original: adatrayā dayate vāryāṇi pūṣā bhago aditir vasta usraḥ /
analyzed: adatrayā dayate vāryāṇi pūṣā bhagaḥ aditiḥ vaste usraḥ
translated: Pusha, Bhaga, Aditi, the dawn bestow the boons, the good things,

original: indro viṣṇur varuṇo mitro agnir ahāni bhadrā janayanta dasmāḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ viṣṇuḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ ahāni bhadrā janayanta dasmāḥ
translated: Indra, Vishnu, Varuna, Mitra, Agni, the terrible ones, produce the auspicious days.

original: tan no anarvā savitā varūthaṃ tat sindhava iṣayanto anu gman /
analyzed: tat naḥ anarvā savitā varūtham tat sindhavaḥ iṣayantaḥ anu gman
translated: That protection of ours, Savitar, that is not to be surpassed, that the streams have reached in their course,

original: upa yad voce adhvarasya hotā rāyaḥ syāma patayo vājaratnāḥ //🔽pra ye vasubhya īvad ā namo dur ye mitre varuṇe sūktavācaḥ /
analyzed: upa yat voce adhvarasya hotā rāyaḥ syāma patayaḥ vāja ratnāḥ  pra ye vasubhyaḥ īvat ā namaḥ duḥ ye mitre varuṇe sūkta vācaḥ
translated: To which the priest of the sacrifice speaks, may we be lords of wealth, possessors of treasure.🔽Those who have offered worship to the Vasus, those who have offered praise to Mitra, Varuna,

original: avaitv abhvaṃ kṛṇutā varīyo divaspṛthivyor avasā madema //
analyzed: avaitu abhvam kṛṇuta varīyaḥ divaspṛthivyoḥ avasā madema
translated: May they remove misfortune, make a wider room, and through the help of heaven and earth may we rejoice.

original: viśvo devasya netur marto vurīta sakhyam /
analyzed: viśvaḥ devasya netuḥ martaḥ vurīta sakhyam
translated: May every mortal man win the friendship of the guiding God.

original: viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṃ vṛṇīta puṣyase //
analyzed: viśvaḥ rāyaḥ iṣudhyati dyumnam vṛṇīta puṣyase
translated: May every man long for wealth, and choose glory that he may prosper.

original: te te deva netar ye cemāṃ anuśase /
analyzed: te te deva netar ye ca imām anuśase
translated: Those of you, O guiding God, who rule over these (people),

original: te rāyā te hy āpṛce sacemahi sacathyaiḥ //🔽ato na ā nṝn atithīn ataḥ patnīr daśasyata /
analyzed: te rāyā te hi āpṛce sacemahi sacathyaiḥ  atas naḥ ā nṝn atithīn atas patnīḥ daśasyata
translated: Through wealth may we be united with them, and with those who are to be united.🔽From here honour the men, the guests, from here the wives.

original: āre viśvam patheṣṭhāṃ dviṣo yuyotu yūyuviḥ //
analyzed: āre viśvam patheṣṭhām dviṣaḥ yuyotu yūyuviḥ
translated: Keep all the paths of the foe afar, let the pursuer pursue.

original: yatra vahnir abhihito dudravad droṇyaḥ paśuḥ /
analyzed: yatra vahniḥ abhihitaḥ dudravat droṇyaḥ paśuḥ
translated: Where the fire, the animal, was set in motion, the waters flowed.

original: nṛmaṇā vīrapastyo 'rṇā dhīreva sanitā //
analyzed: nṛmaṇāḥ vīra pastyoḥ rṇā dhīrā iva sanitā
translated: The man-conquering, hero-loving (waters), the deep, are wise, to be gained by thought.

original: eṣa te deva netā rathaspatiḥ śaṃ rayiḥ /
analyzed: eṣa te deva netā rathaspatiḥ śam rayiḥ
translated: This is thy guiding God, the lord of the chariot, prosperity.

original: śaṃ rāye śaṃ svastaya iṣastuto manāmahe devastuto manāmahe //
analyzed: śam rāye śam svastaye iṣa stutaḥ manāmahe deva stutaḥ manāmahe
translated: For prosperity, for well-being, we think of the praised food, we think of the praised god.

original: agne sutasya pītaye viśvair ūmebhir ā gahi /
analyzed: agne sutasya pītaye viśvaiḥ ūmebhiḥ ā gahi
translated: O Agni, come with all the Ūm sounds to drink the Soma juice,

original: devebhir havyadātaye //
analyzed: devebhiḥ havya dātaye
translated: With the gods to carry the oblation.

original: ṛtadhītaya ā gata satyadharmāṇo adhvaram /
analyzed: ṛta dhītayaḥ ā gata satya dharmāṇaḥ adhvaram
translated: O you who have truth as your law, come to the sacrifice.

original: agneḥ pibata jihvayā //
analyzed: agneḥ pibata jihvayā
translated: Drink with Agni's tongue.

original: viprebhir vipra santya prātaryāvabhir ā gahi /
analyzed: viprebhiḥ vipra santya prātaryāvabhiḥ ā gahi
translated: O you who are wise with the wise, come with the morning offerings.

original: devebhiḥ somapītaye //
analyzed: devebhiḥ soma pītaye
translated: With the gods to drink the Soma.

original: ayaṃ somaś camū suto 'matre pari ṣicyate /
analyzed: ayam somaḥ camū sutaḥ matre pari sicyate
translated: This Soma, pressed in the mortar, is poured into the cup.

original: priya indrāya vāyave //🔽vāyav ā yāhi vītaye juṣāṇo havyadātaye /
analyzed: priyaḥ indrāya vāyave  vāyo ā yāhi vītaye juṣāṇaḥ havya dātaye
translated: Dear to Indra and Vayu.🔽O Vayu, come to the feast, accepting the offering of oblations.

original: pibā sutasyāndhaso abhi prayaḥ //
analyzed: pibā sutasya andhasaḥ abhi prayaḥ
translated: Drink of the pressed Soma, for the sake of the oblation.

original: indraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ sutānām pītim arhathaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ ca vāyo eṣām sutānām pītim arhathaḥ
translated: O Indra and Vayu, you deserve to drink of these pressed juices.

original: tāñ juṣethām arepasāv abhi prayaḥ //
analyzed: tām juṣethām arepasau abhi prayaḥ
translated: Accept them, you two who are unblemished, for the sake of the oblation.

original: sutā indrāya vāyave somāso dadhyāśiraḥ /
analyzed: sutāḥ indrāya vāyave somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ
translated: The pressed Soma juices, O Indra and Vayu, are mixed with curds.

original: nimnaṃ na yanti sindhavo 'bhi prayaḥ //
analyzed: nimnam na yanti sindhavaḥ bhi prayaḥ
translated: They flow like rivers to the low ground, for the sake of the oblation.

original: sajūr viśvebhir devebhir aśvibhyām uṣasā sajūḥ /
analyzed: sajūs viśvebhiḥ devebhiḥ aśvibhyām uṣasā sajūs
translated: United with all the gods, with the Ashvins, united with dawn,

original: ā yāhy agne atrivat sute raṇa //
analyzed: ā yāhi agne atri vat sute raṇa
translated: Come, O Agni, to the pressed (juice), like Atri, for the sake of the oblation.

original: sajūr mitrāvaruṇābhyāṃ sajūḥ somena viṣṇunā /
analyzed: sajūs mitrāvaruṇābhyām sajūs somena viṣṇunā
translated: United with Mitra and Varuna, united with Soma and Vishnu,

original: ā yāhy agne atrivat sute raṇa //
analyzed: ā yāhi agne atri vat sute raṇa
translated: Come hither, O Agni, like Atri, to the pressed (juice), to the juice that is pressed.

original: sajūr ādityair vasubhiḥ sajūr indreṇa vāyunā /
analyzed: sajūs ādityaiḥ vasubhiḥ sajūs indreṇa vāyunā
translated: United with the Âdityas, united with the Vasus, united with Indra, with Vâyu,

original: ā yāhy agne atrivat sute raṇa //🔽svasti no mimītām aśvinā bhagaḥ svasti devy aditir anarvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ā yāhi agne atri vat sute raṇa  svasti naḥ mimītām aśvinā bhagaḥ svasti devī aditiḥ anarvaṇaḥ
translated: Come hither, O Agni, like Atri, to the pressed (juice), to the juice that is pressed.🔽May the Asvins, Bhaga, and the Goddess Aditi, who needeth not a chariot, grant us welfare.

original: svasti pūṣā asuro dadhātu naḥ svasti dyāvāpṛthivī sucetunā //
analyzed: svasti pūṣā asuraḥ dadhātu naḥ svasti dyāvāpṛthivī sucetunā
translated: May the Asura Pûshan grant us welfare, and Heaven and Earth with fair choice.

original: svastaye vāyum upa bravāmahai somaṃ svasti bhuvanasya yas patiḥ /
analyzed: svastaye vāyum upa bravāmahai somam svasti bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ
translated: For welfare let us call on Vâyu, on Soma who is the lord of the world, for welfare.

original: bṛhaspatiṃ sarvagaṇaṃ svastaye svastaya ādityāso bhavantu naḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim sarva gaṇam svastaye svastaye ādityāsaḥ bhavantu naḥ
translated: On Br̥ihaspati with all his band for welfare: may the Âdityas be for our welfare.

original: viśve devā no adyā svastaye vaiśvānaro vasur agniḥ svastaye /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ naḥ adya svastaye vaiśvānaraḥ vasuḥ agniḥ svastaye
translated: May all the Gods this day be gracious to us for welfare, may the good Agni Vaisvânara be for welfare.

original: devā avantv ṛbhavaḥ svastaye svasti no rudraḥ pātv aṃhasaḥ //
analyzed: devāḥ avantu ṛbhavaḥ svastaye svasti naḥ rudraḥ pātu aṃhasaḥ
translated: May the Gods, the Rkvans, be for our welfare: may Rudra guard us from distress.

original: svasti mitrāvaruṇā svasti pathye revati /
analyzed: svasti mitrāvaruṇā svasti pathye revati
translated: Welfare to us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, welfare, O Revanta, on the path.

original: svasti na indraś cāgniś ca svasti no adite kṛdhi //
analyzed: svasti naḥ indraḥ ca agniḥ ca svasti naḥ adite kṛdhi
translated: Grant thou welfare to us, O Agni, and to Indra.

original: svasti panthām anu carema sūryācandramasāv iva /
analyzed: svasti panthām anu carema sūryācandramasau iva
translated: Along the path of welfare may we go, as it were, the sun and moon.

original: punar dadatāghnatā jānatā saṃ gamemahi //
analyzed: punar dadatā a ghnatā jānatā sam gamemahi
translated: May we meet again, giving, not slaying, knowing.

original: pra śyāvāśva dhṛṣṇuyārcā marudbhir ṛkvabhiḥ /
analyzed: pra śyāvāśva dhṛṣṇuyā arca marudbhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ
translated: O Śyāvāśva, with the Maruts who delight in praise, with the singers,

original: ye adrogham anuṣvadhaṃ śravo madanti yajñiyāḥ //
analyzed: ye adrogham anuṣvadham śravaḥ madanti yajñiyāḥ
translated: Those who rejoice in the truthful, the straight, the sacrificial glory.

original: te hi sthirasya śavasaḥ sakhāyaḥ santi dhṛṣṇuyā /🔽te yāmann ā dhṛṣadvinas tmanā pānti śaśvataḥ //
analyzed: te hi sthirasya śavasaḥ sakhāyaḥ santi dhṛṣṇuyā  te yāman ā dhṛṣadvinaḥ tmanā pānti śaśvataḥ
translated: For they are the friends of firm strength, of daring.🔽They, in their course, ever protect the daring ones.

original: te syandrāso nokṣaṇo 'ti ṣkandanti śarvarīḥ /
analyzed: te syandrāsaḥ na ukṣaṇaḥ ti skandanti śarvarīḥ
translated: Those swift ones, those anointed ones, they leap over the nights.

original: marutām adhā maho divi kṣamā ca manmahe //
analyzed: marutām adhā mahaḥ divi kṣamā ca manmahe
translated: We think of the great Maruts in the sky and on earth.

original: marutsu vo dadhīmahi stomaṃ yajñaṃ ca dhṛṣṇuyā /
analyzed: marutsu vaḥ dadhīmahi stomam yajñam ca dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: We will place our praise and sacrifice in the Maruts, in the daring ones,

original: viśve ye mānuṣā yugā pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ //
analyzed: viśve ye mānuṣā yugā pānti martyam riṣaḥ
translated: All those who in the human ages protect mortals from harm.

original: arhanto ye sudānavo naro asāmiśavasaḥ /
analyzed: arhantaḥ ye sudānavaḥ naraḥ asāmi śavasaḥ
translated: Those who are worthy, the bountiful, the men who have abundant strength,

original: pra yajñaṃ yajñiyebhyo divo arcā marudbhyaḥ //
analyzed: pra yajñam yajñiyebhyaḥ divaḥ arca marudbhyaḥ
translated: To the worthy ones, to the Maruts, I offer the sacrifice with the praise of heaven.

original: ā rukmair ā yudhā nara ṛṣvā ṛṣṭīr asṛkṣata /
analyzed: ā rukmaiḥ ā yudhā naraḥ ṛṣvāḥ ṛṣṭīḥ asṛkṣata
translated: With their rays, with their weapons, the men, the tall ones, have sent forth their spears.

original: anv enāṃ aha vidyuto maruto jajjhatīr iva bhānur arta tmanā divaḥ //
analyzed: anu enām aha vidyutaḥ marutaḥ jajjhatīḥ iva bhānuḥ arta tmanā divaḥ
translated: The Maruts, like roaring clouds, have followed this lightning. The light moves by itself from the sky.

original: ye vāvṛdhanta pārthivā ya urāv antarikṣa ā /
analyzed: ye vāvṛdhanta pārthivāḥ ye urau antarikṣe ā
translated: Those who have grown on earth, who are in the wide atmosphere,

original: vṛjane vā nadīnāṃ sadhasthe vā maho divaḥ //
analyzed: vṛjane vā nadīnām sadhasthe vā mahaḥ divaḥ
translated: In the race of the rivers, or in the great abode of the sky.

original: śardho mārutam uc chaṃsa satyaśavasam ṛbhvasam /
analyzed: śardhaḥ mārutam ud śaṃsa satya śavasam ṛbhvasam
translated: Praise the Marut host, of true might, of mighty power.

original: uta sma te śubhe naraḥ pra syandrā yujata tmanā //
analyzed: uta sma te śubhe naraḥ pra syandrā yujata tmanā
translated: And the splendid men have yoked themselves to your chariot, O Indra, of their own accord.

original: uta sma te paruṣṇyām ūrṇā vasata śundhyavaḥ /
analyzed: uta sma te paruṣṇyām ūrṇāḥ vasata śundhyavaḥ
translated: And on the Parushni, the wool-dwellers, the pure-dwellers,

original: uta pavyā rathānām adrim bhindanty ojasā //
analyzed: uta pavyā rathānām adrim bhindanti ojasā
translated: And the wheels of the chariots, with their power, burst the rock.

original: āpathayo vipathayo 'ntaspathā anupathāḥ /
analyzed: āpathayaḥ vipathayaḥ ntaspathāḥ anupathāḥ
translated: The straight-going, the cross-going, the going on the paths, the going on the bypaths,

original: etebhir mahyaṃ nāmabhir yajñaṃ viṣṭāra ohate //
analyzed: etebhiḥ mahyam nāmabhiḥ yajñam viṣṭāre ohate
translated: With these names of yours, O Yajna, the spreaders of the sacrifice carry you.

original: adhā naro ny ohate 'dhā niyuta ohate /
analyzed: adhā naraḥ ni ohate dhāḥ niyutaḥ ohate
translated: Then the men carry you, then the teams carry you,

original: adhā pārāvatā iti citrā rūpāṇi darśyā //
analyzed: adhā pārāvatāḥ iti citrā rūpāṇi darśyā
translated: Then the pigeons, showing various forms, carry you.

original: chandastubhaḥ kubhanyava utsam ā kīriṇo nṛtuḥ /
analyzed: chanda stubhaḥ kubhanyavaḥ utsam ā kīriṇaḥ nṛtuḥ
translated: The Chandomas, the Kubhanas, the Kairatas have danced around the spring.

original: te me ke cin na tāyava ūmā āsan dṛśi tviṣe //
analyzed: te me ke cit na tāyavaḥ ūmāḥ āsan dṛśi tviṣe
translated: Some of them, the impetuous ones, have been friendly to me, to be seen in their splendor.

original: ya ṛṣvā ṛṣṭividyutaḥ kavayaḥ santi vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: ye ṛṣvāḥ ṛṣṭi vidyutaḥ kavayaḥ santi vedhasaḥ
translated: Those who are lofty, with swords and lightning, who are wise, who are creators,

original: tam ṛṣe mārutaṃ gaṇaṃ namasyā ramayā girā //
analyzed: tam ṛṣe mārutam gaṇam namasya ramaya girā
translated: To that Marut host, O Rishi, I pay homage with a delightful song.

original: accha ṛṣe mārutaṃ gaṇaṃ dānā mitraṃ na yoṣaṇā /
analyzed: accha ṛṣe mārutam gaṇam dānā mitram na yoṣaṇā
translated: Come, O Rishi, to the Marut host, like a woman to a generous friend,

original: divo vā dhṛṣṇava ojasā stutā dhībhir iṣaṇyata //
analyzed: divaḥ vā dhṛṣṇavaḥ ojasā stutāḥ dhībhiḥ iṣaṇyata
translated: Or like the bold ones of heaven with their power, be delighted with the praises.

original: nū manvāna eṣāṃ devāṃ acchā na vakṣaṇā /
analyzed: nu manvānaḥ eṣām devān acchā na vakṣaṇā
translated: Now, thinking of them, the gods have come to the sacrifice,

original: dānā saceta sūribhir yāmaśrutebhir añjibhiḥ //
analyzed: dānā saceta sūribhiḥ yāma śrutebhiḥ añjibhiḥ
translated: With gifts, O ye wise ones, with the famous ones, with the anointed ones.

original: pra ye me bandhveṣe gāṃ vocanta sūrayaḥ pṛśniṃ vocanta mātaram /
analyzed: pra ye me bandhu eṣe gām vocanta sūrayaḥ pṛśnim vocanta mātaram
translated: Those who proclaim my kinsmen, the nobles, proclaim the cow, proclaim the dappled mother.

original: adhā pitaram iṣmiṇaṃ rudraṃ vocanta śikvasaḥ //
analyzed: adhā pitaram iṣmiṇam rudram vocanta śikvasaḥ
translated: Then the powerful ones proclaim the father Rudra.

original: sapta me sapta śākina ekamekā śatā daduḥ /
analyzed: sapta me sapta śākinaḥ ekam ekā śatā daduḥ
translated: Seven times seven powerful ones gave me one hundred each.

original: yamunāyām adhi śrutam ud rādho gavyam mṛje ni rādho aśvyam mṛje //
analyzed: yamunāyām adhi śrutam ud rādhaḥ gavyam mṛje ni rādhaḥ aśvyam mṛje
translated: I have obtained the famous cattle wealth on the Yamunā, I have obtained the horse wealth.

original: ko veda jānam eṣāṃ ko vā purā sumneṣv āsa marutām /
analyzed: kaḥ veda jānam eṣām kaḥ vā purā sumneṣu āsa marutām
translated: Who knows their lineage? Who was with them in the past in their favors, of the Maruts,

original: yad yuyujre kilāsyaḥ //
analyzed: yat yuyujre kilāsyaḥ
translated: When they yoked their chariots?

original: aitān ratheṣu tasthuṣaḥ kaḥ śuśrāva kathā yayuḥ /
analyzed: ā etān ratheṣu tasthuṣaḥ kaḥ śuśrāva kathā yayuḥ
translated: Who has heard them standing in their chariots? Who has seen where they went?

original: kasmai sasruḥ sudāse anv āpaya iḷābhir vṛṣṭayaḥ saha //
analyzed: kasmai sasruḥ sudāse anu āpayaḥ iḷābhiḥ vṛṣṭayaḥ saha
translated: For what good man did the rains follow with the Iḷās?

original: te ma āhur ya āyayur upa dyubhir vibhir made /
analyzed: te me āhuḥ ye āyayuḥ upa dyubhiḥ vibhiḥ made
translated: They tell me that they have come with the luminous ones, with the radiant ones, in the intoxication.

original: naro maryā arepasa imān paśyann iti ṣṭuhi //
analyzed: naraḥ maryāḥ arepasaḥ imān paśyan iti stuhi
translated: The men, the spotless ones, seeing these, say, Praise them!

original: ye añjiṣu ye vāśīṣu svabhānavaḥ srakṣu rukmeṣu khādiṣu /
analyzed: ye añjiṣu ye vāśīṣu sva bhānavaḥ srakṣu rukmeṣu khādiṣu
translated: Those who are in the ornaments, those who are in the weapons, the self-shining ones, in the shafts, in the golden ones, in the biting ones,

original: śrāyā ratheṣu dhanvasu //
analyzed: śrāyāḥ ratheṣu dhanvasu
translated: In the chariots, in the bows.

original: yuṣmākaṃ smā rathāṃ anu mude dadhe maruto jīradānavaḥ /
analyzed: yuṣmākam smā rathān anu mude dadhe marutaḥ jīra dānavaḥ
translated: I have placed my joy in your chariots, O Maruts, you who give quickly.

original: vṛṣṭī dyāvo yatīr iva //
analyzed: vṛṣṭī dyāvaḥ yatīḥ iva
translated: The rains, like moving heavens.

original: ā yaṃ naraḥ sudānavo dadāśuṣe divaḥ kośam acucyavuḥ /
analyzed: ā yam naraḥ sudānavaḥ dadāśuṣe divaḥ kośam acucyavuḥ
translated: Whom the men, the givers of good gifts, have shaken for the worshipper from the quiver of the sky.

original: vi parjanyaṃ sṛjanti rodasī anu dhanvanā yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ //🔽tatṛdānāḥ sindhavaḥ kṣodasā rajaḥ pra sasrur dhenavo yathā /
analyzed: vi parjanyam sṛjanti rodasī anu dhanvanā yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ  tatṛdānāḥ sindhavaḥ kṣodasā rajaḥ pra sasruḥ dhenavaḥ yathā
translated: They send forth Parjanya, the two world-halves, the rains move along the water-course.🔽The rivers have flowed, with their flood, through the dust, they have flowed forth like milch-kine.

original: syannā aśvā ivādhvano vimocane vi yad vartanta enyaḥ //
analyzed: syannāḥ aśvāḥ iva adhvanaḥ vimocane vi yat vartante enyaḥ
translated: When they are yoked, like horses on a journey, for the loosing, when they are scattered in different directions.

original: ā yāta maruto diva āntarikṣād amād uta /
analyzed: ā yāta marutaḥ divaḥ āntarikṣāt amāt uta
translated: Come, O Maruts, from the sky, from the atmosphere, and from the earth.

original: māva sthāta parāvataḥ //
analyzed: mā ava sthāta parāvataḥ
translated: Do not stay away from afar.

original: mā vo rasānitabhā kubhā krumur mā vaḥ sindhur ni rīramat /
analyzed: mā vaḥ rasā anitabhā kubhā krumuḥ mā vaḥ sindhuḥ ni rīramat
translated: Let not the water-loving Kuṣmā or Krumur stay you, let not the river hold you back.

original: mā vaḥ pari ṣṭhāt sarayuḥ purīṣiṇy asme it sumnam astu vaḥ //
analyzed: mā vaḥ pari sthāt sarayuḥ purīṣiṇī asme id sumnam astu vaḥ
translated: Let not the river Sarayu, which has its waters in the dust, stay you around. May your favour be with us.

original: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ rathānāṃ tveṣaṃ gaṇam mārutaṃ navyasīnām /
analyzed: tam vaḥ śardham rathānām tveṣam gaṇam mārutam navyasīnām
translated: That your troop of chariots, that your brilliant host, the Maruts, of the newest (songs),

original: anu pra yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: anu pra yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: The rains follow.

original: śardhaṃśardhaṃ va eṣāṃ vrātaṃvrātaṃ gaṇaṃgaṇaṃ suśastibhiḥ /
analyzed: śardham śardham vaḥ eṣām vrātam vrātam gaṇam gaṇam su śastibhiḥ
translated: Each troop of theirs, each band, each host, with good praises,

original: anu krāmema dhītibhiḥ //
analyzed: anu krāmema dhītibhiḥ
translated: We would follow with our thoughts.

original: kasmā adya sujātāya rātahavyāya pra yayuḥ /
analyzed: kasmai adya sujātāya rāta havyāya pra yayuḥ
translated: To what good-born one, to whom oblations are brought, have they gone today,

original: enā yāmena marutaḥ //
analyzed: enā yāmena marutaḥ
translated: The Maruts, with that going of yours?

original: yena tokāya tanayāya dhānyam bījaṃ vahadhve akṣitam /
analyzed: yena tokāya tanayāya dhānyam bījam vahadhve akṣitam
translated: With which you carry to your offspring and children grain, seed that is inexhaustible,

original: asmabhyaṃ tad dhattana yad va īmahe rādho viśvāyu saubhagam //
analyzed: asmabhyam tat dhattana yat vaḥ īmahe rādhaḥ viśvāyu saubhagam
translated: Grant us that, O ye All-Gods, which we implore, wealth that shall last for all our lives, and bliss.

original: atīyāma nidas tiraḥ svastibhir hitvāvadyam arātīḥ /
analyzed: atīyāma nidaḥ tiras svastibhiḥ hitvā avadyam arātīḥ
translated: May we pass over all misfortunes by means of blessings, leaving sin and enmity behind.

original: vṛṣṭvī śaṃ yor āpa usri bheṣajaṃ syāma marutaḥ saha //
analyzed: vṛṣṭvī śam yoḥ āpaḥ usri bheṣajam syāma marutaḥ saha
translated: May the rain-giving, auspicious Maruts be our medicine in sickness, in the conflict of the two hosts.

original: sudevaḥ samahāsati suvīro naro marutaḥ sa martyaḥ /
analyzed: su devaḥ samaha asati su vīraḥ naraḥ marutaḥ sa martyaḥ
translated: The man who has good sons, O Maruts, and good heroes, that mortal whom ye protect,

original: yaṃ trāyadhve syāma te //🔽stuhi bhojān stuvato asya yāmani raṇan gāvo na yavase /
analyzed: yam trāyadhve syāma te  stuhi bhojān stuvataḥ asya yāmani raṇan gāvaḥ na yavase
translated: May we be such, O ye who are easy to invoke.🔽Praise the Bhojas, praise them as they come to this singer's call, like cattle to the fodder.

original: yataḥ pūrvāṃ iva sakhīṃr anu hvaya girā gṛṇīhi kāminaḥ //
analyzed: yatas pūrvān iva sakhīṃr anu hvaya girā gṛṇīhi kāminaḥ
translated: Call hither with the song, as to old friends, the lovers of the song.

original: pra śardhāya mārutāya svabhānava imāṃ vācam anajā parvatacyute /
analyzed: pra śardhāya mārutāya sva bhānave imām vācam anajā parvata cyute
translated: To the rushing Marut host, shining in their own light, to the slayers of the mountain, direct this speech of ours.

original: gharmastubhe diva ā pṛṣṭhayajvane dyumnaśravase mahi nṛmṇam arcata //
analyzed: gharma stubhe divaḥ ā pṛṣṭhayajvane dyumna śravase mahi nṛmṇam arcata
translated: To him who warms his mouth with the hot draught, who offers on the back of the sky, to him who makes the fame of glory resound, offer great strength.

original: pra vo marutas taviṣā udanyavo vayovṛdho aśvayujaḥ parijrayaḥ /
analyzed: pra vaḥ marutaḥ taviṣāḥ udanyavaḥ vayaḥ vṛdhaḥ aśva yujaḥ parijrayaḥ
translated: O ye Maruts, who increase your strength, who are turned towards the north, who increase life, who are yoked with horses, who go round in a circle,

original: saṃ vidyutā dadhati vāśati tritaḥ svaranty āpo 'vanā parijrayaḥ //
analyzed: sam vidyutā dadhati vāśati tritaḥ svaranti āpaḥ vanā parijrayaḥ
translated: Trita, with lightning, brings together the three, the three who roar. The waters, who go round in a circle, sing.

original: vidyunmahaso naro aśmadidyavo vātatviṣo marutaḥ parvatacyutaḥ /
analyzed: vidyut mahasaḥ naraḥ aśma didyavaḥ vāta tviṣaḥ marutaḥ parvata cyutaḥ
translated: The men who have lightning for their might, who hurl the stone, the Maruts whose splendour is like the wind, who come down from the mountain,

original: abdayā cin muhur ā hrādunīvṛta stanayadamā rabhasā udojasaḥ //
analyzed: abdayā cit muhur ā hrādunīvṛta stanaya damāḥ rabhasāḥ udojasaḥ
translated: Like two roaring clouds, they often roar for a year, thundering, swift, with great strength.

original: vy aktūn rudrā vy ahāni śikvaso vy antarikṣaṃ vi rajāṃsi dhūtayaḥ /
analyzed: vi aktūn rudrāḥ vi ahāni śikvasaḥ vi antarikṣam vi rajāṃsi dhūtayaḥ
translated: The Rudras have scattered the rays, the days, the swift ones have scattered the atmosphere, the dust-bearing ones the spaces,

original: vi yad ajrāṃ ajatha nāva īṃ yathā vi durgāṇi maruto nāha riṣyatha //
analyzed: vi yat ajrām ajatha nāvaḥ īm yathā vi durgāṇi marutaḥ na aha riṣyatha
translated: When you have gone through the difficult ones like a boat, O Maruts, you do not perish like a bird.

original: tad vīryaṃ vo maruto mahitvanaṃ dīrghaṃ tatāna sūryo na yojanam /
analyzed: tat vīryam vaḥ marutaḥ mahitvanam dīrgham tatāna sūryaḥ na yojanam
translated: That is your heroism, O Maruts, your greatness, it has stretched out far, like the sun's path.

original: etā na yāme agṛbhītaśociṣo 'naśvadāṃ yan ny ayātanā girim //
analyzed: etāḥ na yāme a gṛbhīta śociṣaḥ naśva dām yat ni ayātana girim
translated: These (rays) with unrestrained radiance, when you went to the mountain without horses,

original: abhrāji śardho maruto yad arṇasam moṣathā vṛkṣaṃ kapaneva vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: abhrāji śardhaḥ marutaḥ yat arṇasam moṣatha vṛkṣam kapanā iva vedhasaḥ
translated: The Marut host shines when it is stormy, you destroy the tree like clever ones in a contest.

original: adha smā no aramatiṃ sajoṣasaś cakṣur iva yantam anu neṣathā sugam //
analyzed: adha smā naḥ aramatim sajoṣasaḥ cakṣuḥ iva yantam anu neṣathāḥ sugam
translated: Then, O Maruts, of one mind with us, lead us to a good path, as if it were the moving eye.

original: na sa jīyate maruto na hanyate na sredhati na vyathate na riṣyati /
analyzed: na sa jīyate marutaḥ na hanyate na sredhati na vyathate na riṣyati
translated: He is not conquered, O Maruts, he is not killed, he does not languish, he does not suffer, he does not perish,

original: nāsya rāya upa dasyanti notaya ṛṣiṃ vā yaṃ rājānaṃ vā suṣūdatha //
analyzed: na asya rāyaḥ upa dasyanti na ūtayaḥ ṛṣim vā yam rājānam vā suṣūdatha
translated: His wealth does not fail, nor his means, whom you have purified, whether he be a sage or a king.

original: niyutvanto grāmajito yathā naro 'ryamaṇo na marutaḥ kabandhinaḥ /
analyzed: niyutvantaḥ grāma jitaḥ yathā naraḥ ryamaṇaḥ na marutaḥ kabandhinaḥ
translated: Like men who conquer villages, the Maruts, the Kabandhin brothers, the Aryaman brothers,

original: pinvanty utsaṃ yad ināso asvaran vy undanti pṛthivīm madhvo andhasā //
analyzed: pinvanti utsam yat ināsaḥ asvaran vi undanti pṛthivīm madhvaḥ andhasā
translated: When the Innas have roared, they swell the spring, they spread the earth with the sweet juice.

original: pravatvatīyam pṛthivī marudbhyaḥ pravatvatī dyaur bhavati prayadbhyaḥ /
analyzed: pravatvatī iyam pṛthivī marudbhyaḥ pravatvatī dyauḥ bhavati prayadbhyaḥ
translated: The earth is full of strength for the Maruts, the full-strength heaven is for the striving ones.

original: pravatvatīḥ pathyā antarikṣyāḥ pravatvantaḥ parvatā jīradānavaḥ //
analyzed: pravatvatīḥ pathyāḥ antarikṣyāḥ pravatvantaḥ parvatāḥ jīra dānavaḥ
translated: The paths in the atmosphere are full of strength, the mountains are full of strength, the swift-moving ones.

original: yan marutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇaraḥ sūrya udite madathā divo naraḥ /
analyzed: yat marutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇaraḥ sūrye udite madatha divaḥ naraḥ
translated: When, O Maruts, you, the golden-hued ones, rejoice at sunrise, O men of heaven,

original: na vo 'śvāḥ śrathayantāha sisrataḥ sadyo asyādhvanaḥ pāram aśnutha //
analyzed: na vaḥ śvās śrathayantā aha sisrataḥ sadyas asya adhvanaḥ pāram aśnutha
translated: Your horses do not break, as you rush forth, you quickly reach the end of this path.

original: aṃseṣu va ṛṣṭayaḥ patsu khādayo vakṣassu rukmā maruto rathe śubhaḥ /
analyzed: aṃseṣu vaḥ ṛṣṭayaḥ patsu kha ādayaḥ vakṣassu rukmāḥ marutaḥ rathe śubhaḥ
translated: The spears are on your shoulders, the knives on your hands, the ornaments on your chests, O Maruts, on the chariot.

original: agnibhrājaso vidyuto gabhastyoḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣasu vitatā hiraṇyayīḥ //
analyzed: agni bhrājasaḥ vidyutaḥ gabhastyoḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣasu vitatāḥ hiraṇyayīḥ
translated: The lightning flashes from your arms, the golden crests spread out on your heads.

original: taṃ nākam aryo agṛbhītaśociṣaṃ ruśat pippalam maruto vi dhūnutha /
analyzed: tam nākam aryaḥ a gṛbhīta śociṣam ruśat pippalam marutaḥ vi dhūnutha
translated: You, O Maruts, shake the heaven, the one with the unheld radiance, the red pipal tree.

original: sam acyanta vṛjanātitviṣanta yat svaranti ghoṣaṃ vitatam ṛtāyavaḥ //
analyzed: sam acyanta vṛjanā atitviṣanta yat svaranti ghoṣam vitatam ṛtāyavaḥ
translated: The songs are extended, they shine beyond the songs, when they sing out the extended sound for the righteous ones.

original: yuṣmādattasya maruto vicetaso rāyaḥ syāma rathyo vayasvataḥ /
analyzed: yuṣmādattasya marutaḥ vicetasaḥ rāyaḥ syāma rathyaḥ vayasvataḥ
translated: O Maruts, with your minds, we wish for the wealth given by you, the wealth of a chariot, the self-existent one.

original: na yo yucchati tiṣyo yathā divo 'sme rāranta marutaḥ sahasriṇam //
analyzed: na yaḥ yucchati tiṣyaḥ yathā divaḥ sme rāranta marutaḥ sahasriṇam
translated: Who does not bend like Tishya of the sky, O Maruts, grant us a thousandfold wealth.

original: yūyaṃ rayim maruta spārhavīraṃ yūyam ṛṣim avatha sāmavipram /
analyzed: yūyam rayim marutaḥ spārha vīram yūyam ṛṣim avatha sāma vipram
translated: You, O Maruts, bestow wealth with heroic sons, you support the sage who is skilled in the Sāman chants.

original: yūyam arvantam bharatāya vājaṃ yūyaṃ dhattha rājānaṃ śruṣṭimantam //
analyzed: yūyam arvantam bharatāya vājam yūyam dhattha rājānam śruṣṭimantam
translated: You give the steed to Bharata for strength, you establish the king who is to be obeyed.

original: tad vo yāmi draviṇaṃ sadyaūtayo yenā svar ṇa tatanāma nṝṃr abhi /
analyzed: tat vaḥ yāmi draviṇam sadyaūtayaḥ yena svar na tatanāma nṝn abhi
translated: That wealth of yours, O swift helpers, by which ye have attained the light and overcome the men, I seek from you.

original: idaṃ su me maruto haryatā vaco yasya tarema tarasā śataṃ himāḥ //
analyzed: idam su me marutaḥ haryata vacaḥ yasya tarema tarasā śatam himāḥ
translated: O Maruts, accept this my delightful speech, by which we may pass a hundred winters in safety.

original: prayajyavo maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayo bṛhad vayo dadhire rukmavakṣasaḥ /
analyzed: prayajyavaḥ marutaḥ bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ bṛhat vayaḥ dadhire rukma vakṣasaḥ
translated: The Maruts, who are to be worshipped, whose eyes shine brightly, who have a lofty voice, and whose breasts are adorned with ornaments,

original: īyante aśvaiḥ suyamebhir āśubhiḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata //
analyzed: īyante aśvaiḥ su yamebhiḥ āśubhiḥ śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: Move on with their well-controlled swift horses. The beautiful ones have turned their chariots to come.

original: svayaṃ dadhidhve taviṣīṃ yathā vida bṛhan mahānta urviyā vi rājatha /
analyzed: svayam dadhidhve taviṣīm yathā vida bṛhat mahāntaḥ urviyā vi rājatha
translated: Ye yourselves have obtained strength as ye know it. Ye are great and vast, ye shine with splendour.

original: utāntarikṣam mamire vy ojasā śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata //
analyzed: uta antarikṣam mamire vi ojasā śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: And with your might ye have measured the atmosphere. The beautiful ones have turned their chariots to come.

original: sākaṃ jātāḥ subhvaḥ sākam ukṣitāḥ śriye cid ā prataraṃ vāvṛdhur naraḥ /
analyzed: sākam jātāḥ su bhvaḥ sākam ukṣitāḥ śriye cit ā prataram vāvṛdhuḥ naraḥ
translated: Born together, mighty, sprinkled together, the men have grown in strength even for glory.

original: virokiṇaḥ sūryasyeva raśmayaḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata //
analyzed: virokiṇaḥ sūryasya iva raśmayaḥ śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: Like the rays of the sun, have gone to the auspicious. Follow the chariot!

original: ābhūṣeṇyaṃ vo maruto mahitvanaṃ didṛkṣeṇyaṃ sūryasyeva cakṣaṇam /
analyzed: ābhūṣeṇyam vaḥ marutaḥ mahitvanam didṛkṣeṇyam sūryasya iva cakṣaṇam
translated: O Maruts, your greatness is to be desired, your appearance is to be longed for, like the light of the sun.

original: uto asmāṃ amṛtatve dadhātana śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata //
analyzed: uta u asmām amṛta tve dadhātana śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: And you place us in immortality. Follow the chariot!

original: ud īrayathā marutaḥ samudrato yūyaṃ vṛṣṭiṃ varṣayathā purīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: ud īrayatha marutaḥ samudrataḥ yūyam vṛṣṭim varṣayatha purīṣiṇaḥ
translated: O Maruts, you send forth from the ocean, you rain down the rain, you who are full of strength.

original: na vo dasrā upa dasyanti dhenavaḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata //
analyzed: na vaḥ dasrāḥ upa dasyanti dhenavaḥ śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: Your wondrous cows will not be destroyed. Follow the chariot!

original: yad aśvān dhūrṣu pṛṣatīr ayugdhvaṃ hiraṇyayān praty atkāṃ amugdhvam /
analyzed: yat aśvān dhūrṣu pṛṣatīḥ ayugdhvam hiraṇyayān prati atkām amugdhvam
translated: When you yoke your spotted horses to the poles, and yoke your golden reins,

original: viśvā it spṛdho maruto vy asyatha śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata //
analyzed: viśvāḥ id spṛdhaḥ marutaḥ vi asyatha śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: O Maruts, you crush all enemies. Follow the chariot!

original: na parvatā na nadyo varanta vo yatrācidhvam maruto gacchathed u tat /
analyzed: na parvatāḥ na nadyaḥ varanta vaḥ yatra acidhvam marutaḥ gacchatha id u tat
translated: Neither mountains nor rivers obstruct you, O Maruts, wherever you go.

original: uta dyāvāpṛthivī yāthanā pari śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata //
analyzed: uta dyāvāpṛthivī yāthana pari śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: You go around the sky and earth. Follow the chariot!

original: yat pūrvyam maruto yac ca nūtanaṃ yad udyate vasavo yac ca śasyate /
analyzed: yat pūrvyam marutaḥ yat ca nūtanam yat udyate vasavaḥ yat ca śasyate
translated: Whatever is ancient, O Maruts, and whatever is new, O Vasus, whatever is raised up and whatever is praised,

original: viśvasya tasya bhavathā navedasaḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata //
analyzed: viśvasya tasya bhavatha navedasaḥ śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata
translated: Be ye the finders of that treasure for us: let the bright chariots turn hither unto us.

original: mṛḷata no maruto mā vadhiṣṭanāsmabhyaṃ śarma bahulaṃ vi yantana /
analyzed: mṛḍata naḥ marutaḥ mā vadhiṣṭana asmabhyam śarma bahulam vi yantana
translated: Be gracious unto us, O Maruts: strike us not down. Spread ye abroad for us abundant protection.

original: adhi stotrasya sakhyasya gātana śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata //🔽yūyam asmān nayata vasyo acchā nir aṃhatibhyo maruto gṛṇānāḥ /
analyzed: adhi stotrasya sakhyasya gātana śubham yātām anu rathāḥ avṛtsata  yūyam asmān nayata vasyaḥ acchā niḥ aṃhatibhyaḥ marutaḥ gṛṇānāḥ
translated: Sing ye a song for the praise and friendship of the Stotra. Let the bright chariots turn hither unto us.🔽Ye, O Maruts, singing, lead us to better things, from the afflictions.

original: juṣadhvaṃ no havyadātiṃ yajatrā vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām //
analyzed: juṣadhvam naḥ havya dātim yajatrāḥ vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: Accept, O ye adorable ones, our oblation. May we be lords of wealth.

original: agne śardhantam ā gaṇam piṣṭaṃ rukmebhir añjibhiḥ /
analyzed: agne śardhantam ā gaṇam piṣṭam rukmebhiḥ añjibhiḥ
translated: O Agni, the Maruts' troop that rushes on, anointed with bright rays,

original: viśo adya marutām ava hvaye divaś cid rocanād adhi //
analyzed: viśaḥ adya marutām ava hvaye divaḥ cit rocanāt adhi
translated: I call today to the people of the Maruts, even from the light of the sky.

original: yathā cin manyase hṛdā tad in me jagmur āśasaḥ /
analyzed: yathā cit manyase hṛdā tat id me jagmuḥ āśasaḥ
translated: Even as thou thinkest in thy heart, so have they come to my expectation.

original: ye te nediṣṭhaṃ havanāny āgaman tān vardha bhīmasaṃdṛśaḥ //
analyzed: ye te nediṣṭham havanāni āgaman tān vardha bhīma saṃdṛśaḥ
translated: Those who have come to your nearest invocations, them, O ye terrible to behold, increase.

original: mīḷhuṣmatīva pṛthivī parāhatā madanty ety asmad ā /
analyzed: mīḷhuṣmatī iva pṛthivī parāhatā madantī eti asmat ā
translated: The earth, as it were, trembling, struck, rejoices, coming to us.

original: ṛkṣo na vo marutaḥ śimīvāṃ amo dudhro gaur iva bhīmayuḥ //
analyzed: ṛkṣaḥ na vaḥ marutaḥ śimīvān amaḥ dudhraḥ gauḥ iva bhīmayuḥ
translated: Like a bear, O Maruts, is your strength, O ye terrible ones, like a wild bull, a fierce bull.

original: ni ye riṇanty ojasā vṛthā gāvo na durdhuraḥ /
analyzed: ni ye riṇanti ojasā vṛthā gāvaḥ na durdhuraḥ
translated: Those who with might break through, like cows through a weak rope,

original: aśmānaṃ cit svaryam parvataṃ girim pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ //🔽ut tiṣṭha nūnam eṣāṃ stomaiḥ samukṣitānām /
analyzed: aśmānam cit svaryam parvatam girim pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ  ud tiṣṭha nūnam eṣām stomaiḥ samukṣitānām
translated: They cause even the heavenly mountain, the rock, the hill, to tremble with their paths.🔽Rise up now, O Maruts, the most ancient and most excellent,

original: marutām purutamam apūrvyaṃ gavāṃ sargam iva hvaye //🔽yuṅgdhvaṃ hy aruṣī rathe yuṅgdhvaṃ ratheṣu rohitaḥ /
analyzed: marutām purutamam apūrvyam gavām sargam iva hvaye  yuṅgdhvam hi aruṣī rathe yuṅgdhvam ratheṣu rohitaḥ
translated: I invoke the most abundant outpouring of milk, as it were, of these who are anointed with praises.🔽Yoke ye the ruddy mares to the chariot, yoke the red ones to the chariots,

original: yuṅgdhvaṃ harī ajirā dhuri voḷhave vahiṣṭhā dhuri voḷhave //
analyzed: yuṅgdhvam harī ajirā dhuri voḷhave vahiṣṭhā dhuri voḷhave
translated: Yoke the two swift tawny horses to the pole, most excellent to draw, to the pole to draw.

original: uta sya vājy aruṣas tuviṣvaṇir iha sma dhāyi darśataḥ /
analyzed: uta sya vājī aruṣaḥ tuviṣvaṇiḥ iha sma dhāyi darśataḥ
translated: And may that strong red steed, wondrous, be here established, the beautiful one.

original: mā vo yāmeṣu marutaś ciraṃ karat pra taṃ ratheṣu codata //
analyzed: mā vaḥ yāmeṣu marutaḥ ciram karat pra tam ratheṣu codata
translated: Do not delay long, O Maruts, in your journeys, urge him forward in the chariots.

original: rathaṃ nu mārutaṃ vayaṃ śravasyum ā huvāmahe /
analyzed: ratham nu mārutam vayam śravasyum ā huvāmahe
translated: We invoke the Marut chariot, which is desirous of glory,

original: ā yasmin tasthau suraṇāni bibhratī sacā marutsu rodasī //
analyzed: ā yasmin tasthau suraṇāni bibhratī sacā marutsu rodasī
translated: In which the two worlds, bearing the beautiful ornaments, stand together with the Maruts.

original: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ ratheśubhaṃ tveṣam panasyum ā huve /
analyzed: tam vaḥ śardham ratheśubham tveṣam panasyum ā huve
translated: I invoke that your host, which is splendid on the chariots, which is brilliant, which is eager,

original: yasmin sujātā subhagā mahīyate sacā marutsu mīḷhuṣī //
analyzed: yasmin sujātā subhagā mahīyate sacā marutsu mīḍhuṣī
translated: In which the well-born, the fortunate, the great one is exalted, which is bountiful together with the Maruts.

original: ā rudrāsa indravantaḥ sajoṣaso hiraṇyarathāḥ suvitāya gantana /
analyzed: ā rudrāsaḥ indravantaḥ sajoṣasaḥ hiraṇya rathāḥ suvitāya gantana
translated: O Rudras, united with Indra, of one mind, come on golden chariots for our prosperity.

original: iyaṃ vo asmat prati haryate matis tṛṣṇaje na diva utsā udanyave //
analyzed: iyam vaḥ asmat prati haryate matiḥ tṛṣṇaje na divaḥ utsāḥ udanyave
translated: This our prayer is sent forth to you, to be accepted, as to Tṛṣaṇag, to Divodāsa, to Udanīya.

original: vāśīmanta ṛṣṭimanto manīṣiṇaḥ sudhanvāna iṣumanto niṣaṅgiṇaḥ /
analyzed: vāśīmantaḥ ṛṣṭimantaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ su dhanvānaḥ iṣumantaḥ niṣaṅgiṇaḥ
translated: Possessed of swords, possessed of spears, wise, with good bows, with arrows, with quivers,

original: svaśvā stha surathāḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ svāyudhā maruto yāthanā śubham //🔽dhūnutha dyām parvatān dāśuṣe vasu ni vo vanā jihate yāmano bhiyā /
analyzed: su aśvāḥ stha su rathāḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ su āyudhāḥ marutaḥ yāthana śubham  dhūnutha dyām parvatān dāśuṣe vasu ni vaḥ vanā jihate yāmanaḥ bhiyā
translated: Ye have good horses, good chariots, O ye of dappled mothers; your weapons are your own, O Maruts; ye go to the fair place.🔽Ye shake the sky, the mountains, for the worshipper's wealth; your woods are shaken with the fear of your approach.

original: kopayatha pṛthivīm pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhe yad ugrāḥ pṛṣatīr ayugdhvam //
analyzed: kopayatha pṛthivīm pṛśni mātaraḥ śubhe yat ugrāḥ pṛṣatīḥ ayugdhvam
translated: Ye make the earth tremble, O ye of dappled mothers, when, O ye terrible ones, ye yoke your spotted deer.

original: vātatviṣo maruto varṣanirṇijo yamā iva susadṛśaḥ supeśasaḥ /
analyzed: vāta tviṣaḥ marutaḥ varṣa nirṇijaḥ yamāḥ iva su sadṛśaḥ supeśasaḥ
translated: Ye Maruts, whose lustre is like the wind, whose garments are rain, like the Yamas, very beautiful, of fair forms,

original: piśaṅgāśvā aruṇāśvā arepasaḥ pratvakṣaso mahinā dyaur ivoravaḥ //
analyzed: piśaṅga aśvāḥ aruṇa aśvāḥ arepasaḥ pratvakṣasaḥ mahinā dyauḥ iva uravaḥ
translated: With yellow horses, with red horses, unsoiled, of great strength, in majesty like the heaven, like the mountains.

original: purudrapsā añjimantaḥ sudānavas tveṣasaṃdṛśo anavabhrarādhasaḥ /
analyzed: puru drapsāḥ añjimantaḥ sudānavaḥ tveṣa saṃdṛśaḥ anavabhra rādhasaḥ
translated: Of many showers, anointed, bountiful, of terrible appearance, of unfailing help,

original: sujātāso januṣā rukmavakṣaso divo arkā amṛtaṃ nāma bhejire //
analyzed: su jātāsaḥ januṣā rukma vakṣasaḥ divaḥ arkāḥ amṛtam nāma bhejire
translated: Well-born, by birth, with golden breasts, the lights of heaven have received the name of immortal.

original: ṛṣṭayo vo maruto aṃsayor adhi saha ojo bāhvor vo balaṃ hitam /
analyzed: ṛṣṭayaḥ vaḥ marutaḥ aṃsayoḥ adhi sahaḥ ojaḥ bāhvoḥ vaḥ balam hitam
translated: Your spears, O Maruts, are on your shoulders; your strength is laid in your arms, your power in your sides.

original: nṛmṇā śīrṣasv āyudhā ratheṣu vo viśvā vaḥ śrīr adhi tanūṣu pipiśe //
analyzed: nṛmṇā śīrṣasu āyudhā ratheṣu vaḥ viśvā vaḥ śrīḥ adhi tanūṣu pipiśe
translated: In men's heads are your weapons, in your chariots; all glory rests upon your bodies.

original: gomad aśvāvad rathavat suvīraṃ candravad rādho maruto dadā naḥ /
analyzed: gomat aśvāvat rathavat su vīram candravat rādhaḥ marutaḥ dada naḥ
translated: O Maruts, grant us wealth in horses and cows, in chariots and brave men, in splendour.

original: praśastiṃ naḥ kṛṇuta rudriyāso bhakṣīya vo 'vaso daivyasya //🔽haye naro maruto mṛḷatā nas tuvīmaghāso amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ /
analyzed: praśastim naḥ kṛṇuta rudriyāsaḥ bhakṣīya vaḥ vaso daivyasya  haye naraḥ marutaḥ mṛḍata naḥ tuvīmaghāsaḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: Grant us praise, O ye sons of Rudra; may I enjoy your divine favour.🔽O ye men, O Maruts, be gracious to us, O ye of great bounty, immortal, knowing the truth.

original: satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yuvāno bṛhadgirayo bṛhad ukṣamāṇāḥ //
analyzed: satya śrutaḥ kavayaḥ yuvānaḥ bṛhat girayaḥ bṛhat ukṣamāṇāḥ
translated: Ye whose fame is true, ye wise, young, with lofty mountains, pouring forth abundantly.

original: tam u nūnaṃ taviṣīmantam eṣāṃ stuṣe gaṇam mārutaṃ navyasīnām /
analyzed: tam u nūnam taviṣīmantam eṣām stuṣe gaṇam mārutam navyasīnām
translated: I praise that powerful host of them, the Maruts, of the newest (songs),

original: ya āśvaśvā amavad vahanta uteśire amṛtasya svarājaḥ //
analyzed: ye āśu aśvāḥ amavat vahante uta īśire amṛtasya svarājaḥ
translated: Who carry on swift horses, who have become the immortal, independent (possessors) of their own.

original: tveṣaṃ gaṇaṃ tavasaṃ khādihastaṃ dhunivratam māyinaṃ dātivāram /
analyzed: tveṣam gaṇam tavasam khādi hastam dhuni vratam māyinam dāti vāram
translated: The impetuous host, the mighty one, whose hands grasp food, whose vows are firm, the magician, the bountiful one,

original: mayobhuvo ye amitā mahitvā vandasva vipra tuvirādhaso nṝn //
analyzed: mayobhuvaḥ ye amitāḥ mahitvā vandasva vipra tuvi rādhasaḥ nṝn
translated: The delightful ones, whose greatness is immeasurable, O sage, praise those men of great power.

original: ā vo yantūdavāhāso adya vṛṣṭiṃ ye viśve maruto junanti /
analyzed: ā vaḥ yantu uda vāhāsaḥ adya vṛṣṭim ye viśve marutaḥ junanti
translated: Let your messengers come to you today, O Maruts, all of you who send down rain.

original: ayaṃ yo agnir marutaḥ samiddha etaṃ juṣadhvaṃ kavayo yuvānaḥ //
analyzed: ayam yaḥ agniḥ marutaḥ samiddhaḥ etam juṣadhvam kavayaḥ yuvānaḥ
translated: O Maruts, accept this Agni who is kindled, O wise young men.

original: yūyaṃ rājānam iryaṃ janāya vibhvataṣṭaṃ janayathā yajatrāḥ /
analyzed: yūyam rājānam iryam janāya vibhva taṣṭam janayatha yajatrāḥ
translated: You, O ye Holy Ones, have generated the King who is all-shaping for the people.

original: yuṣmad eti muṣṭihā bāhujūto yuṣmat sadaśvo marutaḥ suvīraḥ //
analyzed: yuṣmat eti muṣṭi hā bāhu jūtaḥ yuṣmat sat aśvaḥ marutaḥ su vīraḥ
translated: From you comes forth the strong-armed, the mighty, from you, O Maruts, the good hero with good horses.

original: arā ived acaramā aheva prapra jāyante akavā mahobhiḥ /
analyzed: arāḥ iva id a caramāḥ aha iva pra pra jāyante akavāḥ mahobhiḥ
translated: They are born like wheels that never stop, like snakes, in multitudes, not in order, with great (powers).

original: pṛśneḥ putrā upamāso rabhiṣṭhāḥ svayā matyā marutaḥ sam mimikṣuḥ //
analyzed: pṛśneḥ putrāḥ upamāsaḥ rabhiṣṭhāḥ svayā matyā marutaḥ sam mimikṣuḥ
translated: The sons of Prsni, the most impetuous, the most like him, the Maruts, have been mingled together by their own thought.

original: yat prāyāsiṣṭa pṛṣatībhir aśvair vīḷupavibhir maruto rathebhiḥ /
analyzed: yat prāyāsiṣṭa pṛṣatībhiḥ aśvaiḥ vīḍu pavibhiḥ marutaḥ rathebhiḥ
translated: When ye went forth with spotted deer, with horses, O Maruts, with your teams of goats, with your chariots,

original: kṣodanta āpo riṇate vanāny avosriyo vṛṣabhaḥ krandatu dyauḥ //
analyzed: kṣodante āpaḥ riṇate vanāni ava usriyaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ krandatu dyauḥ
translated: The waters were agitated, the woods were broken down, let the cloud, the bull, roar, the friend of the waters.

original: prathiṣṭa yāman pṛthivī cid eṣām bharteva garbhaṃ svam ic chavo dhuḥ /
analyzed: prathiṣṭa yāman pṛthivī cit eṣām bhartā iva garbham svam id śavaḥ dhuḥ
translated: This earth itself was extended in their course, as if bearing her own embryo, she was filled with strength.

original: vātān hy aśvān dhury āyuyujre varṣaṃ svedaṃ cakrire rudriyāsaḥ //🔽haye naro maruto mṛḷatā nas tuvīmaghāso amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ /🔽satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yuvāno bṛhadgirayo bṛhad ukṣamāṇāḥ //
analyzed: vātān hi aśvān dhuri āyuyujre varṣam svedam cakrire rudriyāsaḥ  haye naraḥ marutaḥ mṛḍata naḥ tuvīmaghāsaḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ  satya śrutaḥ kavayaḥ yuvānaḥ bṛhat girayaḥ bṛhat ukṣamāṇāḥ
translated: They yoked the winds, the horses, to the chariot, the Rudras made the rain and sweat.🔽O ye men, O Maruts, be gracious to us, O ye of great bounty, immortal, knowing the truth.🔽Ye whose fame is true, ye wise, young, of great voice, ye of great strength, pouring forth (your gifts).

original: pra va spaḷ akran suvitāya dāvane 'rcā dive pra pṛthivyā ṛtam bhare /
analyzed: pra vaḥ spaḷ akran suvitāya dāvane rcā dive pra pṛthivyai ṛtam bhare
translated: They have gone forth to give us prosperity. I bring praise to heaven and earth. I uphold the truth.

original: ukṣante aśvān taruṣanta ā rajo 'nu svam bhānuṃ śrathayante arṇavaiḥ //
analyzed: ukṣante aśvān ā rajaḥ nu svam bhānum śrathayante arṇavaiḥ
translated: They sprinkle the horses, they stretch the chariot along the path, they bind their own light with the waves.

original: amād eṣām bhiyasā bhūmir ejati naur na pūrṇā kṣarati vyathir yatī /
analyzed: amāt eṣām bhiyasā bhūmiḥ ejati nauḥ na pūrṇā kṣarati vyathiḥ yatī
translated: From their fear the earth trembles, like a full ship leaks while crossing the ocean.

original: dūredṛśo ye citayanta emabhir antar mahe vidathe yetire naraḥ //🔽gavām iva śriyase śṛṅgam uttamaṃ sūryo na cakṣū rajaso visarjane /
analyzed: dūredṛśaḥ ye citayante emabhiḥ antar mahe vidathe yetire naraḥ  gavām iva śriyase śṛṅgam uttamam sūryaḥ na cakṣuḥ rajasaḥ visarjane
translated: Those who are far-sighted, who think with their minds, the men who move in the great assembly within.🔽Like the highest peak for the glory of the mountains, like the sun for the eyes in the expanse of the sky,

original: atyā iva subhvaś cārava sthana maryā iva śriyase cetathā naraḥ //
analyzed: atyāḥ iva su bhvaḥ cāravaḥ sthana maryāḥ iva śriyase cetathā naraḥ
translated: Like swift horses you stand in the sky, like boundaries you think for the glory of the men.

original: ko vo mahānti mahatām ud aśnavat kas kāvyā marutaḥ ko ha pauṃsyā /
analyzed: kaḥ vaḥ mahānti mahatām ud aśnavat kaḥ kāvyā marutaḥ kaḥ ha pauṃsyā
translated: Who among you finds the great deeds of the great? Who finds the wise thoughts, O Maruts, and who the manly deeds?

original: yūyaṃ ha bhūmiṃ kiraṇaṃ na rejatha pra yad bharadhve suvitāya dāvane //🔽aśvā ived aruṣāsaḥ sabandhavaḥ śūrā iva prayudhaḥ prota yuyudhuḥ /
analyzed: yūyam ha bhūmim kiraṇam na rejatha pra yat bharadhve suvitāya dāvane  aśvāḥ iva id aruṣāsaḥ sabandhavaḥ śūrāḥ iva prayudhaḥ pra uta yuyudhuḥ
translated: You shake the earth like a reed, when you carry it forward to give prosperity.🔽Like red horses of the same bond, like heroes with weapons, they fought the battle.

original: maryā iva suvṛdho vāvṛdhur naraḥ sūryasya cakṣuḥ pra minanti vṛṣṭibhiḥ //
analyzed: maryāḥ iva suvṛdhaḥ vāvṛdhuḥ naraḥ sūryasya cakṣuḥ pra minanti vṛṣṭibhiḥ
translated: Like boundaries, the men have grown in good strength, they measure the sun's eye with their showers.

original: te ajyeṣṭhā akaniṣṭhāsa udbhido 'madhyamāso mahasā vi vāvṛdhuḥ /
analyzed: te a jyeṣṭhāḥ a kaniṣṭhāsaḥ udbhidaḥ madhyamāsaḥ mahasā vi vāvṛdhuḥ
translated: They, the eldest, the youngest, the middle ones, the bursting ones, have grown in greatness, each in its own place.
