original: sujātāso januṣā pṛśnimātaro divo maryā ā no acchā jigātana //🔽vayo na ye śreṇīḥ paptur ojasāntān divo bṛhataḥ sānunas pari /
analyzed: su jātāsaḥ januṣā pṛśni mātaraḥ divaḥ maryāḥ ā naḥ acchā jigātana  vayaḥ na ye śreṇīḥ paptuḥ ojasā antān divaḥ bṛhataḥ sānunaḥ pari
translated: Well-born, with various mothers by their nature, the boundaries of heaven, come hither to us.🔽They who have flown like birds in rows by their strength from the far-reaching heights of the lofty heaven,

original: aśvāsa eṣām ubhaye yathā viduḥ pra parvatasya nabhanūṃr acucyavuḥ //
analyzed: aśvāsaḥ eṣām ubhaye yathā viduḥ pra parvatasya nabhanūn acucyavuḥ
translated: The horses of these all know as they belong; they have shaken the summits of the mountain.

original: mimātu dyaur aditir vītaye naḥ saṃ dānucitrā uṣaso yatantām /
analyzed: mimātu dyauḥ aditiḥ vītaye naḥ sam dānu citrāḥ uṣasaḥ yatantām
translated: May Dyaus and Aditi be measured for our worship; may the dawns, adorned with rain, strive (to help us).

original: ācucyavur divyaṃ kośam eta ṛṣe rudrasya maruto gṛṇānāḥ //
analyzed: ācucyavuḥ divyam kośam ete ṛṣe rudrasya marutaḥ gṛṇānāḥ
translated: The R̥ishis, the Maruts, singing Rudra's praises, have shaken this the heavenly vessel hither.

original: īḷe agniṃ svavasaṃ namobhir iha prasatto vi cayat kṛtaṃ naḥ /
analyzed: īḍe agnim su avasam namobhiḥ iha prasattaḥ vi cayat kṛtam naḥ
translated: With reverence I implore Agni, the Self-existent One: here be gracious and remove our sin.

original: rathair iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇin marutāṃ stomam ṛdhyām //
analyzed: rathaiḥ iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇit marutām stomam ṛdhyām
translated: As with chariots I will bear the Maruts who give strength: I will accomplish the praise of the Maruts who go round.

original: ā ye tasthuḥ pṛṣatīṣu śrutāsu sukheṣu rudrā maruto ratheṣu /🔽vanā cid ugrā jihate ni vo bhiyā pṛthivī cid rejate parvataś cit //
analyzed: ā ye tasthuḥ pṛṣatīṣu śrutāsu sukheṣu rudrāḥ marutaḥ ratheṣu  vanā cit ugrā jihate ni vaḥ bhiyā pṛthivī cit rejate parvataḥ cit
translated: Those who have stood on the well-known spotted (cows), the pleasant, the Rudras, the Maruts, on the chariots,🔽Even the woods tremble through your fear, the mighty; even the earth quakes, even the mountain.

original: parvataś cin mahi vṛddho bibhāya divaś cit sānu rejata svane vaḥ /
analyzed: parvataḥ cit mahi vṛddhaḥ bibhāya divaḥ cit sānu rejata svane vaḥ
translated: Even the great mountain, grown mighty, is afraid; even the ridge of heaven quakes at your roar,

original: yat krīḷatha maruta ṛṣṭimanta āpa iva sadhryañco dhavadhve //
analyzed: yat krīḍatha marutaḥ ṛṣṭimantaḥ āpaḥ iva sadhryañcaḥ dhavadhve
translated: When, O Maruts, ye sport with your pointed (weapons), ye rush together like the waters.

original: varā ived raivatāso hiraṇyair abhi svadhābhis tanvaḥ pipiśre /
analyzed: varāḥ iva id raivatāsaḥ hiraṇyaiḥ abhi svadhābhiḥ tanvaḥ pipiśre
translated: Like boons, the sons of Raivata, with gold, with their own powers, have anointed their bodies.

original: śriye śreyāṃsas tavaso ratheṣu satrā mahāṃsi cakrire tanūṣu //
analyzed: śriye śreyāṃsaḥ tavasaḥ ratheṣu satrā mahāṃsi cakrire tanūṣu
translated: For glory, the most excellent ones, with their powers, have always made great things on their chariots.

original: ajyeṣṭhāso akaniṣṭhāsa ete sam bhrātaro vāvṛdhuḥ saubhagāya /
analyzed: a jyeṣṭhāsaḥ a kaniṣṭhāsaḥ ete sam bhrātaraḥ vāvṛdhuḥ saubhagāya
translated: These brothers, without an eldest, without a youngest, have grown together for good fortune.

original: yuvā pitā svapā rudra eṣāṃ sudughā pṛśniḥ sudinā marudbhyaḥ //
analyzed: yuvā pitā su apāḥ rudraḥ eṣām su dughā pṛśniḥ su dinā marudbhyaḥ
translated: The young father, the self-cooking one, the Rudra of these, the milch cow, the dappled one, the good day, for the Maruts.

original: yad uttame maruto madhyame vā yad vāvame subhagāso divi ṣṭha /
analyzed: yat uttame marutaḥ madhyame vā yat vā avame subhagāsaḥ divi ṣṭha
translated: If, O Maruts, you are in the highest, in the middle, or in the lowest, O fortunate ones, dwelling in the sky,

original: ato no rudrā uta vā nv asyāgne vittād dhaviṣo yad yajāma //
analyzed: atas naḥ rudrāḥ uta vā nu asya agne vittāt haviṣaḥ yat yajāma
translated: From there, O Rudras, or from this, O Agni, know the oblation that we offer.

original: agniś ca yan maruto viśvavedaso divo vahadhva uttarād adhi ṣṇubhiḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ ca yat marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ divaḥ vahadhve uttarāt adhi snubhiḥ
translated: O Agni, and you, O Maruts, all-knowing, bring from the highest heaven with your swift ones.

original: te mandasānā dhunayo riśādaso vāmaṃ dhatta yajamānāya sunvate //
analyzed: te mandasānāḥ dhunayaḥ riśādasaḥ vāmam dhatta yajamānāya sunvate
translated: You, rejoicing, shaking, destroyers of enemies, bestow good things on the sacrificer who presses (Soma).

original: agne marudbhiḥ śubhayadbhir ṛkvabhiḥ somam piba mandasāno gaṇaśribhiḥ /
analyzed: agne marudbhiḥ śubhayadbhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ somam piba mandasānaḥ gaṇa śribhiḥ
translated: O Agni, with the Maruts, the brilliant ones, the singers, drink Soma, rejoicing, with the ones who have a host for their glory.

original: pāvakebhir viśvaminvebhir āyubhir vaiśvānara pradivā ketunā sajūḥ //
analyzed: pāvakebhiḥ viśvaminvebhiḥ āyubhiḥ vaiśvānara pradivā ketunā sajūs
translated: With the purifying ones, the all-pervading ones, the life-giving ones, O Vaisvânara, with the banner, the companion, by day.

original: ke ṣṭhā naraḥ śreṣṭhatamā ya ekaeka āyaya /
analyzed: ke stha naraḥ śreṣṭhatamāḥ ye eka ekaḥ āyaya
translated: Who are those men, the best of the best, who have come one by one?

original: paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ //
analyzed: paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ
translated: From the highest distance.

original: kva vo 'śvāḥ kvābhīśavaḥ kathaṃ śeka kathā yaya /
analyzed: kva vaḥ śvās kva abhīśavaḥ katham śeka kathā yaya
translated: Where are your horses, where your reins? How could you go, how could you travel?

original: pṛṣṭhe sado nasor yamaḥ //🔽jaghane coda eṣāṃ vi sakthāni naro yamuḥ /🔽putrakṛthe na janayaḥ //
analyzed: pṛṣṭhe sadaḥ nasoḥ yamaḥ  jaghane codaḥ eṣām vi sakthāni naraḥ yamuḥ  putrakṛthe na janayaḥ
translated: The seat is on the back, Yama is in the nostrils.🔽The men have stretched out their legs, the heroes have extended their thighs.🔽In the place of the son's birth, O mothers.

original: parā vīrāsa etana maryāso bhadrajānayaḥ /
analyzed: parā vīrāsaḥ etana maryāsaḥ bhadra jānayaḥ
translated: Go away, O heroes, O men, O sons of good birth.

original: agnitapo yathāsatha //🔽sanat sāśvyam paśum uta gavyaṃ śatāvayam /
analyzed: agnitapaḥ yathā asatha  sanat sā aśvyam paśum uta gavyam śatāvayam
translated: As you sit in the heat of Agni.🔽You have given a hundredfold the horse-accompanied animal, the one accompanied by cattle,

original: śyāvāśvastutāya yā dor vīrāyopabarbṛhat //
analyzed: śyāvāśva stutāya yā doḥ vīrāya upabarbṛhat
translated: Which you have extended to the one praised by Śyāvāśva, to the hero.

original: uta tvā strī śaśīyasī puṃso bhavati vasyasī /
analyzed: uta tvā strī śaśīyasī puṃsaḥ bhavati vasyasī
translated: And a woman may be better, more prosperous, than a man,

original: adevatrād arādhasaḥ //
analyzed: adevatrāt arādhasaḥ
translated: If she is not devoted to the gods, if she is not generous.

original: vi yā jānāti jasuriṃ vi tṛṣyantaṃ vi kāminam /
analyzed: vi yā jānāti jasurim vi tṛṣyantam vi kāminam
translated: She knows well the one who is angry, the one who is thirsty, the one who is passionate.

original: devatrā kṛṇute manaḥ //
analyzed: devatrā kṛṇute manaḥ
translated: She turns the mind towards the gods.

original: uta ghā nemo astutaḥ pumāṃ iti bruve paṇiḥ /
analyzed: uta ghā nemaḥ a stutaḥ pumān iti bruve paṇiḥ
translated: And I say this to the slow one, the man who is not praised, the miser:

original: sa vairadeya it samaḥ //
analyzed: sa vaira deye id samaḥ
translated: He is like one who gives gifts to enemies.

original: uta me 'rapad yuvatir mamanduṣī prati śyāvāya vartanim /
analyzed: uta me rapat yuvatiḥ mamanduṣī prati śyāvāya vartanim
translated: And the young woman who is dear to me, who rejoices, has turned away from the dark one,

original: vi rohitā purumīḷhāya yematur viprāya dīrghayaśase //
analyzed: vi rohitā purumīḷhāya yematuḥ viprāya dīrgha yaśase
translated: The two red ones have been extended for the sage of many thoughts, for the one with long fame.

original: yo me dhenūnāṃ śataṃ vaidadaśvir yathā dadat /
analyzed: yaḥ me dhenūnām śatam vaidadaśviḥ yathā dadat
translated: The one who will give me a hundred cows, just as Vedadāṣvi gave,

original: taranta iva maṃhanā //
analyzed: tarantaḥ iva maṃhanā
translated: Like those who cross over with their wealth.

original: ya īṃ vahanta āśubhiḥ pibanto madiram madhu /
analyzed: ye īm vahante āśubhiḥ pibantaḥ madiram madhu
translated: Those who bear him with swift steeds, drinking the intoxicating mead,

original: atra śravāṃsi dadhire //
analyzed: atra śravāṃsi dadhire
translated: Here they have gained renown.

original: yeṣāṃ śriyādhi rodasī vibhrājante ratheṣv ā /
analyzed: yeṣām śriyā adhi rodasī vibhrājante ratheṣu ā
translated: Whose glory fills the two worlds, they shine on their chariots,

original: divi rukma ivopari //
analyzed: divi rukmaḥ iva upari
translated: Like a gem in the sky above.

original: yuvā sa māruto gaṇas tveṣaratho anedyaḥ /
analyzed: yuvā sa mārutaḥ gaṇaḥ tveṣa rathaḥ anedyaḥ
translated: That youthful host of Maruts, with their glittering chariot, irrepressible,

original: śubhaṃyāvāpratiṣkutaḥ //
analyzed: śubhaṃyāvā apratiṣkutaḥ
translated: Of auspicious course, irresistible.

original: ko veda nūnam eṣāṃ yatrā madanti dhūtayaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ veda nūnam eṣām yatrā madanti dhūtayaḥ
translated: Who knows for certain where they rejoice, those purified ones,

original: ṛtajātā arepasaḥ //
analyzed: ṛta jātāḥ arepasaḥ
translated: Born of truth, unblemished?

original: yūyam martaṃ vipanyavaḥ praṇetāra itthā dhiyā /
analyzed: yūyam martam vipanyavaḥ praṇetāraḥ itthā dhiyā
translated: You, O you who are to be worshipped, are the leaders of the mortal man here with this thought,

original: śrotāro yāmahūtiṣu //🔽te no vasūni kāmyā puruścandrā riśādasaḥ /
analyzed: śrotāraḥ yāma hūtiṣu  te naḥ vasūni kāmyā puru ścandrā riśādasaḥ
translated: The hearers at the calls for help.

original: ā yajñiyāso vavṛttana //
analyzed: ā yajñiyāsaḥ vavṛttana
translated: Those who are to be worshipped, O Vasus, of many lights, destroyers of enemies,🔽Have turned to me.

original: etam me stomam ūrmye dārbhyāya parā vaha /
analyzed: etam me stomam ūrmye dārbhyāya parā vaha
translated: O Ūrmyā, bring to Dārbhī this hymn of mine,

original: giro devi rathīr iva //
analyzed: giraḥ devi rathīḥ iva
translated: O goddess, like a charioteer.

original: uta me vocatād iti sutasome rathavītau /
analyzed: uta me vocatāt iti suta some rathavītau
translated: And may he speak to me, Sutasoma, at the chariot's resting place,

original: na kāmo apa veti me //
analyzed: na kāmaḥ apa veti me
translated: My desire does not depart.

original: eṣa kṣeti rathavītir maghavā gomatīr anu /
analyzed: eṣa kṣeti rathavītiḥ maghavā gomatīḥ anu
translated: This bountiful one rests at the chariot's resting place, along the paths of the cows,

original: parvateṣv apaśritaḥ //
analyzed: parvateṣu apaśritaḥ
translated: Hidden among the mountains.

original: ṛtena ṛtam apihitaṃ dhruvaṃ vāṃ sūryasya yatra vimucanty aśvān /
analyzed: ṛtena ṛtam apihitam dhruvam vām sūryasya yatra vimucanti aśvān
translated: The truth is hidden by the truth, your firm (vow), where they unyoke the horses of the sun,

original: daśa śatā saha tasthus tad ekaṃ devānāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ vapuṣām apaśyam //
analyzed: daśa śatā saha tasthuḥ tat ekam devānām śreṣṭham vapuṣām apaśyam
translated: Ten hundred stood there, but I saw that one, the best of the gods, in form.

original: tat su vām mitrāvaruṇā mahitvam īrmā tasthuṣīr ahabhir duduhre /
analyzed: tat su vām mitrāvaruṇāḥ mahitvam īrmā tasthuṣīḥ ahabhiḥ duduhre
translated: That greatness of yours, O Mitra and Varuna, the slow-moving ones have milked with the days.

original: viśvāḥ pinvathaḥ svasarasya dhenā anu vām ekaḥ pavir ā vavarta //
analyzed: viśvāḥ pinvathaḥ svasarasya dhenāḥ anu vām ekaḥ paviḥ ā vavarta
translated: You fill all the lowing cows of the lake; one of you has turned to the filter.

original: adhārayatam pṛthivīm uta dyām mitrarājānā varuṇā mahobhiḥ /
analyzed: adhārayatam pṛthivīm uta dyām mitra rājānā varuṇā mahobhiḥ
translated: You, O Mitra and Varuna, the kings, have supported the earth and the sky with your powers.

original: vardhayatam oṣadhīḥ pinvataṃ gā ava vṛṣṭiṃ sṛjataṃ jīradānū //🔽ā vām aśvāsaḥ suyujo vahantu yataraśmaya upa yantv arvāk /
analyzed: vardhayatam oṣadhīḥ pinvatam gāḥ ava vṛṣṭim sṛjatam jīra dānū  ā vām aśvāsaḥ su yujaḥ vahantu yata raśmayaḥ upa yantu arvāk
translated: You increase the plants, you swell the cows, you send down rain, O you who give quickly.🔽Let your well-yoked horses bring you hitherward, O you whose rays are turned this way.

original: ghṛtasya nirṇig anu vartate vām upa sindhavaḥ pradivi kṣaranti //🔽anu śrutām amatiṃ vardhad urvīm barhir iva yajuṣā rakṣamāṇā /🔽namasvantā dhṛtadakṣādhi garte mitrāsāthe varuṇeḷāsv antaḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtasya nirṇij anu vartate vām upa sindhavaḥ pradivi kṣaranti  anu śrutām amatim vardhat urvīm barhiḥ iva yajuṣā rakṣamāṇā  namasvantā dhṛtadakṣā adhi garte mitrā āsāthe varuṇā iḷāsu antar
translated: The stream of ghee follows you; the rivers flow on the surface of the earth.🔽Increasing the vast and famous bounty, guarding it with the sacrificial formula as with a grass-mat,🔽You two, O Mitra and Varuna, with firm powers, bow down in the pit, in the waters.

original: akravihastā sukṛte paraspā yaṃ trāsāthe varuṇeḷāsv antaḥ /
analyzed: a kravi hastā su kṛte paraspā yam trāsāthe varuṇā iḷāsu antar
translated: You two, O Mitra and Varuna, with hands that do not tremble, with good protection, in the waters, for the good man whom you protect.

original: rājānā kṣatram ahṛṇīyamānā sahasrasthūṇam bibhṛthaḥ saha dvau //
analyzed: rājānā kṣatram a hṛṇīyamānā sahasra sthūṇam bibhṛthaḥ saha dvau
translated: O kings, not despised, you two support the royal power with a thousand pillars and two.

original: hiraṇyanirṇig ayo asya sthūṇā vi bhrājate divy aśvājanīva /
analyzed: hiraṇya nirṇij ayaḥ asya sthūṇā vi bhrājate divi aśvājanī iva
translated: His pillar is of gold, it shines in the sky like a horse-winning post.

original: bhadre kṣetre nimitā tilvile vā sanema madhvo adhigartyasya //
analyzed: bhadre kṣetre nimitā tilvile vā sanema madhvaḥ adhigartyasya
translated: In a good field or in a tilvīla, may we obtain the honey of the Adhigaṛtya.

original: hiraṇyarūpam uṣaso vyuṣṭāv ayasthūṇam uditā sūryasya /
analyzed: hiraṇya rūpam uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau aya sthūṇam uditā sūryasya
translated: The golden form of the dawns at dawn, the pillar of iron at sunrise,

original: ā rohatho varuṇa mitra gartam ataś cakṣāthe aditiṃ ditiṃ ca //
analyzed: ā rohathaḥ varuṇa mitra gartam atas cakṣāthe aditim ditim ca
translated: Ascend the pit, O Varuṇa and Mitra, from there look upon Aditi and Diti.

original: yad baṃhiṣṭhaṃ nātividhe sudānū acchidraṃ śarma bhuvanasya gopā /
analyzed: yat baṃhiṣṭham na atividhe sudānū acchidram śarma bhuvanasya gopā
translated: The most bountiful, which does not transgress, the faultless shelter, guardians of the world, O bountiful ones,

original: tena no mitrāvaruṇāv aviṣṭaṃ siṣāsanto jigīvāṃsaḥ syāma //
analyzed: tena naḥ mitrāvaruṇau aviṣṭam siṣāsantaḥ jigīvāṃsaḥ syāma
translated: By that, O Mitra and Varuṇa, we are encompassed. Desiring, may we be victorious.

original: ṛtasya gopāv adhi tiṣṭhatho rathaṃ satyadharmāṇā parame vyomani /
analyzed: ṛtasya gopau adhi tiṣṭhathaḥ ratham satya dharmāṇā parame vyomani
translated: You two stand on the chariot of truth, in the highest heaven, you who have the law of truth.

original: yam atra mitrāvaruṇāvatho yuvaṃ tasmai vṛṣṭir madhumat pinvate divaḥ //
analyzed: yam atra mitrāvaruṇau avathaḥ yuvam tasmai vṛṣṭiḥ madhumat pinvate divaḥ
translated: The rain of heaven swells for him whom you two, O Mitra and Varuṇa, favor here.

original: samrājāv asya bhuvanasya rājatho mitrāvaruṇā vidathe svardṛśā /
analyzed: samrājau asya bhuvanasya rājathaḥ mitrāvaruṇā vidathe svar dṛśā
translated: You two are the emperors of this world, Mitra and Varuṇa, in the sacrifice, seeing the light.

original: vṛṣṭiṃ vāṃ rādho amṛtatvam īmahe dyāvāpṛthivī vi caranti tanyavaḥ //
analyzed: vṛṣṭim vām rādhaḥ amṛta tvam īmahe dyāvāpṛthivī vi caranti tanyavaḥ
translated: We implore your rain and bounty, immortality. The thunders move between heaven and earth.

original: samrājā ugrā vṛṣabhā divas patī pṛthivyā mitrāvaruṇā vicarṣaṇī /
analyzed: samrājau ugrā vṛṣabhā divaḥ patī pṛthivyāḥ mitrāvaruṇā vicarṣaṇī
translated: The two emperors, the fierce bulls, the lords of heaven, Mitra and Varuṇa, the swift ones,

original: citrebhir abhrair upa tiṣṭhatho ravaṃ dyāṃ varṣayatho asurasya māyayā //
analyzed: citrebhiḥ abhraiḥ upa tiṣṭhathaḥ ravam dyām varṣayathaḥ asurasya māyayā
translated: With your wondrous clouds you attend on the roar, you cause rain to fall on the sky by the Asura's magic.

original: māyā vām mitrāvaruṇā divi śritā sūryo jyotiś carati citram āyudham /
analyzed: māyā vām mitrāvaruṇāḥ divi śritā sūryaḥ jyotiḥ carati citram āyudham
translated: Your magic, O Mitra and Varuna, is established in the sky; the sun moves with wondrous weapons as its light.

original: tam abhreṇa vṛṣṭyā gūhatho divi parjanya drapsā madhumanta īrate //
analyzed: tam abhreṇa vṛṣṭyā gūhathaḥ divi parjanya drapsāḥ madhumantaḥ īrate
translated: You two cover it with your cloud and rain in the sky; the drops of Parjanya, rich in honey, flow forth.

original: rathaṃ yuñjate marutaḥ śubhe sukhaṃ śūro na mitrāvaruṇā gaviṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: ratham yuñjate marutaḥ śubhe sukham śūraḥ na mitrāvaruṇā gaviṣṭiṣu
translated: The Maruts yoke the chariot, beautiful and pleasant; the hero, like Mitra and Varuna, in the contests for the cows.

original: rajāṃsi citrā vi caranti tanyavo divaḥ samrājā payasā na ukṣatam //
analyzed: rajāṃsi citrāḥ vi caranti tanyavaḥ divaḥ samrājā payasā naḥ ukṣatam
translated: The wondrous clouds move through the variegated realms; O sovereigns of the sky, sprinkle us with milk.

original: vācaṃ su mitrāvaruṇāv irāvatīm parjanyaś citrāṃ vadati tviṣīmatīm /🔽abhrā vasata marutaḥ su māyayā dyāṃ varṣayatam aruṇām arepasam //
analyzed: vācam su mitrāvaruṇau irāvatīm parjanyaḥ citrām vadati tviṣīmatīm  abhrā vasata marutaḥ su māyayā dyām varṣayatam aruṇām arepasam
translated: Parjanya speaks the wondrous speech, rich in food, full of splendor, O Mitra and Varuna.🔽The Maruts dwell in the cloud with their wondrous magic; cause rain to fall on the sky, red and spotless.

original: dharmaṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā vratā rakṣethe asurasya māyayā /
analyzed: dharmaṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā vratā rakṣethe asurasya māyayā
translated: By the wise law, O Mitra and Varuna, you two protect the vows by the Asura's magic.

original: ṛtena viśvam bhuvanaṃ vi rājathaḥ sūryam ā dhattho divi citryaṃ ratham //
analyzed: ṛtena viśvam bhuvanam vi rājathaḥ sūryam ā dhatthaḥ divi citryam ratham
translated: By the truth you two rule over the whole world; you two have placed the sun, the wondrous chariot, in the sky.

original: varuṇaṃ vo riśādasam ṛcā mitraṃ havāmahe /
analyzed: varuṇam vaḥ riśādasam ṛcā mitram havāmahe
translated: With a verse we invoke Varuna, the destroyer of enemies, and Mitra.

original: pari vrajeva bāhvor jaganvāṃsā svarṇaram //
analyzed: pari vrajā iva bāhvoḥ jaganvāṃsā svarṇaram
translated: Circling like arms, they have gone to the golden one.

original: tā bāhavā sucetunā pra yantam asmā arcate /
analyzed: tā bāhavā sucetunā pra yantam asmai arcate
translated: Those arms of yours, with good counsel, go forth to him who lauds you.

original: śevaṃ hi jāryaṃ vāṃ viśvāsu kṣāsu joguve //
analyzed: śevam hi jāryam vām viśvāsu kṣāsu joguve
translated: For you are to be served, O you who are to be served, in all the people's houses.

original: yan nūnam aśyāṃ gatim mitrasya yāyām pathā /
analyzed: yat nūnam aśyām gatim mitrasya yāyām pathā
translated: If now I should seek a way, I would go by the path of Mitra,

original: asya priyasya śarmaṇy ahiṃsānasya saścire //
analyzed: asya priyasya śarmaṇi a hiṃsānasya saścire
translated: In the protection of this dear one, in the observance of this harmless one.

original: yuvābhyām mitrāvaruṇopamaṃ dheyām ṛcā /
analyzed: yuvābhyām mitrāvaruṇā upamam dheyām ṛcā
translated: To you, O Mitra and Varuna, I would offer a hymn worthy of you,

original: yad dha kṣaye maghonāṃ stotṝṇāṃ ca spūrdhase //
analyzed: yat ha kṣaye maghonām stotṝṇām ca spūrdhase
translated: Since you vie with the wealthy and the praisers in your abode.

original: ā no mitra sudītibhir varuṇaś ca sadhastha ā /
analyzed: ā naḥ mitra su dītibhiḥ varuṇaḥ ca sadhasthe ā
translated: Come to us, O Mitra with your fair lights, and Varuna to your own place,

original: sve kṣaye maghonāṃ sakhīnāṃ ca vṛdhase //🔽yuvaṃ no yeṣu varuṇa kṣatram bṛhac ca bibhṛthaḥ /
analyzed: sve kṣaye maghonām sakhīnām ca vṛdhase  yuvam naḥ yeṣu varuṇa kṣatram bṛhat ca bibhṛthaḥ
translated: In your own abode, to increase the wealth of the wealthy and the friends.🔽O Varuna, in which of your abodes do you and the great king Mitra bear the kingdom?

original: uru ṇo vājasātaye kṛtaṃ rāye svastaye //
analyzed: uru naḥ vājasātaye kṛtam rāye svastaye
translated: Make it wide for us to gain strength, for wealth, for well-being.

original: ucchantyām me yajatā devakṣatre ruśadgavi /
analyzed: ucchantyām me yajatā devakṣatre ruśadgavi
translated: When the priest is offering to me in the rising dawn, in the divine realm, in the ruddy cow,

original: sutaṃ somaṃ na hastibhir ā paḍbhir dhāvataṃ narā bibhratāv arcanānasam //
analyzed: sutam somam na hastibhiḥ ā paḍbhiḥ dhāvatam narā bibhratau arcanānasam
translated: Bring the pressed Soma with your hands, O heroes, with your feet run, bearing the praiseworthy one.

original: yaś ciketa sa sukratur devatrā sa bravītu naḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ciketa sa su kratuḥ devatrā sa bravītu naḥ
translated: He who knows this, he is the wise one. Let him speak to us about the gods.

original: varuṇo yasya darśato mitro vā vanate giraḥ //
analyzed: varuṇaḥ yasya darśataḥ mitraḥ vā vanate giraḥ
translated: The wonderful Varuna, or Mitra who accepts the praises.

original: tā hi śreṣṭhavarcasā rājānā dīrghaśruttamā /
analyzed: tā hi śreṣṭha varcasā rājānā dīrghaśruttamā
translated: For they are the most glorious of the kings, the most renowned.

original: tā satpatī ṛtāvṛdha ṛtāvānā janejane //
analyzed: tā sat patī ṛtāvṛdhaḥ ṛtāvānā janejane
translated: Those lords of the true, increasers of the true, in every race of men.

original: tā vām iyāno 'vase pūrvā upa bruve sacā /
analyzed: tā vām iyānaḥ vase pūrvau upa bruve sacā
translated: To you two, thus eager, I address my earliest prayer for help,

original: svaśvāsaḥ su cetunā vājāṃ abhi pra dāvane //🔽mitro aṃhoś cid ād uru kṣayāya gātuṃ vanate /
analyzed: su aśvāsaḥ su cetunā vājām abhi pra dāvane  mitraḥ aṃhoḥ cit āt uru kṣayāya gātum vanate
translated: With good horses, with good choice, for the bestowing of strength.🔽Mitra even from distress finds room for the wide-spreading path.

original: mitrasya hi pratūrvataḥ sumatir asti vidhataḥ //
analyzed: mitrasya hi pratūrvataḥ sumatiḥ asti vidhataḥ
translated: For the favour of the active, the all-ordering, Mitra is.

original: vayam mitrasyāvasi syāma saprathastame /
analyzed: vayam mitrasya avasi syāma saprathastame
translated: May we be in the help of Mitra, most widely extended.

original: anehasas tvotayaḥ satrā varuṇaśeṣasaḥ //
analyzed: anehasaḥ tvotayaḥ satrā varuṇa śeṣasaḥ
translated: The unoffending, the well-ordered, the ever-lasting, the followers of Varuṇa.

original: yuvam mitremaṃ janaṃ yatathaḥ saṃ ca nayathaḥ /
analyzed: yuvam mitrā imam janam yatathaḥ sam ca nayathaḥ
translated: You two, O Mitra and Varuṇa, protect this people, and lead it on.

original: mā maghonaḥ pari khyatam mo asmākam ṛṣīṇāṃ gopīthe na uruṣyatam //
analyzed: mā maghonaḥ pari khyatam mā u asmākam ṛṣīṇām gopīthe naḥ uruṣyatam
translated: Do not pass by the bountiful, do not forsake us R̥ishis. Be ye our guardians in the drinking of the cows.

original: ā cikitāna sukratū devau marta riśādasā /
analyzed: ā cikitāna su kratū devau marta riśādasā
translated: The two wise, the two observant, the two gods, slayers of the foe,

original: varuṇāya ṛtapeśase dadhīta prayase mahe //
analyzed: varuṇāya ṛta peśase dadhīta prayase mahe
translated: To Varuṇa, whose form is truth, should one offer, in the great service.

original: tā hi kṣatram avihrutaṃ samyag asuryam āśāte /
analyzed: tā hi kṣatram a vihrutam samyak asuryam āśāte
translated: For they have gained the imperishable sovereignty, the true rule of the Asuras.

original: adha vrateva mānuṣaṃ svar ṇa dhāyi darśatam //🔽tā vām eṣe rathānām urvīṃ gavyūtim eṣām /
analyzed: adha vratā iva mānuṣam svar na dhāyi darśatam  tā vām rathānām urvīm gavyūtim eṣām
translated: And then the heavenly, the beautiful, was established as the law of men.🔽To you two, in the seeking of your chariots, we offer the wide pasture of these (cows).

original: rātahavyasya suṣṭutiṃ dadhṛk stomair manāmahe //
analyzed: rāta havyasya suṣṭutim dadhṛṣ stomaiḥ manāmahe
translated: We, with our praises, with our lauds, bear to Rātahavya the praise of him who brings oblations.

original: adhā hi kāvyā yuvaṃ dakṣasya pūrbhir adbhutā /
analyzed: adhā hi kāvyā yuvam dakṣasya pūrbhiḥ adbhutā
translated: For verily, O ye two, with the wondrous strongholds of your power,

original: ni ketunā janānāṃ cikethe pūtadakṣasā //
analyzed: ni ketunā janānām cikethe pūta dakṣasā
translated: Ye have shone forth with your light, with your pure strength, before the people.

original: tad ṛtam pṛthivi bṛhac chravaeṣa ṛṣīṇām /
analyzed: tat ṛtam pṛthivi bṛhat śravaḥ eṣaḥ ṛṣīṇām
translated: That is the great truth of the Rishis, O Earth,

original: jrayasānāv aram pṛthv ati kṣaranti yāmabhiḥ //
analyzed: jrayasānau aram pṛthu ati kṣaranti yāmabhiḥ
translated: Which, with their strength, they have spread out, they have extended with their paths.

original: ā yad vām īyacakṣasā mitra vayaṃ ca sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: ā yat vām mitra vayam ca sūrayaḥ
translated: When, O Mitra, we, and the princes, with our eye that reaches far,

original: vyaciṣṭhe bahupāyye yatemahi svarājye //
analyzed: vyaciṣṭhe bahu pāyye yatemahi sva rājye
translated: Would serve you in your most spacious abode, in your own dominion.

original: baḷ itthā deva niṣkṛtam ādityā yajatam bṛhat /🔽varuṇa mitrāryaman varṣiṣṭhaṃ kṣatram āśāthe //
analyzed: baḷ itthā deva niṣkṛtam ādityā yajatam bṛhat  varuṇa mitra aryaman varṣiṣṭham kṣatram āśāthe
translated: Here, O God, is the great sacrifice of the Âdityas, O Mitra,🔽You have obtained the highest lordship, O Varuṇa, O Mitra, O Aryaman.

original: ā yad yoniṃ hiraṇyayaṃ varuṇa mitra sadathaḥ /
analyzed: ā yat yonim hiraṇyayam varuṇa mitra sadathaḥ
translated: When, O Varuṇa, you two sit in the golden womb,

original: dhartārā carṣaṇīnāṃ yantaṃ sumnaṃ riśādasā //
analyzed: dhartārā carṣaṇīnām yantam sumnam riśādasā
translated: The supporters of men, destroying evil, you two go to your joy.

original: viśve hi viśvavedaso varuṇo mitro aryamā /
analyzed: viśve hi viśva vedasaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: For all the all-knowing ones, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,

original: vratā padeva saścire pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ //
analyzed: vratā padā iva saścire pānti martyam riṣaḥ
translated: Protect the mortal from harm, as if guarding a place of worship.

original: te hi satyā ṛtaspṛśa ṛtāvāno janejane /
analyzed: te hi satyāḥ ṛta spṛśaḥ ṛtāvānaḥ janejane
translated: For they are true, touching the truth, righteous in every family,

original: sunīthāsaḥ sudānavo 'ṃhoś cid urucakrayaḥ //
analyzed: su nīthāsaḥ sudānavaḥ ṃhoḥ cit uru cakrayaḥ
translated: Of good gifts, bountiful, who have made a wide way even through woe.

original: ko nu vām mitrāstuto varuṇo vā tanūnām /
analyzed: kaḥ nu vām mitrāstutaḥ varuṇaḥ vā tanūnām
translated: Who then, O Mitra, or Varuṇa, is to be praised for your bodies?

original: tat su vām eṣate matir atribhya eṣate matiḥ //
analyzed: tat su vām eṣate matiḥ atribhyaḥ eṣate matiḥ
translated: That thought of yours is successful, that thought of yours is successful for the Âtris.

original: pra vo mitrāya gāyata varuṇāya vipā girā /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mitrāya gāyata varuṇāya vipā girā
translated: Sing forth to Mitra, to Varuna, to Vipā with a song of praise,

original: mahikṣatrāv ṛtam bṛhat //
analyzed: mahi kṣatrau ṛtam bṛhat
translated: To the great kings, to the lofty law.

original: samrājā yā ghṛtayonī mitraś cobhā varuṇaś ca /
analyzed: samrājā yā ghṛta yonī mitraḥ ca ubhā varuṇaḥ ca
translated: The two great kings, Mitra and Varuna, whose home is in the ghee,

original: devā deveṣu praśastā //
analyzed: devā deveṣu praśastā
translated: The gods praised by the gods.

original: tā naḥ śaktam pārthivasya maho rāyo divyasya /
analyzed: tā naḥ śaktam pārthivasya mahaḥ rāyaḥ divyasya
translated: They are able to give us great wealth, of earth and of heaven.

original: mahi vāṃ kṣatraṃ deveṣu //
analyzed: mahi vām kṣatram deveṣu
translated: Great is your lordship among the gods.

original: ṛtam ṛtena sapanteṣiraṃ dakṣam āśāte /
analyzed: ṛtam ṛtena sapantā iṣiram dakṣam āśāte
translated: They who join the law with the law, who desire the strong power,

original: adruhā devau vardhete //
analyzed: adruhā devau vardhete
translated: The two gods who increase without doing harm.

original: vṛṣṭidyāvā rītyāpeṣas patī dānumatyāḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣṭi dyāvā rīti apā iṣaḥ patī dānumatyāḥ
translated: The two who are the lords of the rain-pouring heaven and earth, of the cloud-bearing (sky),

original: bṛhantaṃ gartam āśāte //
analyzed: bṛhantam gartam āśāte
translated: They have attained the great abode of the bountiful.

original: trī rocanā varuṇa trīṃr uta dyūn trīṇi mitra dhārayatho rajāṃsi /
analyzed: trī rocanā varuṇa trīn uta dyūn trīṇi mitra dhārayathaḥ rajāṃsi
translated: O Varuna, three luminous realms, and three heavens, O Mitra, three firmaments you uphold.

original: vāvṛdhānāv amatiṃ kṣatriyasyānu vrataṃ rakṣamāṇāv ajuryam //
analyzed: vāvṛdhānau amatim kṣatriyasya anu vratam rakṣamāṇau ajuryam
translated: Increasing the strength of the king, guarding the imperishable vow.

original: irāvatīr varuṇa dhenavo vām madhumad vāṃ sindhavo mitra duhre /
analyzed: irāvatīḥ varuṇa dhenavaḥ vām madhumat vām sindhavaḥ mitra duhre
translated: O Varuna, your cows are full of nourishment, O Mitra, your streams yield honey for you.

original: trayas tasthur vṛṣabhāsas tisṛṇāṃ dhiṣaṇānāṃ retodhā vi dyumantaḥ //
analyzed: trayaḥ tasthuḥ vṛṣabhāsaḥ tisṛṇām dhiṣaṇānām retaḥ dhāḥ vi dyumantaḥ
translated: The three, the most powerful, the three powers, the impregnators of the three, are radiant.

original: prātar devīm aditiṃ johavīmi madhyandina uditā sūryasya /
analyzed: prātar devīm aditim johavīmi madhyandine uditā sūryasya
translated: In the morning I invoke the goddess Aditi, at midday when the sun has risen,

original: rāye mitrāvaruṇā sarvatāteḷe tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ //
analyzed: rāye mitrāvaruṇā sarvatātā īḍe tokāya tanayāya śam yoḥ
translated: For wealth, O Mitra-Varuṇa, for all our families, for our children and offspring, for our welfare and joy.

original: yā dhartārā rajaso rocanasyotādityā divyā pārthivasya /
analyzed: yā dhartārā rajasaḥ rocanasya uta ādityā divyā pārthivasya
translated: Who are the supporters of the realm of light, and of the heavenly and earthly realm, O Âdityas.

original: na vāṃ devā amṛtā ā minanti vratāni mitrāvaruṇā dhruvāṇi //
analyzed: na vām devāḥ amṛtāḥ ā minanti vratāni mitrāvaruṇā dhruvāṇi
translated: The immortal gods do not violate your firm ordinances, O Mitra-Varuna.

original: purūruṇā cid dhy asty avo nūnaṃ vāṃ varuṇa /
analyzed: purūruṇā cit hi asti avaḥ nūnam vām varuṇa
translated: Even to one of great glory, O Varuna, is there help from you.

original: mitra vaṃsi vāṃ sumatim //🔽tā vāṃ samyag adruhvāṇeṣam aśyāma dhāyase /🔽vayaṃ te rudrā syāma //
analyzed: mitra vaṃsi vām sumatim  tā vām samyak adruhvāṇā iṣam aśyāma dhāyase  vayam te rudrā syāma
translated: I seek your favour, O Mitra.🔽With you two, O Rudras, may we obtain that which is good for support, free from guile.🔽May we be yours, O Rudras.

original: pātaṃ no rudrā pāyubhir uta trāyethāṃ sutrātrā /
analyzed: pātam naḥ rudrā pāyubhiḥ uta trāyethām su trātrā
translated: Protect us, O Rudras, with your protections, and deliver us, O good protectors.

original: turyāma dasyūn tanūbhiḥ //
analyzed: turyāma dasyūn tanūbhiḥ
translated: May we conquer the Dasyus with our bodies.

original: mā kasyādbhutakratū yakṣam bhujemā tanūbhiḥ /
analyzed: mā kasya adbhuta kratū yakṣam bhujema tanūbhiḥ
translated: Let us not, with our bodies, offend the wondrously wise one of you.

original: mā śeṣasā mā tanasā //
analyzed: mā śeṣasā mā tanasā
translated: Let us not with our remnant, nor with our body.

original: ā no gantaṃ riśādasā varuṇa mitra barhaṇā /
analyzed: ā naḥ gantam riśādasā varuṇa mitra barhaṇā
translated: Come to us, O you who destroy the enemy, O Varuna and Mitra, with your greatness.

original: upemaṃ cārum adhvaram //
analyzed: upa imam cārum adhvaram
translated: To this fair sacrifice.

original: viśvasya hi pracetasā varuṇa mitra rājathaḥ /
analyzed: viśvasya hi pracetasā varuṇa mitra rājathaḥ
translated: For with the foresight of all things, O Varuna and Mitra, ye rule.

original: īśānā pipyataṃ dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: īśānā pipyatam dhiyaḥ
translated: As lords, make our thoughts to swell.

original: upa naḥ sutam ā gataṃ varuṇa mitra dāśuṣaḥ /
analyzed: upa naḥ sutam ā gatam varuṇa mitra dāśuṣaḥ
translated: Come to the offered juice of him who offers, O Varuna and Mitra.

original: asya somasya pītaye //
analyzed: asya somasya pītaye
translated: To drink this Soma.

original: ā mitre varuṇe vayaṃ gīrbhir juhumo atrivat /
analyzed: ā mitre varuṇe vayam gīrbhiḥ juhumaḥ atri vat
translated: To Mitra and Varuna we call with hymns, as Atri did.

original: ni barhiṣi sadataṃ somapītaye //
analyzed: ni barhiṣi sadatam soma pītaye
translated: Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma.

original: vratena stho dhruvakṣemā dharmaṇā yātayajjanā /
analyzed: vratena sthaḥ dhruva kṣemā dharmaṇā yātayat janā
translated: Ye are established by the vow, by the law, by firm prosperity. Ye who go to the sacrifice, the people.

original: ni barhiṣi sadataṃ somapītaye //
analyzed: ni barhiṣi sadatam soma pītaye
translated: Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma.

original: mitraś ca no varuṇaś ca juṣetāṃ yajñam iṣṭaye /
analyzed: mitraḥ ca naḥ varuṇaḥ ca juṣetām yajñam iṣṭaye
translated: May Mitra and Varuna accept our sacrifice for prosperity.

original: ni barhiṣi sadatāṃ somapītaye //🔽yad adya sthaḥ parāvati yad arvāvaty aśvinā /
analyzed: ni barhiṣi sadatām soma pītaye  yat adya sthaḥ parāvati yat arvāvati aśvinā
translated: Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma.🔽If ye be this day afar, or near at hand, O ye Aṣvins,

original: yad vā purū purubhujā yad antarikṣa ā gatam //
analyzed: yat vā purū puru bhujā yat antarikṣe ā gatam
translated: Or in many a place, O ye who give to many, or in the atmosphere, come hither.

original: iha tyā purubhūtamā purū daṃsāṃsi bibhratā /
analyzed: iha tyā puru bhūtamā purū daṃsāṃsi bibhratā
translated: Here, O ye who are most bountiful, bearing many gifts,

original: varasyā yāmy adhrigū huve tuviṣṭamā bhuje //
analyzed: varasyā yāmi adhrigū huve tuviṣṭamā bhuje
translated: I call, O ye who are most bountiful, to the best boon.

original: īrmānyad vapuṣe vapuś cakraṃ rathasya yemathuḥ /
analyzed: īrmānyat vapuṣe vapuḥ cakram rathasya yemathuḥ
translated: The form which ye have made for the body, the wheel of the chariot which ye have guided,

original: pary anyā nāhuṣā yugā mahnā rajāṃsi dīyathaḥ //
analyzed: pari anyā nāhuṣā yugā mahnā rajāṃsi dīyathaḥ
translated: Ye have gone through the regions with many a yoke, O ye who are rich in gifts.

original: tad ū ṣu vām enā kṛtaṃ viśvā yad vām anu ṣṭave /
analyzed: tat u su vām enā kṛtam viśvā yat vām anu stave
translated: This deed of yours, O ye two, is to be praised, whatever we may praise of you,

original: nānā jātāv arepasā sam asme bandhum eyathuḥ //
analyzed: nānā jātau arepasā sam asme bandhum eyathuḥ
translated: Ye who are born separately, unblemished, have come to us as kinsmen.

original: ā yad vāṃ sūryā rathaṃ tiṣṭhad raghuṣyadaṃ sadā /🔽pari vām aruṣā vayo ghṛṇā varanta ātapaḥ //
analyzed: ā yat vām sūryā ratham tiṣṭhat raghuṣyadam sadā  pari vām aruṣāḥ vayaḥ ghṛṇāḥ varante ātapaḥ
translated: When the sun hath mounted your chariot which ever moves swiftly,🔽The ruddy wind hath encompassed you about, the heat hath encompassed you.

original: yuvor atriś ciketati narā sumnena cetasā /
analyzed: yuvoḥ atriḥ ciketati narā sumnena cetasā
translated: Atri, O ye Heroes, thinks of you with a mind full of bliss.

original: gharmaṃ yad vām arepasaṃ nāsatyāsnā bhuraṇyati //
analyzed: gharmam yat vām arepasam nāsatya asnā bhuraṇyati
translated: When the spotless Gharma is being pressed for you, O Nâsatyas,

original: ugro vāṃ kakuho yayiḥ śṛṇve yāmeṣu saṃtaniḥ /
analyzed: ugraḥ vām kakuhaḥ yayiḥ śṛṇve yāmeṣu saṃtaniḥ
translated: Fierce is your Kakubh, your going, your wheel-track is heard in your journeys,

original: yad vāṃ daṃsobhir aśvinātrir narāvavartati //🔽madhva ū ṣu madhūyuvā rudrā siṣakti pipyuṣī /
analyzed: yat vām daṃsobhiḥ aśvinā atriḥ narā avavartati  madhvaḥ u su madhūyuvā rudrā siṣakti pipyuṣī
translated: When, O Aṣvins, Triṣoka turns you hither with his praises,🔽The sweet, O Rudras, rich in sweets, the swelling (stream) flows to you,

original: yat samudrāti parṣathaḥ pakvāḥ pṛkṣo bharanta vām //
analyzed: yat samudra ati parṣathaḥ pakvāḥ pṛkṣaḥ bharanta vām
translated: When ye pass over the cooked food of the sea, ye receive your own food.

original: satyam id vā u aśvinā yuvām āhur mayobhuvā /
analyzed: satyam id vai u aśvinā yuvām āhuḥ mayobhuvā
translated: Verily, O ye Aṣvins, they call you two givers of bliss.

original: tā yāman yāmahūtamā yāmann ā mṛḷayattamā //🔽imā brahmāṇi vardhanāśvibhyāṃ santu śantamā /
analyzed: tā yāman yāmahūtamā yāman ā mṛḍayattamā  imā brahmāṇi vardhana aśvibhyām santu śantamā
translated: Come to us, O ye invoked in the journey, come to us, O ye most merciful in the journey.🔽May these prayers of ours be most auspicious to the Aṣvins,

original: yā takṣāma rathāṃ ivāvocāma bṛhan namaḥ //
analyzed: yā takṣāma rathān iva avocāma bṛhat namaḥ
translated: Which we have uttered like two well-fashioned chariots, a great homage.

original: kūṣṭho devāv aśvinādyā divo manāvasū /
analyzed: devau aśvinā adyā divaḥ manāvasū
translated: Kusha, O ye two Gods, O ye two Aṣvins, to-day, O ye two benefactors,

original: tac chravatho vṛṣaṇvasū atrir vām ā vivāsati //
analyzed: tat śravathaḥ vṛṣaṇvasū atriḥ vām ā vivāsati
translated: Hear that, O ye two rich in wealth, Atri invites you.

original: kuha tyā kuha nu śrutā divi devā nāsatyā /
analyzed: kuha tyā kuha nu śrutā divi devā nāsatyā
translated: Where are ye, O ye two renowned in heaven, O ye two Gods, O ye two Nâsatyas?

original: kasminn ā yatatho jane ko vāṃ nadīnāṃ sacā //
analyzed: kasmin ā yatathaḥ jane kaḥ vām nadīnām sacā
translated: In what people do ye delight? Who is your companion among the rivers?

original: kaṃ yāthaḥ kaṃ ha gacchathaḥ kam acchā yuñjāthe ratham /
analyzed: kam yāthaḥ kam ha gacchathaḥ kam acchā yuñjāthe ratham
translated: Whom do ye visit? Whom do ye go to? Whom do ye yoke to your chariot?

original: kasya brahmāṇi raṇyatho vayaṃ vām uśmasīṣṭaye //
analyzed: kasya brahmāṇi raṇyathaḥ vayam vām uśmasi iṣṭaye
translated: Whose prayers do ye delight in? Or us, that we may be dear to you.

original: pauraṃ cid dhy udaprutam paura paurāya jinvathaḥ /
analyzed: pauram cit hi uda prutam paura paurāya jinvathaḥ
translated: Even the most distant of the people, O Paura, you quicken for the Paura.

original: yad īṃ gṛbhītatātaye siṃham iva druhas pade //🔽pra cyavānāj jujuruṣo vavrim atkaṃ na muñcathaḥ /
analyzed: yat īm gṛbhītatātaye siṃham iva druhaḥ pade  pra cyavānāt jujuruṣaḥ vavrim atkam na muñcathaḥ
translated: When you seize him for your own, like a lion in the lair of the wicked.🔽You do not release the clinging, the clinging to the one who is falling, like a rope.

original: yuvā yadī kṛthaḥ punar ā kāmam ṛṇve vadhvaḥ //
analyzed: yuvā yadī kṛthaḥ punar ā kāmam ṛṇve vadhvaḥ
translated: When you have made him young again, I turn to the bride's desire.

original: asti hi vām iha stotā smasi vāṃ saṃdṛśi śriye /
analyzed: asti hi vām iha stotā smasi vām saṃdṛśi śriye
translated: For there is a praiser here for you two, we are in your sight for glory.

original: nū śrutam ma ā gatam avobhir vājinīvasū //
analyzed: nu śrutam me ā gatam avobhiḥ vājinīvasū
translated: Now come, O you who hear, with your aids, O you who are rich in wealth.

original: ko vām adya purūṇām ā vavne martyānām /
analyzed: kaḥ vām adya purūṇām ā vavne martyānām
translated: Who today has chosen you from among many men?

original: ko vipro vipravāhasā ko yajñair vājinīvasū //
analyzed: kaḥ vipraḥ vipra vāhasā kaḥ yajñaiḥ vājinīvasū
translated: Who is the sage, O you who are carried by sages, who is the sacrificer, O you who are rich in wealth?

original: ā vāṃ ratho rathānāṃ yeṣṭho yātv aśvinā /🔽purū cid asmayus tira āṅgūṣo martyeṣv ā //🔽śam ū ṣu vām madhūyuvāsmākam astu carkṛtiḥ /
analyzed: ā vām rathaḥ rathānām yeṣṭhaḥ yātu aśvinā  purū cit asmayuḥ tiras āṅgūṣaḥ martyeṣu ā  śam u su vām madhūyuvā asmākam astu carkṛtiḥ
translated: May your chariot, O Aśvins, the best of chariots, come to us.🔽Even through many, O you who are ready to help, through the praises of mortals.🔽May our hymn be pleasing to you two, rich in honey.

original: arvācīnā vicetasā vibhiḥ śyeneva dīyatam //
analyzed: arvācīnā vicetasā vibhiḥ śyenā iva dīyatam
translated: Come hither with your thoughts, come with your wings, like a falcon.

original: aśvinā yad dha karhi cic chuśrūyātam imaṃ havam /
analyzed: aśvinā yat ha karhi cit śuśrūyātam imam havam
translated: O Aśvins, whenever you hear this invocation of mine,

original: vasvīr ū ṣu vām bhujaḥ pṛñcanti su vām pṛcaḥ //
analyzed: vasvīḥ u su vām bhujaḥ pṛñcanti su vām pṛcaḥ
translated: May your bountiful arms, your good gifts, be ours.

original: prati priyatamaṃ rathaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vasuvāhanam /
analyzed: prati priyatamam ratham vṛṣaṇam vasu vāhanam
translated: To the most beloved chariot, the strong one, which carries wealth,

original: stotā vām aśvināv ṛṣi stomena prati bhūṣati mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam //
analyzed: stotā vām aśvinau ṛṣiḥ stomena prati bhūṣati mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: The sage who praises you, O Aśvins, is honoured with his hymn. O lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

original: atyāyātam aśvinā tiro viśvā ahaṃ sanā /
analyzed: atyāyātam aśvinā tiras viśvāḥ aham
translated: Come, O Aśvins, across all these days.

original: dasrā hiraṇyavartanī suṣumnā sindhuvāhasā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam //
analyzed: dasrā hiraṇya vartanī suṣumnā sindhu vāhasā mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: O wondrous ones, borne on golden paths, O bountiful ones, carried by the rivers, O lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

original: ā no ratnāni bibhratāv aśvinā gacchataṃ yuvam /
analyzed: ā naḥ ratnāni bibhratau aśvinā gacchatam yuvam
translated: O Aśvins, come to us, bearing treasures.

original: rudrā hiraṇyavartanī juṣāṇā vājinīvasū mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam //
analyzed: rudrā hiraṇya vartanī juṣāṇā vājinīvasū mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: O Rudras, borne on golden paths, accepting, O rich in wealth, O lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

original: suṣṭubho vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū rathe vāṇīcy āhitā /
analyzed: suṣṭubhaḥ vām vṛṣaṇvasū rathe vāṇīcī āhitā
translated: Your praise-song, O you rich in goods, is placed on the chariot.

original: uta vāṃ kakuho mṛgaḥ pṛkṣaḥ kṛṇoti vāpuṣo mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam //
analyzed: uta vām kakuhaḥ mṛgaḥ pṛkṣaḥ kṛṇoti vāpuṣaḥ mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: And your deer Kakuhā makes you rich in game, O you who delight in the good, O lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

original: bodhinmanasā rathyeṣirā havanaśrutā /
analyzed: bodhinmanasā rathyā iṣirā havana śrutā
translated: O you who are to be invoked with the mind, O you who travel in chariots, O you who hear the invocation,

original: vibhiś cyavānam aśvinā ni yātho advayāvinam mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam //
analyzed: vibhiḥ cyavānam aśvinā ni yāthaḥ a dvayāvinam mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: O Aśvins, come to Chyavāna, who has no companion, O lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

original: ā vāṃ narā manoyujo 'śvāsaḥ pruṣitapsavaḥ /
analyzed: ā vām narā manaḥ yujaḥ śvāsaḥ pruṣitapsavaḥ
translated: O heroes, let your horses, yoked by the mind, swift, with streaming manes,

original: vayo vahantu pītaye saha sumnebhir aśvinā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam //
analyzed: vayaḥ vahantu pītaye saha sumnebhiḥ aśvinā mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: carry you to the offering, together with bliss, O Aśvins, O lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

original: aśvināv eha gacchataṃ nāsatyā mā vi venatam /
analyzed: aśvinau ā iha gacchatam nāsatyā mā vi venatam
translated: O Aśvins, come hither, O Nāsatyas, do not be negligent.

original: tiraś cid aryayā pari vartir yātam adābhyā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam //
analyzed: tiras cit aryayā pari vartiḥ yātam adābhyā mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: Come, O you two who go around even the farthest, O you two who are not to be deceived, O you two who love sweetness, listen to my call.

original: asmin yajñe adābhyā jaritāraṃ śubhas patī /
analyzed: asmin yajñe adābhyā jaritāram śubhaḥ patī
translated: O you two who are not to be deceived, O lords of splendor, at this sacrifice,

original: avasyum aśvinā yuvaṃ gṛṇantam upa bhūṣatho mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam //
analyzed: avasyum aśvinā yuvam gṛṇantam upa bhūṣathaḥ mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: come to the worshipper who is devoted to you, O Aśvins, who sings your praises. O you two who love sweetness, listen to my call.

original: abhūd uṣā ruśatpaśur āgnir adhāyy ṛtviyaḥ /
analyzed: abhūt uṣāḥ ruśat paśuḥ ā agniḥ adhāyi ṛtviyaḥ
translated: Dawn has become the one with beautiful cattle, the proper Agni has been established.

original: ayoji vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū ratho dasrāv amartyo mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam //
analyzed: ayoji vām vṛṣaṇvasū rathaḥ dasrau amartyaḥ mādhvī mama śrutam havam
translated: Your chariot, O you two who are rich in goods, has been yoked, O you two who are immortal, O you two who are wondrous. O you two who love sweetness, listen to my call.

original: ā bhāty agnir uṣasām anīkam ud viprāṇāṃ devayā vāco asthuḥ /
analyzed: ā bhāti agniḥ uṣasām anīkam ud viprāṇām deva yāḥ vācaḥ asthuḥ
translated: The face of the dawns shines, the divine songs of the seers have arisen.

original: arvāñcā nūnaṃ rathyeha yātam pīpivāṃsam aśvinā gharmam accha //🔽na saṃskṛtam pra mimīto gamiṣṭhānti nūnam aśvinopastuteha /
analyzed: arvāñcā nūnam rathyā iha yātam pīpivāṃsam aśvinā gharmam accha  na saṃskṛtam pra mimītaḥ gamiṣṭhā anti nūnam aśvinā upastutā iha
translated: Come now, O you two who are to be yoked by a chariot, O Aśvins, to the steaming drink.🔽Do not pass over the well-prepared (offering), O you two who go farthest, come now to the praise of the Aśvins.

original: divābhipitve 'vasāgamiṣṭhā praty avartiṃ dāśuṣe śambhaviṣṭhā //
analyzed: divā abhipitve vasa āgamiṣṭhā prati avartim dāśuṣe śambhaviṣṭhā
translated: In the time of the day, O you two who come farthest, come with help, most auspicious, turn away misfortune from the worshipper.

original: utā yātaṃ saṃgave prātar ahno madhyandina uditā sūryasya /
analyzed: uta ā yātam saṃgave prātar ahnaḥ madhyandine uditā sūryasya
translated: And come at the morning pressing, at the midday pressing, when the sun has risen.

original: divā naktam avasā śantamena nedānīm pītir aśvinā tatāna //
analyzed: divā naktam avasā śantamena nā idānīm pītiḥ aśvinā tatāna
translated: By day and by night, O you two who are to be yoked by a chariot, with the most auspicious help, the drink of the Aśvins is spread out now.

original: idaṃ hi vām pradivi sthānam oka ime gṛhā aśvinedaṃ duroṇam /
analyzed: idam hi vām pradivi sthānam okaḥ ime gṛhāḥ aśvinā idam duroṇam
translated: For this is your place, your home in the sky, these are your houses, O Asvins, this your dwelling.

original: ā no divo bṛhataḥ parvatād ādbhyo yātam iṣam ūrjaṃ vahantā //🔽sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema /
analyzed: ā naḥ divaḥ bṛhataḥ parvatāt ā adbhyaḥ yātam iṣam ūrjam vahantā  sam aśvinoḥ avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā su praṇītī gamema
translated: Come to us from the lofty sky, from the mountain, from the waters, bringing food and strength.🔽With the new favour of the Asvins, delightful, may we go with their good guidance.

original: ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni //🔽prātaryāvāṇā prathamā yajadhvam purā gṛdhrād araruṣaḥ pibātaḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ rayim vahatam ā uta vīrān ā viśvāni amṛtā saubhagāni  prātaryāvāṇā prathamā yajadhvam purā gṛdhrāt a raruṣaḥ pibātaḥ
translated: Bring to us wealth and heroes, and all good things, O ye Immortal Ones.🔽Ye who come in the morning, first perform your sacrifice, before the greedy Ruru drinks.

original: prātar hi yajñam aśvinā dadhāte pra śaṃsanti kavayaḥ pūrvabhājaḥ //
analyzed: prātar hi yajñam aśvinā dadhāte pra śaṃsanti kavayaḥ pūrvabhājaḥ
translated: For in the morning the Asvins set the sacrifice forward; the sages praise them, the first to share.

original: prātar yajadhvam aśvinā hinota na sāyam asti devayā ajuṣṭam /
analyzed: prātar yajadhvam aśvinā hinota na sāyam asti deva yāḥ a juṣṭam
translated: Sacrifice in the morning, O Asvins; there is no evening that is not acceptable to the gods.

original: utānyo asmad yajate vi cāvaḥ pūrvaḥpūrvo yajamāno vanīyān //🔽hiraṇyatvaṅ madhuvarṇo ghṛtasnuḥ pṛkṣo vahann ā ratho vartate vām /
analyzed: uta anyaḥ asmat yajate vi ca avaḥ pūrvaḥ pūrvaḥ yajamānaḥ vanīyān  hiraṇya tvac madhu varṇaḥ ghṛta snuḥ pṛkṣaḥ vahan ā rathaḥ vartate vām
translated: Or another than we worships and invites you: each former sacrificer is better than the next.🔽Your chariot, O ye Asvins, moves on, covered with gold, of the colour of honey, gliding with ghee, bearing oblations.

original: manojavā aśvinā vātaraṃhā yenātiyātho duritāni viśvā //
analyzed: manaḥ javāḥ aśvinā vāta raṃhāḥ yena atiyāthaḥ duritāni viśvā
translated: O Asvins, swift as thought, swifter than the wind, wherewith ye pass over all difficulties.

original: yo bhūyiṣṭhaṃ nāsatyābhyāṃ viveṣa caniṣṭham pitvo rarate vibhāge /
analyzed: yaḥ bhūyiṣṭham nāsatyābhyām viveṣa caniṣṭham pitvaḥ rarate vibhāge
translated: He who most frequently has recourse to the Nâsatyas, best of all enjoys the last draught in the division.

original: sa tokam asya pīparac chamībhir anūrdhvabhāsaḥ sadam it tuturyāt //🔽sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī gamema /
analyzed: sa tokam asya pīparat śamībhiḥ an ūrdhva bhāsaḥ sadam id tuturyāt  sam aśvinoḥ avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā su praṇītī gamema
translated: May he, with his offspring, be satisfied with the Samis, and may he always be praised with the upward-shining (sun).🔽With the new favour of the two Ashvins, who bring bliss, may we go with their good guidance.

original: ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhagāni //
analyzed: ā naḥ rayim vahatam ā uta vīrān ā viśvāni amṛtā saubhagāni
translated: Bring to us wealth and heroes, O immortal ones, and all good things.

original: aśvināv eha gacchataṃ nāsatyā mā vi venatam /
analyzed: aśvinau ā iha gacchatam nāsatyā mā vi venatam
translated: O Ashvins, come hither, O Nâsatyas, do not turn away.

original: haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa //
analyzed: haṃsau iva patatam ā sutām upa
translated: Fly like two swans to the Soma juice.

original: aśvinā hariṇāv iva gaurāv ivānu yavasam /
analyzed: aśvinā hariṇau iva gaurau iva anu yavasam
translated: O Ashvins, like two antelopes, like two bulls to the pasture,

original: haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa //
analyzed: haṃsau iva patatam ā sutām upa
translated: Fly like two swans to the Soma juice.

original: aśvinā vājinīvasū juṣethāṃ yajñam iṣṭaye /
analyzed: aśvinā vājinīvasū juṣethām yajñam iṣṭaye
translated: O Ashvins, rich in treasure, accept the sacrifice for prosperity.

original: haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa //🔽atrir yad vām avarohann ṛbīsam ajohavīn nādhamāneva yoṣā /
analyzed: haṃsau iva patatam ā sutām upa  atriḥ yat vām avarohan ṛbīsam ajohavīt nādhamānā iva yoṣā
translated: Fly like two swans to the Soma juice.🔽When Atri, descending, called to you the Rîbhi, like a woman who is not oppressed,

original: śyenasya cij javasā nūtanenāgacchatam aśvinā śantamena //
analyzed: śyenasya cit javasā nūtanena agacchatam aśvinā śantamena
translated: Come with the fresh swiftness of a hawk, O Ashvins, with what is most delightful.

original: vi jihīṣva vanaspate yoniḥ sūṣyantyā iva /
analyzed: vi jihīṣva vanaspate yoniḥ sūṣyantyāḥ iva
translated: O tree, spread out like the womb of a woman who is about to give birth.

original: śrutam me aśvinā havaṃ saptavadhriṃ ca muñcatam //
analyzed: śrutam me aśvinā havam saptavadhrim ca muñcatam
translated: O Ashvins, hear my call and set free the one with seven ribs.

original: bhītāya nādhamānāya ṛṣaye saptavadhraye /
analyzed: bhītāya nādhamānāya ṛṣaye saptavadhraye
translated: To the frightened Rishi with seven ribs who is not oppressed,

original: māyābhir aśvinā yuvaṃ vṛkṣaṃ saṃ ca vi cācathaḥ //
analyzed: māyābhiḥ aśvinā yuvam vṛkṣam sam ca vi ca acathaḥ
translated: With your illusions, O Asvins, you shake the tree and scatter it.

original: yathā vātaḥ puṣkariṇīṃ samiṅgayati sarvataḥ /
analyzed: yathā vātaḥ puṣkariṇīm samiṅgayati sarvatas
translated: Just as the wind scatters the lotus pond from all sides,

original: evā te garbha ejatu niraitu daśamāsyaḥ //
analyzed: eva te garbhaḥ ejatu niraitu daśamāsyaḥ
translated: so let your embryo move, let the ten-month-old one come forth.

original: yathā vāto yathā vanaṃ yathā samudra ejati /
analyzed: yathā vātaḥ yathā vanam yathā samudraḥ ejati
translated: Just as the wind, just as the forest, just as the ocean moves,

original: evā tvaṃ daśamāsya sahāvehi jarāyuṇā //
analyzed: eva tvam daśamāsya saha avehi jarāyuṇā
translated: so, ten-month-old one, come forth with your caul.

original: daśa māsāñ chaśayānaḥ kumāro adhi mātari /
analyzed: daśa māsām śaśayānaḥ kumāraḥ adhi mātari
translated: The child who has lain for ten months upon the mother,

original: niraitu jīvo akṣato jīvo jīvantyā adhi //
analyzed: niraitu jīvaḥ a kṣataḥ jīvaḥ jīvantyāḥ adhi
translated: let the living one come forth unharmed, the living one from the living one.

original: mahe no adya bodhayoṣo rāye divitmatī /
analyzed: mahe naḥ adya bodhaya uṣaḥ rāye divitmatī
translated: O Uṣas, today, for great wealth, for heavenly wealth, do thou awaken us,

original: yathā cin no abodhayaḥ satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte //
analyzed: yathā cit naḥ abodhayaḥ satyaśravasi vāyye su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: as thou hast awakened us for Satyaśravas, the son of Vāya, O well-born one, O thou whose wealth is good horses.

original: yā sunīthe śaucadrathe vy auccho duhitar divaḥ /
analyzed: yā sunīthe śaucadrathe vi aucchaḥ duhitar divaḥ
translated: O thou who hast been awakened by Sunītha, the chariot-borne one, the daughter of the sky,

original: sā vy uccha sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte //
analyzed: sā vi uccha sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: do thou awaken for the most powerful one, for Satyaśravas, the son of Vāya, O well-born one, O thou whose wealth is good horses.

original: sā no adyābharadvasur vy ucchā duhitar divaḥ /
analyzed: sā naḥ adyā ābharat vasuḥ vi uccha duhitar divaḥ
translated: Do thou, O daughter of the sky, who hast brought wealth to Bharadvāja, awaken for us today,

original: yo vy aucchaḥ sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte //
analyzed: yaḥ vi aucchaḥ sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: who hast awakened for the most powerful one, for Satyaśravas, the son of Vāya, O well-born one, O thou whose wealth is good horses.

original: abhi ye tvā vibhāvari stomair gṛṇanti vahnayaḥ /
analyzed: abhi ye tvā vibhāvari stomaiḥ gṛṇanti vahnayaḥ
translated: Those who praise thee with lauds, O thou who shinest forth, O daughter of the sky,

original: maghair maghoni suśriyo dāmanvantaḥ surātayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte //
analyzed: maghaiḥ maghoni su śriyaḥ dāmanvantaḥ su rātayaḥ su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: O Ushas, rich in treasures, bountiful, bestowing fair gifts, well-born, with beautiful horses and songs,

original: yac cid dhi te gaṇā ime chadayanti maghattaye /
analyzed: yat cit hi te gaṇāḥ ime chadayanti maghattaye
translated: Even these thy bands, O Ushas, that are here, that cover (the sky), for the sake of thy bounty,

original: pari cid vaṣṭayo dadhur dadato rādho ahrayaṃ sujāte aśvasūnṛte //
analyzed: pari cit vaṣṭayaḥ dadataḥ rādhaḥ ahrayam su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: The encircling bands have placed thee, O thou who givest, as the giver of wealth, O thou who art well-born, with beautiful horses and songs.

original: aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśa uṣo maghoni sūriṣu /🔽ye no rādhāṃsy ahrayā maghavāno arāsata sujāte aśvasūnṛte //
analyzed: ā eṣu dhāḥ vīravat yaśaḥ uṣaḥ maghoni sūriṣu  ye naḥ rādhāṃsi ahrayā maghavānaḥ arāsata su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: Bestow upon these princes, O Ushas, rich in treasures, glory that is full of heroes,🔽Who, O Ushas, rich in treasures, shall be bountiful to us in gifts, O thou who art well-born, with beautiful horses and songs.

original: tebhyo dyumnam bṛhad yaśa uṣo maghony ā vaha /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ dyumnam bṛhat yaśaḥ uṣaḥ maghoni ā vaha
translated: Bring to them, O Ushas, high glory and great fame,

original: ye no rādhāṃsy aśvyā gavyā bhajanta sūrayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte //
analyzed: ye naḥ rādhāṃsi aśvyā gavyā bhajanta sūrayaḥ su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: To those princes who shall honour us with gifts of horses and cattle, O thou who art well-born, with beautiful horses and songs.

original: uta no gomatīr iṣa ā vahā duhitar divaḥ /
analyzed: uta naḥ gomatīḥ iṣaḥ ā vaha duhitar divaḥ
translated: And bring to us, O daughter of the sky, food full of cattle,

original: sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ śukraiḥ śocadbhir arcibhiḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte //
analyzed: sākam sūryasya raśmibhiḥ śukraiḥ śocadbhiḥ arcibhiḥ su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: Together with the rays of the sun, with the shining, glowing flames, O thou who art well-born, with beautiful horses and songs.

original: vy ucchā duhitar divo mā ciraṃ tanuthā apaḥ /
analyzed: vi uccha duhitar divaḥ mā ciram tanuthāḥ apaḥ
translated: Rise up, O daughter of the sky, and do not delay to spread out the waters,

original: net tvā stenaṃ yathā ripuṃ tapāti sūro arciṣā sujāte aśvasūnṛte //
analyzed: na id tvā stenam yathā ripum tapāti sūraḥ arciṣā su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: Lest the sun scorch thee with his rays as he would a thief, O thou who art well-born, with beautiful horses and songs.

original: etāvad ved uṣas tvam bhūyo vā dātum arhasi /
analyzed: etāvat vā id uṣaḥ tvam bhūyas vā dātum arhasi
translated: So much, O Ushas, thou knowest, or more than that thou art able to give.

original: yā stotṛbhyo vibhāvary ucchantī na pramīyase sujāte aśvasūnṛte //
analyzed: yā stotṛbhyaḥ vibhāvarī ucchantī na pramīyase su jāte aśva sūnṛte
translated: Thou who, rising up, art most resplendent to the praisers, and art not deceived, Well-born, O thou whose face is lovely as a horse's.

original: dyutadyāmānam bṛhatīm ṛtena ṛtāvarīm aruṇapsuṃ vibhātīm /
analyzed: dyutat yāmānam bṛhatīm ṛtena ṛtāvarīm aruṇapsum vibhātīm
translated: The radiant one, the great one, with holy power, the red-hued one, the far-shining one, the truthful one,

original: devīm uṣasaṃ svar āvahantīm prati viprāso matibhir jarante //
analyzed: devīm uṣasam svar āvahantīm prati viprāsaḥ matibhiḥ jarante
translated: The Goddess Dawn, who brings heaven, the singers with their hymns of praise attend her as she rises.

original: eṣā janaṃ darśatā bodhayantī sugān pathaḥ kṛṇvatī yāty agre /🔽bṛhadrathā bṛhatī viśvaminvoṣā jyotir yacchaty agre ahnām //
analyzed: eṣā janam darśatā bodhayantī su gān pathaḥ kṛṇvatī yāti agre  bṛhat rathā bṛhatī viśvaminvā uṣāḥ jyotiḥ yacchati agre ahnām
translated: She, showing the people, waking them, making the paths easy, goes in front.🔽The great-minded Dawn, of great strength, all-impelling, gives light in the beginning of the days.

original: eṣā gobhir aruṇebhir yujānāsredhantī rayim aprāyu cakre /
analyzed: eṣā gobhiḥ aruṇebhiḥ yujānā a sredhantī rayim aprāyu cakre
translated: She, yoking with the ruddy cows, increasing, has made ready wealth and food.

original: patho radantī suvitāya devī puruṣṭutā viśvavārā vi bhāti //
analyzed: pathaḥ radantī suvitāya devī puruṣṭutā viśva vārā vi bhāti
translated: The Goddess, making the paths easy, shines forth, much lauded, bestowing all boons.

original: eṣā vyenī bhavati dvibarhā āviṣkṛṇvānā tanvam purastāt /🔽ṛtasya panthām anv eti sādhu prajānatīva na diśo mināti //
analyzed: eṣā vyenī bhavati dvibarhāḥ āviṣkṛṇvānā tanvam purastāt  ṛtasya panthām anu eti sādhu prajānatī iva na diśaḥ mināti
translated: She, to be yoked, becomes two-fold, showing her body in front.🔽She follows the path of holy order aright, as if knowing well, she does not err in the directions.

original: eṣā śubhrā na tanvo vidānordhveva snātī dṛśaye no asthāt /
analyzed: eṣā śubhrā na tanvaḥ vidānā ūrdhvā iva snātī dṛśaye naḥ asthāt
translated: She, the bright one, having put on her garments, stands, as it were, rising up, to be seen by us.

original: apa dveṣo bādhamānā tamāṃsy uṣā divo duhitā jyotiṣāgāt //
analyzed: apa dveṣaḥ bādhamānā tamāṃsi uṣāḥ divaḥ duhitā jyotiṣā āgāt
translated: Dawn, the Daughter of the Sky, has come with light, driving away our hatreds and our darkness.

original: eṣā pratīcī duhitā divo nṝn yoṣeva bhadrā ni riṇīte apsaḥ /
analyzed: eṣā pratīcī duhitā divaḥ nṝn yoṣā iva bhadrā ni riṇīte apsaḥ
translated: This is the western daughter of the sky, like a good woman, she leads men to the waters.

original: vyūrṇvatī dāśuṣe vāryāṇi punar jyotir yuvatiḥ pūrvathākaḥ //
analyzed: vyūrṇvatī dāśuṣe vāryāṇi punar jyotiḥ yuvatiḥ pūrvathā akaḥ
translated: She who spreads out boons for the worshipper, the young maiden, the light again as before.

original: yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ /
analyzed: yuñjate manaḥ uta yuñjate dhiyaḥ viprāḥ viprasya bṛhataḥ vipaścitaḥ
translated: They yoke the mind, they yoke the thoughts, the priests of the great priest, the wise one.

original: vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ //🔽viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīd bhadraṃ dvipade catuṣpade /
analyzed: vi hotrā dadhe vayunā vid ekaḥ id mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ  viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīt bhadram dvipade catuṣpade
translated: He alone, the knower of ordinances, has assigned the priestly offices. Great is the praise of the god Savita.🔽The wise one lets loose all forms. He has brought forth good for the two-footed and the four-footed.

original: vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyo 'nu prayāṇam uṣaso vi rājati //🔽yasya prayāṇam anv anya id yayur devā devasya mahimānam ojasā /
analyzed: vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyaḥ nu prayāṇam uṣasaḥ vi rājati  yasya prayāṇam anu anye id yayuḥ devāḥ devasya mahimānam ojasā
translated: Savita, the most excellent one, has disclosed the vault. He shines along the course of the dawns.🔽After whose course the other gods have gone, the gods, after the greatness of the god (Savita) with might.

original: yaḥ pārthivāni vimame sa etaśo rajāṃsi devaḥ savitā mahitvanā //
analyzed: yaḥ pārthivāni vimame saḥ etaśaḥ rajāṃsi devaḥ savitā mahitvanā
translated: He who has measured the earthly spaces, that god Savita, by his greatness.

original: uta yāsi savitas trīṇi rocanota sūryasya raśmibhiḥ sam ucyasi /
analyzed: uta yāsi savitar trīṇi rocanā uta sūryasya raśmibhiḥ sam ucyasi
translated: And, O Savita, you go to the three lights. And you are united with the rays of the sun.

original: uta rātrīm ubhayataḥ parīyasa uta mitro bhavasi deva dharmabhiḥ //
analyzed: uta rātrīm ubhayatas parīyase uta mitraḥ bhavasi deva dharmabhiḥ
translated: And you go around the night on both sides. And, O god, you become Mitra by the laws (of truth).

original: uteśiṣe prasavasya tvam eka id uta pūṣā bhavasi deva yāmabhiḥ /
analyzed: uta īśiṣe prasavasya tvam ekaḥ id uta pūṣā bhavasi deva yāmabhiḥ
translated: And thou art the one who is appointed to the impulse, and as Pūṣan thou art the god who is to be served with offerings.

original: utedaṃ viśvam bhuvanaṃ vi rājasi śyāvāśvas te savita stomam ānaśe //
analyzed: uta idam viśvam bhuvanam vi rājasi śyāvāśvaḥ te savitaḥ stomam ānaśe
translated: And thou dost shine over this whole world. Śyāvāśva has offered praise to thee, O Savitar.

original: tat savitur vṛṇīmahe vayaṃ devasya bhojanam /
analyzed: tat savituḥ vṛṇīmahe vayam devasya bhojanam
translated: We choose that favour of the god Savitar,

original: śreṣṭhaṃ sarvadhātamaṃ turam bhagasya dhīmahi //
analyzed: śreṣṭham sarva dhātamam turam bhagasya dhīmahi
translated: The best of all, the most bountiful, the most powerful, we choose the favour of Bhaga.

original: asya hi svayaśastaraṃ savituḥ kac cana priyam /
analyzed: asya hi sva yaśastaram savituḥ kad cana priyam
translated: For this is the most famous, this is the most beloved of Savitar,

original: na minanti svarājyam //
analyzed: na minanti sva rājyam
translated: They do not diminish his own kingdom.

original: sa hi ratnāni dāśuṣe suvāti savitā bhagaḥ /
analyzed: sa hi ratnāni dāśuṣe suvāti savitā bhagaḥ
translated: For he, Savitar, the bountiful, sends treasures to the worshipper.

original: tam bhāgaṃ citram īmahe //
analyzed: tam bhāgam citram īmahe
translated: We seek that variegated portion of his.

original: adyā no deva savitaḥ prajāvat sāvīḥ saubhagam /
analyzed: adyā naḥ deva savitar prajāvat sāvīḥ saubhagam
translated: Today, O god Savitar, grant us prosperity with offspring.

original: parā duṣṣvapnyaṃ suva //
analyzed: parā duṣṣvapnyam suva
translated: Drive away evil dreams.

original: viśvāni deva savitar duritāni parā suva /
analyzed: viśvāni deva savitar duritāni parā suva
translated: O god Savitar, drive away all evils.

original: yad bhadraṃ tan na ā suva //
analyzed: yat bhadram tat naḥ ā suva
translated: Drive to us what is good.

original: anāgaso aditaye devasya savituḥ save /
analyzed: anāgasaḥ aditaye devasya savituḥ save
translated: Free from sin, for Aditi, in the impulse of the god Savitar,

original: viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi //🔽ā viśvadevaṃ satpatiṃ sūktair adyā vṛṇīmahe /
analyzed: viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi  ā viśva devam sat patim sūktaiḥ adya vṛṇīmahe
translated: We will win all good things.🔽We choose today with hymns the lord of the house, the god of all,

original: satyasavaṃ savitāram //
analyzed: satya savam savitāram
translated: Savitar, who is true to his word.

original: ya ime ubhe ahanī pura ety aprayucchan /
analyzed: yaḥ ime ubhe ahanī puras eti aprayucchan
translated: He who comes to these two days without fail,

original: svādhīr devaḥ savitā //
analyzed: svādhīḥ devaḥ savitā
translated: The self-controlled god Savitar.

original: ya imā viśvā jātāny āśrāvayati ślokena /
analyzed: yaḥ imā viśvā jātāni āśrāvayati ślokena
translated: He who proclaims all these beings with a verse,

original: pra ca suvāti savitā //
analyzed: pra ca suvāti savitā
translated: And Savitar sends forth.

original: acchā vada tavasaṃ gīrbhir ābhi stuhi parjanyaṃ namasā vivāsa /
analyzed: acchā vada tavasam gīrbhiḥ ābhiḥ stuhi parjanyam namasā vivāsa
translated: Come, speak to the mighty one with these songs, praise Parjanya with homage and seek him.

original: kanikradad vṛṣabho jīradānū reto dadhāty oṣadhīṣu garbham //
analyzed: kanikradat vṛṣabhaḥ jīra dānuḥ retaḥ dadhāti oṣadhīṣu garbham
translated: The bellowing bull, the giver of strength, places seed and embryo in the plants.

original: vi vṛkṣān hanty uta hanti rakṣaso viśvam bibhāya bhuvanam mahāvadhāt /
analyzed: vi vṛkṣān hanti uta hanti rakṣasaḥ viśvam bibhāya bhuvanam mahā vadhāt
translated: He strikes down the trees, and he strikes down the demons, all the world fears the great slaughter.

original: utānāgā īṣate vṛṣṇyāvato yat parjanya stanayan hanti duṣkṛtaḥ //
analyzed: uta anāgāḥ īṣate vṛṣṇyāvataḥ yat parjanyaḥ stanayan hanti duṣkṛtaḥ
translated: And the one who has not sinned fears the mighty one, when Parjanya, thundering, strikes down the wicked.

original: rathīva kaśayāśvāṃ abhikṣipann āvir dūtān kṛṇute varṣyāṃ aha /
analyzed: rathī iva kaśayā aśvām abhikṣipan āvis dūtān kṛṇute varṣyām aha
translated: Like a charioteer urging the horses with the whip, he sends forth the messengers of the rain.

original: dūrāt siṃhasya stanathā ud īrate yat parjanyaḥ kṛṇute varṣyaṃ nabhaḥ //
analyzed: dūrāt siṃhasya stanathau ud īrate yat parjanyaḥ kṛṇute varṣyam nabhaḥ
translated: The roars of the lion rise up from afar, when Parjanya makes the rainy cloud.

original: pra vātā vānti patayanti vidyuta ud oṣadhīr jihate pinvate svaḥ /
analyzed: pra vātāḥ vānti patayanti vidyutaḥ ud oṣadhīḥ jihate pinvate svar
translated: The winds blow, the lightning flashes, the plants grow, the heaven swells.

original: irā viśvasmai bhuvanāya jāyate yat parjanyaḥ pṛthivīṃ retasāvati //
analyzed: irā viśvasmai bhuvanāya jāyate yat parjanyaḥ pṛthivīm retasā avati
translated: Food is born for all the worlds, when Parjanya with his seed waters the earth.

original: yasya vrate pṛthivī nannamīti yasya vrate śaphavaj jarbhurīti /
analyzed: yasya vrate pṛthivī nannamīti yasya vrate śaphavat jarbhurīti
translated: In whose vow the earth bows down, in whose vow it trembles like a hoof,

original: yasya vrata oṣadhīr viśvarūpāḥ sa naḥ parjanya mahi śarma yaccha //
analyzed: yasya vrate oṣadhīḥ viśva rūpāḥ sa naḥ parjanya mahi śarma yaccha
translated: Whose are the plants of every form, do thou, O Parjanya, grant us great protection.

original: divo no vṛṣṭim maruto rarīdhvam pra pinvata vṛṣṇo aśvasya dhārāḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ naḥ vṛṣṭim marutaḥ rarīdhvam pra pinvata vṛṣṇaḥ aśvasya dhārāḥ
translated: O Maruts, send down rain from heaven; make the streams of the strong horse flow.

original: arvāṅ etena stanayitnunehy apo niṣiñcann asuraḥ pitā naḥ //🔽abhi kranda stanaya garbham ā dhā udanvatā pari dīyā rathena /
analyzed: arvāṅ etena stanayitnunā ihi apaḥ niṣiñcan asuraḥ pitā naḥ  abhi kranda stanaya garbham ā dhāḥ udanvatā pari dīya rathena
translated: Come hither with this thunder, O Asura, our father, pouring down the waters.🔽Roar, thunder, bring the germ; go round in a chariot with the water.

original: dṛtiṃ su karṣa viṣitaṃ nyañcaṃ samā bhavantūdvato nipādāḥ //🔽mahāntaṃ kośam ud acā ni ṣiñca syandantāṃ kulyā viṣitāḥ purastāt /
analyzed: dṛtim su karṣa viṣitam nyañcam samāḥ bhavantu udvataḥ nipādāḥ  mahāntam kośam ud aca ni siñca syandantām kulyāḥ viṣitāḥ purastāt
translated: Draw the stretched-out skin, the inclined one; let the high places and the low places be even.🔽Fill up the great vessel; let the streams flow out in front, extended.

original: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī vy undhi suprapāṇam bhavatv aghnyābhyaḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī vi undhi su prapāṇam bhavatu aghnyābhyaḥ
translated: Open heaven and earth with ghee; let there be good drinking for the cows.

original: yat parjanya kanikradat stanayan haṃsi duṣkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yat parjanya kanikradat stanayan haṃsi duṣkṛtaḥ
translated: When, O Parjanya, thundering and roaring, thou smitest the wicked,

original: pratīdaṃ viśvam modate yat kiṃ ca pṛthivyām adhi //🔽avarṣīr varṣam ud u ṣū gṛbhāyākar dhanvāny atyetavā u /
analyzed: prati idam viśvam modate yat kim ca pṛthivyām adhi  avarṣīḥ varṣam ud u su gṛbhāya akaḥ dhanvāni atyetavai u
translated: Then all this world rejoices in it, whatever is upon the earth.🔽Thou hast rained rain; thou hast lifted up the cloud; thou hast passed over the dry places.

original: ajījana oṣadhīr bhojanāya kam uta prajābhyo 'vido manīṣām //
analyzed: ajījanaḥ oṣadhīḥ bhojanāya kam uta prajābhyaḥ vidaḥ manīṣām
translated: Thou hast brought forth the plants for food; and hast given wisdom to the people.

original: baḷ itthā parvatānāṃ khidram bibharṣi pṛthivi /
analyzed: baḷ itthā parvatānām khidram bibharṣi pṛthivi
translated: So, O Earth, thou bearest the dust of the mountains.

original: pra yā bhūmim pravatvati mahnā jinoṣi mahini //
analyzed: pra yā bhūmim pravatvati mahnā jinoṣi mahini
translated: Thou, O mighty one, with thy greatness dost overcome the earth.

original: stomāsas tvā vicāriṇi prati ṣṭobhanty aktubhiḥ /🔽pra yā vājaṃ na heṣantam perum asyasy arjuni //
analyzed: stomāsaḥ tvā vicāriṇi prati stobhanti aktubhiḥ  pra yā vājam na heṣantam perum asyasi arjuni
translated: The hymns of praise, O thou who art to be praised, resound to thee with their voices.🔽Thou, O thou who hast a swift horse, dost send forth the steed who neighs as he wins the prize.

original: dṛḷhā cid yā vanaspatīn kṣmayā dardharṣy ojasā /
analyzed: dṛḍhā cit yā vanaspatīn kṣmayā dardharṣi ojasā
translated: Thou dost shake even the firm trees with thy might.

original: yat te abhrasya vidyuto divo varṣanti vṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: yat te abhrasya vidyutaḥ divaḥ varṣanti vṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: When from thy cloud, thy lightning, the rain-showers of heaven are poured down.

original: pra samrāje bṛhad arcā gabhīram brahma priyaṃ varuṇāya śrutāya /
analyzed: pra samrāje bṛhat arcā gabhīram brahma priyam varuṇāya śrutāya
translated: To the great king, the far-famed, to Varuṇa the beloved deep prayer is offered.

original: vi yo jaghāna śamiteva carmopastire pṛthivīṃ sūryāya //
analyzed: vi yaḥ jaghāna śamitā iva carma upastire pṛthivīm sūryāya
translated: He who, like a feller with an axe, has cut asunder the earth and spread it out for Surya.

original: vaneṣu vy antarikṣaṃ tatāna vājam arvatsu paya usriyāsu /🔽hṛtsu kratuṃ varuṇo apsv agniṃ divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau //
analyzed: vaneṣu vi antarikṣam tatāna vājam arvatsu payaḥ usriyāsu  hṛtsu kratum varuṇaḥ apsu agnim divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau
translated: He has stretched out the atmosphere in the woods, and the food in the horses and the milk in the cows.🔽Varuṇa has placed in the heart the will, in the waters the fire, in the heaven the sun, and the Soma on the mountain.

original: nīcīnabāraṃ varuṇaḥ kavandham pra sasarja rodasī antarikṣam /
analyzed: nīcīna bāram varuṇaḥ kabandham pra sasarja rodasī antarikṣam
translated: Varuṇa has let loose the tree with its branches turned downwards, the sky, the earth, and the atmosphere.

original: tena viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā yavaṃ na vṛṣṭir vy unatti bhūma //
analyzed: tena viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā yavam na vṛṣṭiḥ vi unatti bhūma
translated: By that he, the king of the whole world, as the rain the corn, causes to grow the earth.

original: unatti bhūmim pṛthivīm uta dyāṃ yadā dugdhaṃ varuṇo vaṣṭy ād it /
analyzed: unatti bhūmim pṛthivīm uta dyām yadā dugdham varuṇaḥ vaṣṭi āt id
translated: He lifts up the earth and the sky, when Varuna milks the dug out (earth).

original: sam abhreṇa vasata parvatāsas taviṣīyantaḥ śrathayanta vīrāḥ //
analyzed: sam abhreṇa vasata parvatāsaḥ taviṣīyantaḥ śrathayanta vīrāḥ
translated: The mountains dwell together with the cloud, the heroes, striving with might, break through.

original: imām ū ṣv āsurasya śrutasya mahīm māyāṃ varuṇasya pra vocam /
analyzed: imām u su āsurasya śrutasya mahīm māyām varuṇasya pra vocam
translated: I will proclaim to you this great illusion of the Asura, of the heard Varuna.

original: māneneva tasthivāṃ antarikṣe vi yo mame pṛthivīṃ sūryeṇa //
analyzed: mānena iva tasthivān antarikṣe vi yaḥ mame pṛthivīm sūryeṇa
translated: He stands in the atmosphere as if with a measure, he who separates the earth with the sun.

original: imām ū nu kavitamasya māyām mahīṃ devasya nakir ā dadharṣa /
analyzed: imām u nu kavitamasya māyām mahīm devasya nakir ā dadharṣa
translated: No one at all can withstand this great illusion of the divine creator.

original: ekaṃ yad udnā na pṛṇanty enīr āsiñcantīr avanayaḥ samudram //
analyzed: ekam yat udnā na pṛṇanti enīḥ āsiñcantīḥ avanayaḥ samudram
translated: When the dark-colored waters do not fill him, as they pour down, the streams into the ocean.

original: aryamyaṃ varuṇa mitryaṃ vā sakhāyaṃ vā sadam id bhrātaraṃ vā /
analyzed: aryamyam varuṇa mitryam vā sakhāyam vā sadam id bhrātaram vā
translated: Whether it be the favor of Varuna, or the favor of Mitra, or the favor of a friend, or of a brother always,

original: veśaṃ vā nityaṃ varuṇāraṇaṃ vā yat sīm āgaś cakṛmā śiśrathas tat //
analyzed: veśam vā nityam varuṇa araṇam vā yat sīm āgaḥ cakṛma śiśrathaḥ tat
translated: Or the favor of a kinsman, or the favor of a guest, whatever transgression we have committed, loosen that for us, O Varuna.

original: kitavāso yad riripur na dīvi yad vā ghā satyam uta yan na vidma /
analyzed: kitavāsaḥ yat riripuḥ na dīvi yat vā gha satyam uta yat na vidma
translated: Whatever we have done in gambling, in enmity, in the assembly, or in truth, or what we do not know,

original: sarvā tā vi ṣya śithireva devādhā te syāma varuṇa priyāsaḥ //
analyzed: sarvā tā vi sya śithirā iva deva adha te syāma varuṇa priyāsaḥ
translated: All that, O gods, do you loosen, as if loose. May we be dear to you, O Varuna.

original: indrāgnī yam avatha ubhā vājeṣu martyam /
analyzed: indra agnī yam avatha ubhā vājeṣu martyam
translated: O Indra and Agni, him whom you two support in battles, the mortal,

original: dṛḷhā cit sa pra bhedati dyumnā vāṇīr iva tritaḥ //
analyzed: dṛḷhā cit sa pra bhedati dyumnā vāṇīḥ iva tritaḥ
translated: He breaks through even the firm, like Trita through the walls of sound.

original: yā pṛtanāsu duṣṭarā yā vājeṣu śravāyyā /
analyzed: yā pṛtanāsu duṣṭarā yā vājeṣu śravāyyā
translated: The one who is most invincible in battles, most renowned in contests for booty,

original: yā pañca carṣaṇīr abhīndrāgnī tā havāmahe //
analyzed: yā pañca carṣaṇīḥ abhi indra agnī tā havāmahe
translated: who rules over the five peoples, Indra and Agni, we invoke them.

original: tayor id amavac chavas tigmā didyun maghonoḥ /
analyzed: tayoḥ id amavat śavaḥ tigmā didyut maghonoḥ
translated: The sharp thunderbolt of those two mighty ones, Indra and Agni, is indeed terrible.

original: prati druṇā gabhastyor gavāṃ vṛtraghna eṣate //
analyzed: prati druṇā gabhastyoḥ gavām vṛtra ghne eṣate
translated: The Vṛtra-slayer seeks to win the cattle with the shaft and the hand.

original: tā vām eṣe rathānām indrāgnī havāmahe /
analyzed: tā vām eṣe rathānām indra agnī havāmahe
translated: We invoke you, O Indra and Agni, for the sake of your chariots,

original: patī turasya rādhaso vidvāṃsā girvaṇastamā //🔽tā vṛdhantāv anu dyūn martāya devāv adabhā /
analyzed: patī turasya rādhasaḥ vidvāṃsā girvaṇastamā  tā vṛdhantau anu dyūn martāya devau adabhā
translated: the lords of swift bounty, the most wise, the most devoted to the songs.🔽May those two, the gods, for the mortal who serves them, increase day by day.

original: arhantā cit puro dadhe 'ṃśeva devāv arvate //
analyzed: arhantā cit puras dadhe ṃśā iva devau arvate
translated: Even the worthy ones place you in the front, as if the gods were in the share of the horse.

original: evendrāgnibhyām ahāvi havyaṃ śūṣyaṃ ghṛtaṃ na pūtam adribhiḥ /
analyzed: eva indra agnibhyām ahāvi havyam śūṣyam ghṛtam na pūtam adribhiḥ
