translated: Thus, for Indra and Agni, the oblation, the offering, the ghee purified with stones,

original: tā sūriṣu śravo bṛhad rayiṃ gṛṇatsu didhṛtam iṣaṃ gṛṇatsu didhṛtam //
analyzed: tā sūriṣu śravaḥ bṛhat rayim gṛṇatsu didhṛtam iṣam gṛṇatsu didhṛtam
translated: may they bestow great fame among the princes, wealth upon the singers, food upon the singers.

original: pra vo mahe matayo yantu viṣṇave marutvate girijā evayāmarut /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe matayaḥ yantu viṣṇave marutvate giri jāḥ eva yā marut
translated: May your thoughts go forth to the great Viṣṇu, to the Marut-attended one, the mountain-born one, the follower of the Maruts.

original: pra śardhāya prayajyave sukhādaye tavase bhandadiṣṭaye dhunivratāya śavase //
analyzed: pra śardhāya prayajyave su khādaye tavase bhandat iṣṭaye dhuni vratāya śavase
translated: To the impetuous one, the well-worshipped one, the one who delights in good things, to the strong one, to the one whose desire is to be praised, to the one with shaking vows, to the strength.

original: pra ye jātā mahinā ye ca nu svayam pra vidmanā bruvata evayāmarut /
analyzed: pra ye jātāḥ mahinā ye ca nu svayam pra vidmanā bruvate eva yā marut
translated: Those who are born great in might, and who are of themselves, we know, O ye E vāyus, to be the Br̥ihatis.

original: kratvā tad vo maruto nādhṛṣe śavo dānā mahnā tad eṣām adhṛṣṭāso nādrayaḥ //
analyzed: kratvā tat vaḥ marutaḥ na ādhṛṣe śavaḥ dānā mahnā tat eṣām adhṛṣṭāsaḥ na adrayaḥ
translated: That power of yours, O Maruts, I dare not praise in thought, in bounty, in greatness: their wrath is irresistible like a rock.

original: pra ye divo bṛhataḥ śṛṇvire girā suśukvānaḥ subhva evayāmarut /
analyzed: pra ye divaḥ bṛhataḥ śṛṇvire girā su śukvānaḥ su bhvaḥ eva yā marut
translated: Those who have listened from the lofty heaven to the song, the well-praised, the mighty, O ye E vāyus.

original: na yeṣām irī sadhastha īṣṭa āṃ agnayo na svavidyutaḥ pra syandrāso dhunīnām //
analyzed: na yeṣām sadhasthe īṣṭe ām agnayaḥ na sva vidyutaḥ pra syandrāsaḥ dhunīnām
translated: Whose dwelling-place is not on earth, whose fires are not their own light, whose reins are the streams, whose charioteers are the clouds.

original: sa cakrame mahato nir urukramaḥ samānasmāt sadasa evayāmarut /
analyzed: sa cakrame mahataḥ niḥ uru kramaḥ samānasmāt sadasaḥ eva yā marut
translated: He hath strode forth from the great, the wide-stepping one, from the same seat, O ye E vāyus.

original: yadāyukta tmanā svād adhi ṣṇubhir viṣpardhaso vimahaso jigāti śevṛdho nṛbhiḥ //🔽svano na vo 'mavān rejayad vṛṣā tveṣo yayis taviṣa evayāmarut /🔽yenā sahanta ṛñjata svarociṣa sthāraśmāno hiraṇyayāḥ svāyudhāsa iṣmiṇaḥ //
analyzed: yadā ayukta tmanā svāt adhi snubhiḥ viṣpardhasaḥ vimahasaḥ jigāti śevṛdhaḥ nṛbhiḥ  svanaḥ na vaḥ mavān rejayat vṛṣā tveṣaḥ yayiḥ taviṣaḥ eva yā marut  yena sahantaḥ ṛñjata sva rociṣaḥ sthā raśmānaḥ hiraṇyayāḥ su āyudhāsaḥ iṣmiṇaḥ
translated: When he hath gone forth from himself, from his own place, with the swift ones, the contending, the mighty, the prosperous, with men.

original: apāro vo mahimā vṛddhaśavasas tveṣaṃ śavo 'vatv evayāmarut /
analyzed: apāraḥ vaḥ mahimā vṛddha śavasaḥ tveṣam śavaḥ vatu eva yā marut
translated: Your own, O ye E vāyus, is the youthful, the shaking, the mighty, the impetuous, the strong.🔽By whom the self-shining, the far-reaching, the golden, the swift, the well-wrought, the mighty, the strong, the impetuous, the self-shining, the far-reaching, the golden, the swift, the well-wrought, the mighty, the strong, the impetuous, the self-shining, the far-reaching, the golden, the swift, the well-wrought, the mighty, the strong, the impetuous, the self-shining, the far-reaching, the golden, the swift, the well-wrought, the mighty, the strong, the impetuous, the self-shining, the far-reaching, the golden, the swift, the well-wrought, the mighty, the strong, the impetuous, the self-shining, the far-reaching, the golden, the swift, the well-wrought, the mighty, the strong, the impetuous, the self-shining, the far-reaching, the golden, the swift, the well-wrought, the mighty, the strong, the impetuous, the self-shining, the far-reaching, the golden, the swift, the well-wrought, the mighty, the strong, the impetuous, the self-shining, the far-reaching, the golden, the swift, the well-wrought, the mighty, the strong, the impetuous, the self-shining, the far-reaching

original: sthātāro hi prasitau saṃdṛśi sthana te na uruṣyatā nidaḥ śuśukvāṃso nāgnayaḥ //
analyzed: sthātāraḥ hi prasitau saṃdṛśi sthana te naḥ uruṣyata nidaḥ śuśukvāṃsaḥ nā agnayaḥ
translated: For they, the supporters, are seen standing in the two worlds. They, the swift ones, do not endure the curse like the fires.

original: te rudrāsaḥ sumakhā agnayo yathā tuvidyumnā avantv evayāmarut /
analyzed: te rudrāsaḥ su makhāḥ agnayaḥ yathā tuvi dyumnāḥ avantu eva yā marut
translated: Those Rudras, the well-sacrificed ones, like the fires, being very radiant, may they protect the Yavakrit.

original: dīrgham pṛthu paprathe sadma pārthivaṃ yeṣām ajmeṣv ā mahaḥ śardhāṃsy adbhutainasām //
analyzed: dīrgham pṛthu paprathe sadma pārthivam yeṣām ajmeṣu ā mahaḥ śardhāṃsi adbhuta enasām
translated: The abode of the earth has been spread out long and wide by them, in whose paths are the great wonderful hosts of the violent ones.

original: adveṣo no maruto gātum etana śrotā havaṃ jaritur evayāmarut /
analyzed: a dveṣaḥ naḥ marutaḥ gātum etana śrota havam jarituḥ eva yā marut
translated: O Maruts, come to us with a path free from hatred. May the Yavakrit listen to the call of the worshipper.

original: viṣṇor mahaḥ samanyavo yuyotana smad rathyo na daṃsanāpa dveṣāṃsi sanutaḥ //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ mahaḥ samanyavaḥ yuyotana smat rathyaḥ na daṃsanā apa dveṣāṃsi sanutar
translated: O you who are of the same mind as Vishnu, ward off our hostilities, like a good charioteer the shafts.

original: gantā no yajñaṃ yajñiyāḥ suśami śrotā havam arakṣa evayāmarut /
analyzed: ganta naḥ yajñam yajñiyāḥ suśami śrota havam arakṣaḥ eva yā marut
translated: May the worshipful ones, easy to invoke, come to our sacrifice, and the protector listen to the call, O Yavakrit.

original: jyeṣṭhāso na parvatāso vyomani yūyaṃ tasya pracetasaḥ syāta durdhartavo nidaḥ //
analyzed: jyeṣṭhāsaḥ na parvatāsaḥ vyomani yūyam tasya pracetasaḥ syāta durdhartavaḥ nidaḥ
translated: The highest ones, like mountains, in the sky, may you be the wise ones of him, the difficult to bear curses.
